The Mujeres Trabajodores (“Working Women”) committee was formed thanks to the efforts of a member of Mujeres Luchadores (“Fighting Women”) committee. After an informative discussion about what the Women’s Committee of Fundacion Paraguayan offered, and thus motivated, a group of neighbourhood women formed the Mujeres Trabajodores Group.

Currently, the committee has 18 members and is in its second programme cycle. Each member is engaged in various economic activities. Therefore each member will invest the money provided by the loan agreement in the business that she operates.

For example, Claudia V., Fany T. Maria Diaz, Myriam Leguizamón Elizabeth and Mary Sabina S. will invest in the purchase of fabrics, yarns, etc. Elena L. will invest in the purchase of flour, candies, eggs, etc. Jorgelina S. will invest in the purchase of nail polish, nail polish remover, and hair straightener. Fatima E., Z. Norma Gonzalez, Maria De Jesus V., Mariza V. and Mercedes Páez will invest in the purchase of clothing items such as t-shirts, blouses and overalls. Mercedes Dominguez A. and Celsa Gomez will invest in the purchase of bananas, apples, oranges, pears, and pineapples. Carmen Dominguez A. will invest in the purchase "menudencias” or edible organ meat of cows and chickens, such as heart, liver, kidney, etc. Rosa L. will invest in purchasing wigs. Elva Graciela R. will invest in buying shoes, shoe glue, shoe nails, etc. Pascuala Herminia R. will invest in the purchase of meat, oil, small cakes, bases for pies, and napkins. Liliana C. will invest in the purchase of iron grills.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

El comité “Mujeres Trabajadoras” se formó gracias a una integrante del comité “mujeres luchadoras”. Esta integrante invito a su hermana a una charla informativa sobre el programa comité de mujeres que ofrece Fundación Paraguaya. Motivada por la idea reunió a un grupo de vecinas y así se formo el grupo “mujeres trabajadoras”.

Actualmente el comité está conformado por 18 integrantes y se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa. Cada integrante se dedica a diversas actividades económicas. Entonces cada una de ellas invertirá el dinero otorgado por el crédito de acuerdo a los negocios que manejan. Por ejemplo: Claudia V., María Fany T. Díaz, Myriam Elizabeth Leguizamón y María Sabina S. invertirán en la compra de telas, hilos, etc.

Elena L. invertirá en la compra de harina, dulces, huevos, entre otros. Jorgelina S. invertirá en la compra de esmaltes, quita esmalte, planchita (alizador) para cabello. Fátima E., Norma Z. González, María De Jesús V. , Mariza V. y MercedesPáez invertirán en la compra de ropas: remeras, blusas, short, buzos.

Mercedes D. A. y Celsa G. invertirán en la compra de bananas, manzanas, naranjas, peras, piñas. Carmen A. de D. invertirá en la compra de menudencias. Rosa L. invertirá en la compra de cabellos para extensiones. Elva Graciela R. invertirá en la compra de zapatos, cola de zapatero, clavos, etc. Pascuala Herminia R. invertirá en la compra de carnes, aceite, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas. Liliana C. invertirá en la compra de hierros.

loans.use: Purchase of items for hairdressing business, textiles, yarns, food ingredients such as sugar, fruits, vegetables, canned foods, soft drinks, eggs, meat, flour, clothes for women, men and children, among other items.

loans.name: Catarino

texts.es:
Catarino started the business several years ago. He worked as a bricklayer but earned very little and injured his arms due to the strength that was required. He started his own business because it requires less physical strength and he earns a little more money with which he is progressing little by little. He works selling clothing and kitchen utenciles in the markets that move from place to place. He started in 1992 with limited resources, selling very few items.

Now he requires a loan for US$975, which he plans to repay in six months, to buy merchandise for the busy season that is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Catarino inició el negocio hace varios años trabajo como albañil, pero ganaba muy poco y estuvo lastimado de los brazos con el esfuerzo que se requería, por lo que emprendio un negocio propio ya que requiere menos esfuerzo fisico y le deja un poco mas de dinero, con el cual vamos progresando poco a poco, se dedica la venta de ropa y utensilios de cocina en los mercados rodantes, comenzó en el año 1992, con escasos recursos, vendiendo pocos articulos.

Ahora requiere un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de mercancías para la temporada que se acerca de altas ventas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
María started the business because years ago she helped a neighbor to sell clothes in the small market. Since things went well for her neighbor, one day she decided to establish her own business selling used clothing out of economic necessity. Her husband had little work and with what the neighbor with whom she was working paid her, there wasn’t enough to cover household expenses. She started 10 years ago selling clothing and at first she sold very few articles, only men’s and women’s slacks. Little by little she gained a better clientele because she offered good quality and to this day has continued to add more variety of clothing. She now sells almost all types of clothes and has frequent clients.

She needs a loan for US$600, which she plans to repay in six months, to offer clothing that’s in season. With your help María will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria inició el negocio porque años atrás le ayudaba a una vecina a vender ropa en el mercadito y como le iba muy bien un día decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de ropa de medio uso, ante la necesidad economica ya que su esposo tenía poco trabajo y con lo que le daba la vecina con la que ella trabajaba no se completaban para los gastos de la casa. Comenzó hace 10 años con la venta de ropa, primero vendía muy pocas prendas, solo pantalones de hombre y mujer, poco a poco fue teniendo mayor clientela porque surtía ropa buena y cada vez iba metiendo mas variedad de ropa, hast la fecha que ya vende de casi todos los tipos de ropa, y tienen clientes frecuentes

. Ella necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir ropa de temporada.Con tu ayuda Maria saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing

loans.name: Progresando Alcohuillca Group

texts.es:
The Community Bank “Alcohuillca Progressing” is a young bank which is beginning its second cycle with thirteen members. The members are all from the community of Alcohuillca in the district of Iguain, around one hour from the town of Ayacucho.

The members are engaged in different businesses such as fruit-selling, raising suckling-pigs, groceries, livestock raising and offer services such as carpentry. They are also engaged in agriculture.

The members need different amounts of loans: some of 300 sols, some of 600 sols and some of 900 sols, making a total of 6 900 sols in loans from the Community Bank.

The loans will be invested in the purchase of oranges, bananas, mandarins, apples, suckling-pigs, wood, rice, sugar, noodles and young animals.

The dreams of the members are to have a house in Ayacucho town, to provide their children with good educations and to see their businesses prosper.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Banco Comunal Progresando Alcohuillca es un Banco joven que inicia su segundo ciclo con 13 socios. Las socias son provenientes de la comunidad de Alcohuillca, distrito de Iguain que esta ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como venta de frutas, cochinilla, abarrotes, ganado, brindan servicios de carpintería y también se dedican a agricultura.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de préstamos, algunos montos son de 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total de 6,900 soles de préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra de naranja, plátano, mandarina, manzanas, cochinilla, madera, arroz, azúcar, fideo y animales menores.

Los sueños de las socias son tener una casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y que sus negocios prosperen.

loans.use: The loans will be invested in the purchase of oranges, bananas, mandarins, apples, suckling-pigs, wood, rice, sugar, noodles and young animals.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nacer Group

texts.es:
The Community Bank Nacer is a bank which has recently been established with 16 founding members. All of them are from different suburbs of the town of Ayacucho.

The members are engaged in different businesses, such as the sale of cereal grains, young animals, groceries, meat, cosmetics, clothes: they also offer services such as Comestic treatments and preparing natural juices.

The members need varying amounts of money to be loaned: some loans are for 300, 600, and 900 sols, making a total of 7800 sols in loans from the Community Bank.

The loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, flour, eggs, various fruits, wheat, barley, clothes and cosmetics.

The members dream of expanding their businesses, having stable employment, their own houses and seeing their children become professionals.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Banco Comunal Nacer es un Banco que recién inicia con 16 socias. Todas ellas son D. distintos barrios D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como venta D. cereales, animales menores, abarrotes, carne, cosméticos, ropa, también brindan servicios D. cosmetología y preparación D. jugos naturales.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 7,800 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, harina, huevo, frutas variadas, trigo, cebada, ropa y cosméticos.

Los sueños D. las socias ampliar sus negocios, tener un local estable, casa propia y sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: The loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, flour, eggs, various fruits, wheat, barley, clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Julia Juana

texts.es:
Julia is a member of the Community Bank Gracias Morenita.

Julia is married: she is 53 years old, and has 5 children. Julia is a native of the community of Cacamarca, in the district of Ocros. Julia sells groceries and coca leaves at her community fair, and buys cereal grains in her village to sell later in the markets of Ayacucho. Additionally, Julia cultivates various different grains herself.

Julia needs a loan of 3000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of maize and wheat.

The dreams of Julia are to have a car in order to transport her products, to construct a second floor on her house and to see her son a University graduate.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Gracias Morenita.

Julia es casada, tiene 53 años y 5 hijos, Julia es natural D. L. comunidad D. Cacamarca, distrito D. Ocros, Julia venD. abarrotes, hojas D. coca en L. feria D. su comunidad, y compra cereales en su pueblo que posteriormente venD. en los mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Julia se dedica a L. agricultura D. diferentes cereales.

Julia necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. maíz y trigo.

Los sueños D. Julia son tener un carro para transportar sus productos, construir L. segunda planta D. su casa y que su hijo se titule.

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 3000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of maize and wheat.

loans.name: Justina's Group

texts.es:
Modesta, Justina and Maria are members of the Community Bank of Santa Bárbara: the members are from the community of the same name which belongs to the District of Tambillos which is 30 minutes from the town of Ayacucho.

Modesta is a single mother: she is 41 years old, and has two children. Modesta travels to the fairs in the region selling fruits and buying cereal grains which she then processes and sells in the markets of Ayacucho. In addition, Modesta raises guinea-pigs.

Justina is also a single mother, aged 48 and with one daughter. Justina travels to different regional fairs where she sells various types of fruit and purchases cereals which she then sells in the markets in Ayacucho town. Additionally, Justina raises young animals for livestock.

Meanwhile Maria is also a single mother, aged 33 and with one daughter. Maria has a grocery store she runs from her house: additionally she raises young animals for livestock.

Modesta, Justina and Maria need loans of 600, 1000 and 1500 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley, broad beans, peas and guinea-pigs for fattening.

Modesta, Justina and Maria dream of being able to educate their children, increase their capital, and have a large barn and recreation area.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Modesta, Justina y Maria son socias del Banco Comunal Santa Bárbara, las socias son de la comunidad del mismo nombre que pertenece al Distrito de Tambillos que queda a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Modesta es madre soltera, tiene 41 años y 2 hijos, Modesta viaja a las ferias de la región donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que luego procesa y vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Modesta se dedica a la crianza de cuyes.

Por otro lado Justina es madre soltera, tiene 48 años y 1 hija, Justina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región donde vende frutas variadas y de las ferias compra cereales que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Justina se dedica a crianza de animales menores.

Mientras que Maria es madre soltera, tiene 33 años y 1 hija, Maria tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, además se dedica a la crianza de animales menores.

Modesta, Justina y Maria necesitan prestamos de 600 soles, 1000 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada. Haba, arveja, cuyes para engorde.

Los sueños de Modesta, Justina y Maria son educar a sus hijos, incrementar su capital, tener un recreo y un galpón más grande.

loans.use: Modesta, Justina and Maria need loans of 600, 1000 and 1500 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley, broad beans, peas and guinea-pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Agustina's Group

texts.es:
Susana, Agustina and Paulina are members of the Commercial Bank of Santa Bárbara: the members are from the community of the same name which belongs to the District of Tambillos which is located 30 minutes from the town of Ayacucho.

Sausana is married: she is 47 years old and has 8 children. Agustina is a widow, aged 44 and with 3 children. Susana and Agustina travel to fairs where they sell fruits and buy cereal grains which they sell in the town markets of Ayacucho.

Meanwhile, Paulina is married, aged fifty and has four children. Paulina sells vegetables which she sells in the market of Las Américas.

Susana, Agustina and Paulina need loans of 600, 450 and 900 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley, maize, fruits and vegetables.

Susana, Agustina and Paulina dream of having stable employment, improving their business and providing their children with a good education.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Susana, Agustina y Paulina son socias del Banco Comunal Santa Bárbara, las socias son D. la comunidad del mismo nombre que pertenece al Distrito D. Tambillos que queda a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Susana es casada, tiene 47 años y 8 hijos, por otro lado Agustina es viuda, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos. Susana y Agustina viajan a las ferias donD. venD. frutas y D. las ferias compra cereales que venD. en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Mientras que Paulina es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Paulina venD. verduras que venD. en el mercado Las Américas.

Susana, Agustina y Paulina necesita prestamos D. 600 soles, 450 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo, cebada, maíz, frutas y verduras.

Los sueños D. Susana, Agustina y Paulina son tener un puesto estable, mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Susana, Agustina and Paulina need loans of 600, 450 and 900 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley, maize, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Thi Tham

texts.vi:
Mrs C. Thị Thắm is the group leader. She and the other members request a loan of 2.006.000 VND each. She collects/sells waste material. She also weaves silk. Her husband is a laborer. She likes SEDA's program because she can pay back in installments. She wishes to remain with SEDA for a long time.
- Mrs Trương Thanh Tâm sells waste material and weaves silk as well .
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Nghiên sells waste materia.
- Mrs sells basic goods at the market .
- Mrs Ngô Thị Cát weaves silk .

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị C. Thị Thắm (MS: 09050073). Chị Thắm làm nghề buôn bán phế liệu, chồng chị làm thuê. Ngoài công việc đi buôn bán phế liệu chị còn làm tơ tằm. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ mua bán phế liệu. Chị rất thích được trả góp và mong muốn được tham gia chương trình lâu dài. Chị Trương Thanh Tâm (MS: 09050074), chị vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ mua bán phế liệu và tơ tằm. Chị Nguyễn Thị Nghiên (MS: 09050075), vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn đi mua phế liệu. Chị Nguyễn Thị Duyên (MS: 09050076), vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn đi buôn bán ở chợ. Cô Ngô Thị Cát (MS: 09050076), vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn đi buôn bán tơ tằm.

loans.use: collects waste material

loans.name: Thi Sau

texts.vi:
Mrs Ngô Thị Sáu is 38 years old. She's the group leader, everyone is requesting 2.006.000 VND. She has 2 children who still go to school. She raises silkworms and weaves silk. She likes SEDA program and wishes to remain with SEDA for a while.
- Mrs Chu Thị Hiền is 31 years old. She raises silkworms and weaves silk .
- Mrs Ngô Thị Du is 29 years old. She raises silkworms .
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Sữ is 55 years old. She needs the money to buy merchandise for her clothing store. .
- Mrs Chu Thị Thời is 33 years old. She needs the money to start a business: raise silkworms .

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Sáu (MS: 09050078), năm nay 38 tuổi. Chị làm nghề sản xuất tơ tằm, chị có hai con đang đi học. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn chăn nuôi tằm và làm tơ. Chị rất thích vay trả góp và mong muốn tham gia chương trình lâu dài. Chị Chu Thị Hiền (MS: 09050079), năm nay 31 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn chăn nuôi tằm và làm tơ. Chị Ngô Thị Du (MS: 09050080), năm nay 29 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để buôn bán tơ tằm. Cô Nguyễn Thị Sữ (MS: 09050081), năm nay 55 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy hàng quần áo bán. Chị Chu Thị Thời (MS: 09050082), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn chăn nuôi tằm.

loans.use: raise silkworms

loans.name: Thi Thuy

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị Thúy (MS: 050029), 43 years old, has two school aged children. She, with her group, already had one loan which successfully paid off. Her family’s income is 100,000VND a day. She said she liked loan that has weekly payment plan. She is applying for a loan of 2,242,000VND to fund her pork stand at the open market. Her group has 6 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Lê Thị Hoàn (MS: 050030) applies for a loan to raise pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Ninh (MS: 050031) applies for a loan to fund her pork stand.
  • Nguyễn Thị Mỳ (MS: 050032) applies for a loan to raise pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thục (MS: 050034) applies for a loan to raise pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Dung (MS: 050035) applies for a loan to raise pigs.
  • Đặng Thị Chinh (MS: 050050) applies for a loan to fund her pork stand.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Trần Thị Thúy (MS: 050029), năm nay 43 tuổi. Cô có hai con còn đang đi học. Cô cung với cả nhóm đã vay được 1 chu kỳ và đã hoàn trả xong. Mức thu nhập của gia đình cô là 100.000/ngày. Cô rất thích trả dần hàng tuần. Cô vay 2.242.000 để lấy vốn buôn bán thịt lợn ở chợ. Chị Lê Thị Hoàn (MS: 050030), vay 2.242.000 VND lấy vốn chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Ninh (MS: 050031), vay 2.242.000 VND đi chợ buôn bán thịt lợn Chị Nguyễn Thị Mỳ (MS: 050032), vay 2.242.000 VND chăn nuôi lợn Chị Nguyễn Thị Thục (MS: 050034), vay 2.242.000 VND chăn nuôi lợn Chị Nguyễn Thị Dung (MS: 050035), vay 2.242.000 VND chăn nuôi lợn Chị Đặng Thị Chinh (MS: 050050), vay 2.006.000 VND đi chợ buôn bán thịt lợn

loans.use: to invest in businesses

loans.name: Thi Kim Cuc

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vũ Thị Kim Cúc (MS: 01020008), 42 years old, has two small children. She is a kindergarten teacher who also owns a small grocery store. Her husband runs some small business. The family’s income is 300,000VND a week. She would like to take out a loan of 2,006,000VND to invest in her store. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Nghiêm Thị Thân (MS: 11020009) applies for a loan to feed for pigs.
  • Nguyên Thị Được (MS: 11020010) applies for a loan to buy breeding pig.
  • Nguyễn Thị Nhị (MS: 11020011) applies for a loan to buy feed for poultry.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thành (MS: 11020012) applies for a loan to buy feed for poultry.
  • Nghiêm Thị Bình (MS: 11020013) applies for a loan to buy material to weave baskets.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Vũ Thị Kim Cúc (MS: 01020008), năm nay 42 tuổi. Cô có hai con nhỏ. Cô làm giáo viên dạy mầm non, đông thời cô cũng mở của hàng buôn bán nhỏ. Chồng cô kinh doanh nhỏ. Thu nhập của gia đình cô là 300.000 VND/ tuần Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn buôn bán. Chị Nghiêm Thị Thân (MS: 11020009), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho lợn. Chị Nguyên Thị Được (MS: 11020010), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua lợn giống. Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhị (MS: 11020011),vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho gà. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thành (MS: 11020012), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho gà, chim. Chị Nghiêm Thị Bình (MS: 11020013),vay 1.062.000 VND để mua vật liệu về đan rổ.

loans.use: Invest in businesses

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.en:
A. Mahsuda is 41 years old. She is married. She is the loving mother of three children. Her husband is entrepreneur. 

Mahsuda has been running her own business for 14 years. She sells children's clothes in a store located in one of the intensively inhabited parts of the city. She started out with only a few products, but her business is currently more stable.  Mahsuda is very nice and polite and has many clients. The business is quite stable and serves as a significant source of income for the family.

She is requesting 3000 Somoni ($875 USD) to increase her stock of summer clothes for kids. Mahsuda is planning to repay the loan completely in 5 months. She promises to be accurate when repaying the loan and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To buy new children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Idimo

texts.en:
A. Idimo is 46 is years old. She is married with three children. Idimo’s husband is entrepreneur. Idimo and her husband are working hard to ensure a bright future for their children.

Idimo has been running her own small business for thirteen years. She has a place in the central local market for selling food, such as macaroni, sugar, sweets, detergents, soap, washing powder, toothpaste and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Her daughter helps her in the store registering the stock and serving the clients. The business is stable and allows her to improve her family's living conditions.

This year, Idimo’s daughter is finishing school and dreaming about entering the University. In order to make her daughter’s dream come true, Idimo needs to develop her business. For this purpose, she requests for 3000 Somoni ($875 USD). Idimo is planning to spend the loan to buy more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of the goods. She promises to repay the loan within 5 months and thanks everybody who decided to support her.

Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her making her daughter’s dream a reality. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Islom

texts.en:
K. Islom is 37 years old. He has been married for about 15 years and has four children. His wife is a hosekeeper and takes care of their kids. Islom and his wife are raising their children with love, and trying to ensure their children have everything that a teenager may need. Currently Islom does not work within his profession, but tries to feed his family by trading. 

Islom has been running his business for about 6 years. He rents retail store where he sells different kinds of electronics and perfumes. He is the main bread-winner in the family and the future of his children depends on him.  Considering that Islom is working hard in order to ensure his children with the best future and to make them well educated. All of the goods Islom purchases from  the neighboring town Istaravshan. Islom is trying to have a wide range of goods with the good quality to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income.

Today, Islom requests 2700 Somoni ($800 USD) to buy more new goods to increase the range of goods. He hopes to increase his income and be able to send his children to a better school. He promises to repay the loan within 8 months and your support will really help him. Be an important part of the growth of Islom’s business. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: To buy new goods to increase his range of available products

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en:
R. Suhrob is 24 years old. He is not yet married. Suhrob has been running his business for five years. Suhrob sells cell phone accessories, such as chargers, earphones, and cell phone cases. The business is located in the central local market. Suhrob manages his business with success and there is a strong trend for development of the business in future.

This year is a most important one for Suhrob, because he is planning to arrange his own wedding. Thus, Suhrob is planning to expand his business and purchase more cell phone accessories to sell.

For this purpose, he requests 2700 Somoni ($800 USD) for a term of 8 months. Suhrob has already taken out a loan and proved himself to be a reliable client. He promises to repay the current loan in time and thanks all for support. Your support will really help him. Be an important part of arranging of Suhrob’s wedding.

loans.use: To buy accessories for cell phones

loans.name: Soatoy

texts.en:
R. Soatoy is 41 years old. She is a widow and has four children. Soatoy is a market vendor. She sells clothes and shoes for kids in the local market. She has been in this business for two years. She started her business because she needed extra income to be able to pay for household and personal expenses, and she also needed her own income in order to afford her home and health expenses.

Soatoy is a friendly and polite woman. She is trying to diversify the range of goods to satisfy the needs of clients with varying levels of income. However, the majority of the goods are attractive to customers with the average incomes. The business is stable, allowing Soatoy to make the considerable contributions to the family budget.

Now Soatoy is planning to purchase new clothing in order to increase her stock of summer clothes and shoes for kids. For this purpose, she requests 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) for a term of 10 months. Soatoy thanks all of those who are supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy new children's summer clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Khayrikhon

texts.en:
S. Khayrikhon is 38 years old. She is married with five children. Her husband left for Russia two years ago to earn money.

Khayrikhon sells food, such as tea, sunflower oil, baby food, mayonnaise, butter and sweets. She rents a place for her business in the local market. Khayrikhon has been running her own small business for 2 years. Her older sons help Khayrikhon with the business. The income she derives allows her to provide for the family's expenses. Khayrikhon works very hard to give her dearest children a good education and to make them happy.

To cover the higher education expenses of her elder son, who is going to enter the university, Khayrikhon is planning to increase her working capital in order to increase the range of goods that she sells.

Khayrikhon is requesting 3400 Somoni ($1000 USD) for a term of 12 months. Khayrikhon thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

Khayrikhon is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Khayrikhon’s business. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: To buy food for her business

loans.name: Mahmadullo

texts.en:
T. Mahmadullo is 22 years old. Mahmadullo sells the fabrics that people use to sew tradtional Tajik national dresses. He has been in this business for 3 years. The national dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and beautiful. Tajikistan is located in the Central Asia and the spring is the most beautiful season in this region. When you see all these national dresses, it feels like you are admiring the scenery when awaking from a cold winter, the festival of green leaves and grasses, of bright red and yellow tulips in the mountains, and a blue sky which is so close to you in spring.

At the same time, the national dress is one of the most important items in a girl's dowry. Mahmadullo has very good taste, and he is well equipped to advise his clients about which textiles to choose for this or that occasion. That is why he has his customers. Moreover, Mahmadullo’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various levels of the population, because he has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet.

The income that he derives allows him to provide for his personal needs, as well as for the family's needs, since Mahmadullo lives with his parents.

Now Mahmadullo needs 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) to buy new fabrics. Mahmadullo promises to repay the loan in 7 months and expresses his gratitude to everyone that is supporting him.

loans.use: To buy new fabrics in order to increase the variety of his goods for sale

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor K. is 38-year-old lady. Gulbahor and her husband, who is an entrepreneur, have a large family. They have four children of school age. Gulbahor is working hard to earn an honest livelihood. For 5 years already Gulbahor has been running her own business. She started baking the national bread which is called “lepeshka.” She gets up early and bakes the lepeshka so that people have the fresh bread on their tables for breakfast.

Initially Gulbahor only baked the lepeshka but never sold them by herself. Gradually the business expanded, and the children grew up. Today it is the family business and her husband and elder daughter are helping her. Now Gulbahor has a trading place in the central market of the city. The family business is stable. Gulbahor has a client base that allows her to improve the income of the family.

Today Gulbahor requests 300 USD in order to purchase the flour for baking extra lepeshka to expand the business. Gulbahor would like to confirm that she is ready to pay the loan in 9 months and thanks everyone for trusting and supporting her.

loans.use: Purchase flour for baking lepeshka

loans.name: Mirali

texts.ru:
Mirali K. lives in the Rudaki region. He is married and has four children. He has a small business and uses its profits to support his family. He buys old cars, repairs them and then resells at a more profitable price. He just bought a car made by Volga which is a little bit more expensive and he does not have enough money for its repair. He needs help and wants to use the loan to repair this vehicle. When he sells it he can make a decent profit. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Косимов Мирали проживает в районе Рудаки. Женат , имеет 4 детей. Занимается небольшим бизнесом, доход от которого использует для своей семьи. Покупает старые машины , ремонтирует их и перепродает по более выгодной цене. В данный момент он купил автомобиль марки «Волга» немного дороже и на ее ремонт у Мирали не осталось денег. Поэтому он обратился к нам за помощью. Хочет получить кредитдля того , чтобы использовать его на ремонт автомобиля. Продав машину он сможет получить неплохой доход. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Hout N. is 40 years old and makes her living buying resin of rubber trees from workers on local plantations, and then reselling the resin to factories. The resin is then put through a process to become what we know as rubber. These plantations are vast and quite common in eastern Cambodia, in provinces such as Kampong Cham. Working long hours, Hout N. does well, earning $20 per day on average in total sales.

Hout N. is a widow with four children, three of whom were married off fairly young to help with the finances once her husband died. Only one child still lives with her today and helps manage the household. She now wants to take out a loan to buy a larger amount of resin from plantations. Hout N. desires this income boost because she is planning to invest in some land with rubber trees of her own.

loans.use: To buy rubber trees and rubber tree resin.

loans.name: Kon

texts.en: Kon S. is a 33-year-old housewife living in Kampong Cham. She works in the house  caring not only for her three children but also her elderly mother who recently moved in with them. Her husband is a logger in the forests of northern Cambodia, earning $10 per day. This can be a somewhat dangerous profession which is why the pay is good. While she is home alone with her mother and children, she wants a means of earning some money; her loan will allow her to purchase a sewing machine and start doing some tailoring with the hope of developing this into a home-based business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nasim

texts.ru:
Nasim K. lives in the Rudaki region with his family. He is not married and currently lives with his parents. He and his mother have a retail business and sell women's clothing on the Kovron market. He has five years of experience in this field. Nasim wants to help his mother and also separate their vendor space. By receiving a loan he will be able to have an independent business. This will also help his family increase their income. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Косимов Насим житель района Рудаки. Проживает со своей семьей . Он еще не женат и поэтому живет с родителями. Вместе с матерью занимается торговлей. Торгует на рынке «Корвон» женской одеждой. Опыт работы в данной сфере 5 лет. Хочет помочь матери и кроме того отделить торговую точку. Получив кредит он сможет занятся бизнесом самостоятельно. Это поможет его семье увеличить доход семьи.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Kieran

texts.en:
Kieran M., age 55, is married with 8 children (ages 24, 23, 18, 17, 17, 14, 12, and 4). He makes and sells bricks, a business that he started 7 years ago. He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $323.

Kieran has taken out 4 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to pay school fees and home expenses and to increase his bricks business. He hopes for a new loan to buy more cement and make more bricks for a greater sales opportunity.

loans.use: to buy more cement for more bricks

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun Kim Srung is 32 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a small grocery store, earning US$5 per day. Her husband, Mok Saren, is a school teacher. Teacher salaries, however, are extremely low, and Mok Saren is forced to also operate a motor-taxi business to earn additional income each day after school. Chhun Kim Srung and Mok Saren have two children. Chhun Kim Srung knows that her family needs to branch out into other sources of income to cover the daily expenses and secure the future. She wants to begin raising pigs and to buy her husband a new motorbike that he could use as a taxi. For this purpose, Chhun is asking for a loan of US$600, which she will combine with her own savings.

loans.use: Purchase of a new motorbike and pigs

loans.name: Lung

texts.en: Lung K. H. is 53 years of age. She is a construction worker, a job females rarely take in Cambodia. She works alongside her husband, who is paid slightly more tH. she is for the same work. Together, however, their income rounds out to $10 per day. The couple has two children. Lung K. H. seeks a loan in order to rent a plot of land on which she can begin growing yams as an additional source of income.

loans.use: To rent land.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang C. is 57 years old. She has developed a unique occupation for herself working as a stage manager for acts that come through their district. She owns and runs the stage itself and organizes the performances. She has been in this line of work since 1981, averaging about $20 per day for her services. Her husband is 66 years of age, a retired government official living on a small pension of $1 per day. They have eight children and have seen four already happily married. The remaining four live at home and are pursuing varied careers.

Neang C. would like to be able to build a new theatre with a new stage for her business. During the Khmer Rouge regime, traditional Khmer performing arts were all but destroyed and have been very slow to fully resurface. Theatres like this one are crucial for cultural rebuilding.

loans.use: To buy wood to build a theatre.

loans.name: Christina Chuma's Iman A Group

texts.en:
Christina C., age 44, is married with four children (ages 26, 23, 19 and 4). She sells charcoal and firewood in a business that she started 1999. She works from 6am to 7pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $206.

Christina has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business capital. She hopes for a new loan to open another location for selling the same items. Christina will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell fish, clothes and nutrition flour.

In the picture Christina is first from the right.

loans.use: to open another place for selling charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is an entrepreneur from the western Ukrainian city of Mukachevo. She has a small space at a market near the bus station in Mukachevo, where she sells women’s clothing. Ludmila has been in business for about six years. She is hard-working, honest, and disciplined in her business. She has a strong desire to work and work well. Ludmila is married and has children who are grown.

Ludmila has requested a loan of 4000 Ukrainian Griven to invest in purchasing new inventory. We are happy to have this opportunity to assist her with her business and look forward to her continued success.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Born on the 18th July 1926, Pa Johnson is a widower whose wife died about twenty years ago.  Before her dearth they were blessed with three children.  Pa Stephen and his family live in a four room.apartment in the Bertin neighbor hood in Bome.
He did not have a basic education nor did not learn a trade because his parents where poor and died due to lack of medication when he was still very young. Motivated by all these circumstances, the need to bring up a good family and the untimely death of the wife, he joined GHAPE in 2001. Since then, he has borrowed and successfully repaid loans 5 times worth a total of $720 and the profit of these loans have helped him sustain his life and that of his family, including the school fees of his grand children.
	Given a loan, he plans to buy  table birds and piglets for fattening and sale.  He will use the profit of this loan to continue to educate his grad  children and part will be plough back into his business. He thinks his business will succeed because he has been doing this business for a long time and because his neighbors will provide a ready market for his fowl. 
	He plans to pay his loan in 18 months. The first installment shall be repaid four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy fowl, piglets and feed

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya has a small business selling cosmetics and personal care products from a little kiosk at an outdoor market in Uzhgorod, Ukraine. In business for twelve years, she has extensive experience in this area. Mariya started her business after the collapse of the Soviet Union. Through wise management, she has developed a profitable business. Eventually, she hopes to have her own small store location which would allow her to further expand her enterprise. Mariya is married and has a son who is in college. Her business has allowed her to help her son with his college expenses.

Mariya has requested a loan of 5000 Ukrainian Griven to increase her working business capital. She has taken loans from Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine in the past and has always paid her loans back carefully and on-time. We are glad to have another opportunity to help this hard-working entrepreneur operate a successful business.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Tata

texts.en:
Born on the 5th of May 1974, Mr. K. is a single father with one child who is still below the age of fifteen. Due to poverty and untimely death of his father he was unable to continue his education. His mother was unable to help him and his younger brother single handedly. She could not raise enough money to educate the children, take care of their hospitals bills and also basic house needs like salts and magi. K. decided to start business buying and selling goats, pigs, cocoa yams and fowl.  Until now, he had been making healthy profits in the retailing business which has helped him take care of his child. Motivated by the need of business capital and to be with people, he became a member of GHAPE in 2001, where he was trained in business and marketing techniques, So far he has successfully obtained and repaid loans five times from GHAPE, worth a total of $640.
	Given a loan he plans to continue in his retail. He is quite convinced that his business is going to be successful because he has experience and a lot of customers in it.
	He plans to pay the loan in 24 months. The first installment shall be repaid four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy pigs, fowl, and seedlings

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey runs a small business selling car parts at the “avto-rhinok” or auto market in Berdyansk, Ukraine. The auto market is made up of many individual entrepreneurs who sell all sorts of auto related products, from windshield washer fluid and oil, to seat covers, spare parts, and tires. Sergey has a very favorable location at the market for his business. He has been in business for over 15 years and has developed a reputation for honesty. Married with one son, Sergey’s business provides a good income for his family.

Sergey has requested a short term loan to purchase additional inventory, which will help him to continue operating a successful enterprise.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Assaad

texts.en:
Assaad is 30 years old and lives and works in Saida, southern Lebanon. Assaad is in the scrap business and also works as a taxi driver to make ends meet.

This is the second time he is applying for a loan from A. Majmoua because he needs to buy materiA. to sustain his scrap business.

loans.use: To buy scrap material

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 38 year old father of 6. He lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Jamal is in the scrap business.

This is the second time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua because he needs to buy material to sustain and develop his scrap business.

loans.use: To buy scrap material

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Born in 1962, mama Mary is married to chief Fongu Peter.  She has successfully given birth to seven children, three still under the age of fifteen. She joined GHAPE in 2001. Since then she had received and repaid loans from GHAPE 5 times, for a total worth $724.
         Mary requests a loan to buy goats for fattening and cassava for the production of water fufu (a staple food commonly eaten in her area). She thinks her business will succeed because she has been doing this business for so long, she has ample land and has a ready market in Bamenda urban center.     
     She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment shall be repaid four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy goats and cassava

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 44 year old father of 5. He lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Maher is a car blacksmith.

This is the second time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua because he needs to buy materials to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy materials for his car business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Born in 1965, Margaret is married to Lucas Che B. and is blessed with five children, two of which are below the age of fifteen.  The fact that she did not go to school made life very difficult for her and the fact her son, brother and mother died because of poverty and hardship which made her to stress very much. The funeral expenses made her unable to have three square meals a day.  She joined GHAPE after learning about it from her friend. Since then she has successfully borrowed and repaid loans seven times. The profit from these loans helped her pay her children school fees and provide some basic needs like food for the family.
	Given a loan she plans to buy pigs, chicks, feed, medications, flour, sugar, and oil. She knows her business is going to succeed because she had acquired some basic training in finance management and how to choose a good business from GHAPE. 
	She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment shall be repaid four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy chicks, pigs and labor.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 25 year old father of 1. He lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida and owns a coffee shop.

This is the second time he is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua because he needs to buy provisions for his business. The income generated from this investment will help him pay a part of his house payments.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is 31 years old and lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Nidal owns a mini market and is applying for a loan because he needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Fri

texts.en:
Born in 1966, J. is married to Michael Teneng with five children, two below the age of 15. Due to poverty and untimely death of her father and brothers she was unable to continue her education. Her mother was unable to help her and her younger sister single handedly. She could not raise enough money to educate the children, take care of their hospitals bills and pay for basic house needs like salts and magi. J. is a hardworking and energetic young woman who decided to start a business buying and selling wood.  Until now, she had been making healthy profits in the business, which has helped her take care of her children. Motivated by the need for business capital and need to be with people made her to become a member of GHAPE in 2005, where she was trained in business and marketing techniques, So far she has successfully obtained and repaid loans two times from GHAPE..
	She requests a loan to continue in her business of poultry and pig raising, farming and wood selling. She is quite convinced that her business is going to be successful because she has experience and a lot of customers in it.
	J. plans to pay the loan in 24 months. The first installment shall be repaid on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement

loans.use: To buy chicken, pigs, feed, wood and labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand on her business.

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en: Oussama is 27 years old and lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Oussama is a car electrician. This is the third time he is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua because he needs to buy materiA. to sustain and develop his business. The income generated from this investment will help him pursue his house's construction.

loans.use: To buy material for his car business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Born in 1959, Esther A. is married and has five children. She has been a very hardworking woman from the day she joined GHAPE. She explained how good it is for a woman to work for herself and care for the children, even if her work is just the rearing of pigs. Her desire is to work for her children’s education and pay for their apprenticeships so that they may learn a trade. She decided to become a member of GHAPE due to her inability to get investment capital, which could give her higher income to meet her children’s needs. With a loan of $1200, she plans to buy motorcycle parts to be resold, buy seeds to plant, and buy other products for retail. This investment will help people in her community to travel from one location to the other. She will also retail her goods to the public which will greatly help the poor who will not have to travel as far to acquire their daily needs. She is planning on using the profits generated to sponsor her children in school. She also wants to buy working tools for them, to help them get a start in their mechanic apprenticeships.
She plans to pay the loan in 24 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle parts, seeds, and products

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is 48 years old and a mother of 5. She lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Wafaa sells accessories, make up, perfumes and other cosmetic products. This is the first time she is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua because she needs to buy materiA. to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy material for her cosmetics business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her inventory of cereals to sell at the market.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 30 year old father of 2. Rabih lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida, where he works painting furniture. This is the second time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs to buy material to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cereals to sell and double her income.

loans.name: Ndang

texts.en: Born in 1963, Ndang B. E. is married to Ndang Joseph and is the mother of five children. She says her agony started when her elder brother and her father, both who had a lot of material and financial help, died. Wishing to be rid of poverty, she decided to become a GHAPE member. With her first loan, she started building skills in growing and selling vegetables. She is proud of having her own small business. She also succeeded in repaying the loan and making a small profit.  She requests a loan to continue selling vegetables at the local food market where buyers come from all over the province. She has set as an objective for this loan to acquire more experience in marketing techniques and to use her profits to buy a plot of land and build her own home.

loans.use: To buy seeds and manure

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Ma Rachael is married to a monogamist Mr. Ndap Zacaria.  They are blessed with three children, all below the age of fifteen.  The fact that she dropped out of school  made life very difficult for her and she was unable to assist her husband to provide for the family.  Worst of it all, her children were unable to study because of school fees and were also unable to have three square meal a day.  She was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by her friend who has been a GHAPE member in 2002. Since then she has successfully borrowed and repaid loans five times. The profit from these loans helped her pay her children school fees and provide some basic needs like food for the family.
	She requests a loan to buy piglets, cassava and fowl. She knows her business is going to succeed because she had acquired some basic training in finance management and how to choose a good business from GHAPE. 
	She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment  shall be repaid on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: To buy piglets, fowl, cassava and feed.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Rustam B. lives with his family in the town of Yavan. He is 36 years old, married and has four children. He is in the agriculture business selling the product which he gets from his plot of land which he sows with wheat and other crops. He then sells the product after the harvest on the market. He wants to get a loan to buy a mineral fertilizer. He plans to pay off the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Буриев Рустам проживает в городе Яван. Живет со своей семьей . Возраст 36 . Женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимается торговлей сельхозпродукции. Кроме того занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет участок иземли , где сеет пшеницу и другие злаковые культуры. Получаемый урожай продает на базаре. Хочет получитьб кредит для того . чтобы купить минеральные удобрения. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Nyoh

texts.en:
Nyoh M. was born in 1948. She is one of two wives and a mother of six children. Her daughter, who was unmarried, died last year after a protracted illness, leaving behind two children. Nyoh M. was the only person left to take care of them which includes paying their primary school fees and also hospital bills. Her husband is a subsistence farmer and brings no income to the family.
Nyoh M. joined GHAPE three years ago and has successfully repaid two loans, both of which she invested in her small shop in the cattle market. Like most people in Bamenda, M. operates a business and also farms to feed her family. Tragically, last year she lost most of her crops when a herd of cattle destroyed her farm.
M. is requesting a loan to expand her shop and replant her farm. Specifically she wants to buy cattle ropes to add to the palm oil and kola nuts that she is already selling. Her business is going to succeed because there is a high demand for ropes and palm oil in her area and almost all men chew kola nuts. She says the side benefit to her community will be keeping cattle out of people’s farms.
She plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy cow ropes, palm oil

loans.name: Bibizor

texts.ru:
Bibizor U. lives in the town of Yavan with her family, she is a housewife. She is 47 years old, married and has six children. She is in agriculture and needs to get a loan to buy mineral fertilizer for the sowing of wheat. It will help her get a good quality harvest. She will receive good profits for the family when she sells it. She plans to pay off the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Юлдошева Бибизор жительница города Яван. Домохозяйка . Живет со своей семьей . Ей 47 лет . Она замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Занимается сельским хозяйством. Хочет получить кредит , чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения для посееной пшеницы. Это поможет клиентке получить качественный урожай. Продав его она принесет доход семье . Погасить кредит она планиркует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
D. is married to Tita Foji David and they are blessed with six children. She lost her two children. The most recent one died after a brief illness, leaving behind a wife and four children who are now all with D.. Along with her widowed daughter-in-law and the four grandchildren, D. houses two other orphaned grandchildren. D., her husband, and the widow are all GHAPE members. They all join hands together to take care of those children, which includes paying school fees, feeding, hospital bills and clothing. Her husband is a subsistence farmer and brings no income to the house. 
D. was motivated by all these circumstance to join GHAPE in 2004 and has successfully repaid three loans, both of which she invested in rearing of pigs and goats and farming crops like cassava and beans.
D. is requesting a loan of to expand her animal farm (pigs and goats) and cassava farm. She says her business is going to succeed because she has been farming since the age of five when her parents began to teach her. In addition, she has enough land for farming and rearing animals and the demand for these items is high.
She plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To rear pigs and goats and for farming

loans.name: Ulbosh

texts.ru:
Ulbosh I. lives in the town of Yavan. She makes her living by agriculture. She has a plot of land which she sows with wheat and potatoes. She needs a mineral fertilizer to have a good quality harvest. Ulbosh has been in this business for the past thirteen years. She sells the crops from the harvest at the market. The money which she receives from the sales go towards her family needs. This is why she decided to get a loan which she will pay of within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Имомназарова Улбош жительница города Яван. Зарабатывает деньги путем растениеводством. Имеет участок земли . Засеивает его пшеницей. И картофелем. Необходимо закупить минеральные удобрения для того , чтобы получить качественный урожай. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 13 лет. Полученный урожай продает на рынке. А деньги полученные от продажи использовать на другие потребности семьи. Для этого она решила получить кредит , погасить который сможет в течении 18 месяцев

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Abam

texts.en:
E. was born in 1949. He is married and a father of four children who are all above the age of 15. Despite being born into poverty, lacking education, and losing his parents at an early age, Emmanual aims to become a very rich man and give his children the good education they need to get ahead.	
       E. became a member of GHAPE in 2006 and has successfully repaid two loans. He invested his loans to sell maize and bought a maize mill which produces flour.

E. started farming crops in 1975, and recently starteed buying and renting a few houses around his neighborhood. In the two years since joining GHAPE, he has dramatically increased his fortunes. His first loan helped him to buy his first corn mill (which costs about 350,000 CFA or $875), and the second loan from Kiva, together with his profits from previous business, helped him to buy his second corn mill. Corn mills are in demand in every community around Bamenda, as corn is sold in kernels and every person must take their corn to be milled before they can prepare “corn fufu” – a local favorite. 

I asked E. how he is able to farm and operate mills in two locations, and like a modern-day businessman, he operates from a distance. He pays the rent for two shops in two busy markets and hires two young men to operate the mills. With the two mills now operating, he says he is able to earn as much as 100,000 CFA ($250) per month. 

His profits from the mills have allowed him to expand his business activities into livestock. Since starting the second mill, he has been able to purchase three piglets and two cattle. His dream for the future is to start a full cattle farm. He says that he already has enough land for a herd of fifty cattle, and he has recently obtained two required grazing permits. A future loan will enable him to begin to build his herd.

E.’s income allows him and his wife, a civil servant working with the government, to give their four children an enviable education. His eldest is studying in a university in France, made possible in part by a scholarship. Two others are in university in Cameroon. And the youngest is in secondary school. Between the four, E. and his wife pay over 500,000 CFA ($1,250) in annual school fees and expenses. 

E. says that without his new business ventures, he and his wife would really be struggling with the expense of providing their children with such an income. Thus, he is very grateful to those who have financed his loan: “It is a pleasure to learn that so many around the world are contributing to my family’s wellbeing,” he says, “and we send them our thanks.”

He plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy a corn mill

loans.name: Agwa

texts.en:
E. was born in1939; she is one of three wives married to a polygamist who passed away. She is a mother of five children, three below 15 years old. Her only daughter, who was married, died after a protracted illness, leaving behind three children that E. now care for. E. is not educated and due to poverty, hardship, and the death of her husband, she struggles to educate and clothe her children,  pay hospital bills or even provide them three square meals a day. 
E. joined GHAPE three years ago and has successfully repaid two loans, both of which she invested in buying goats and pigs and farming of cassava. The profit from these loans has helped to pay school fees and hospital bills and increased the size of her farm.
E. requests a loan to increase the size of her business by buying more pigs and goats and farming more cassava. Her business is going to succeed because there is a ready market for the animals and cassava. Due to her experience in this business, she is well known in her community for raising healthy animals and has a lot of customers who come from far and near.  
She plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy pigs and goats and raise fowl.

loans.name: Gulnuroy

texts.ru:
Gulnoroy Z. lives in the town of Yavan with her family. She is married and has five children. They live in hardship and her husband left to Russia to find work, but there have not been any income from him yet. Gulnoroy has been taking care of the family by herself by working in agriculture. At this time she needs to buy mineral fertilizer to grow her product. It will help her get a good quality harvest. She has turned for help to get a loan which she will pay off within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Закирлоева Гулнурой жительница города Яван. Домохозяйка . Живет со своей семьей . Замужем , имеет пятерых детей. Условия в которых они живут тяжелые . муж уехал на заработки в Россию , но никаких доходов с его стороны не поступает. Гулнурой сама , занимаясь сельским хозяйством обеспечивает свою семью.Сейчас ей нужно купить минеральные удобрения для оброботки продукции. Это даст возможность получить качественный урожай. Поэтому она обратилась к нам за кредитом , который сможет погасить в течении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha A. A. was born in 1950. She is one of three wives married to a polygamist and a mother of six children, all above the age of 15. However, she cares for two young grandchildren: “My son’s wife died leaving me a young baby; then my daughter who was unmarried died , leaving a two-month-old baby with me. She further explains, “I am the only person left to take care of the family; my children are not doing anything to bring in a living and my husband is a subsistence farmer who brings no income to the family.”
	Tabitha has being a member of GHAPE for three years now and has successfully repaid two loans, both of which she invested in the buying and selling of kola nuts, animal feed, beans, and farming crops like beans, maize, cassava, corn, and potatoes. The profits have helped her to pay school fees for her children and other basic needs of her family.
	Tabitha is requesting a loan to expand her kola nuts business and to increase the size of her farm by adding more land. She is convinced her business is going to succeed because nearly all men eat kola nuts no matter how the economy suffers. Her farm currently provides her family with all the staple crops, and if she farms more land, she may be able to sell the surplus.
She plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy kola nuts and beans

loans.name: Aziza Lubiki's Tupendane B Group

texts.en:
Aziza L., age 38, is married with two children (ages 18 and 16). She sells clothes from a shop that she opened three years ago. She works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $254.

Aziza has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business capital. She hopes for a new loan to increase her inventory. Aziza will share this loan with her loan group Tupendane B, which totals 15 members.

In the picture Aziza is fourth from the left in the front row.

loans.use: to increase inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Normahmad

texts.ru:
Normahmad Z. lives in Dushanbe. He is married and has 6 children. He is the sole provider for his family. Because of this, he needs to work a lot. He is in farming and agricultural businesses. He would like to obtain a loan so he could purchase natural fertilizers. This will help him to grow quality crops. He is planning to pay off the loan within the next 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Закирлоев Нормахмад житель города Душанбе. Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Он один является кормильцем семьи. Для того , чтобы обеспечить семью ему приходится много работать. Занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Хочет получить кредит для того . чтобы закупить удобрения. Это поможет получить качественный урожай. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 18 месяцев

loans.use: To purchase natural fertilizers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. was born in 1930. She was forced into marriage when she was 14 years old. At the time of her marriage, she knew nothing but farming. Her husband died, leaving her with eight children and no assets. Despite the fact that Esther is not educated, her greatest wish is to see that her children become educated and have professions.
	Esther A. was motivated by these circumstances to become a member of GHAPE. She has been a member for five years now and has successfully repaid four loans, all of which she invested in farming crops like cassava, maize, and plantains. The profit from her farm has help her to pay school fees, books and uniforms, sponsoring her children to learn a trade, and paying the dowry for her son’s wife. She has also constructed a kitchen, a toilet, and repaired her house. She says that she is living today because of GHAPE.
	Esther is now requesting a loan to buy an Okada (a motorbike) for one of her sons to drive as a taxi, and also to rear fowl. Her son has undergone financial difficulties but has the determination to work hard and overcome poverty completely. Since motorbikes are still rare in her area, and most people rely on public transportation, hers will be a steady source of income and will also assist the community, especially when emergency transportation is needed
She plans to repay this loan in 24 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and chickens for rearing

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru:
Abdukarim S. lives in the Varzob region. He is 47 years old, married, and has 2 children. Abdukarim has a small food store. Food sales are the sole sorce of income for his family. One of his children is a student. His wife takes care of the household. At this point, Abdukarim would like to increase the assortment of inventory in his store. That is why he needs additional funds. After advising with his family, he decided to apply for a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Солехов Абдукарим житель района Варзоб .Возраст 47 лет , женат , имеет 2 детей. Абдукарим имеет небольшой продуктовый магазин. Торговля является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Сын клиента студент.Жена занимается ведением домашнего хозяйства. В данный момент клиент хочет пополнить ассортимент своего магазина.Для чего ему нужны деньги. Посоветовавшись с семьей Абдукарим решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: To increase the inventory assortment

loans.name: Falak Naz

texts.en:
Falak Naz, son of G. H., is 28 years old. He is one of those persons who returned to his own country, Afghanistan, in 2001. He graduated from grade twelve, but he couldn’t continue to higher education because of financial problems. Now he is marred and working as a gardener in district Shewa of Ningarhar province.

He wants to buy some plants for his garden but he doesn’t have much money; therefore, he requested a loan of 50,000 Afghanis from AFSG to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy some plants for his garden

loans.name: Abdusoleh

texts.ru:
Abdusoleh Manov lives in the Varzob region. He is 59 years old, married, and has 6 children. He has a bachelors degree and works as a school teacher. Because his salary is quite limited, Abdusoleh and his large family need to be occupied in agriculture. He owns a small piece of land, which he uses to plant potatoes. At this point, he needs to purchase natural fertilizers so he could grow good qulity crops. To obtain the necessary funding he applied for a loan, which he plans to pay off within the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Манонов Абдусолех житель района Варзоб .Возраст 59 лет, женат,имеет 6 детей. Образование высшее, по специальности учитель.Работает в средней школе учителем.Так как заработная плата очень маленькая ,Абдусолех и его большая семья занимается сельским хозяйством.Он имеет небольшой земельный участок ,который засеивает картофелем. В данный момент он хочет купить минеральные удобрения для получения хорошего урожая.Для этого ему нужны деньги и он решил взять кредит сроком на 10 месяцев

loans.use: To purchase natural fertilizers

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 28-year-old woman from the town of Živinice. She is married and her husband works abroad. He can earn approximately 2,000 KM per month. They have a son who is four years old. This is her first loan with Zene za Zene; she is requesting 600 KM. Aida will use the loan to buy chickens, fatten them, and sell them.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Šerifa

texts.en: Šerifa was born in 1953 and she is married. She lives with her husband and her son in Nukići, a small village near the town of Živinice. Her husband is a pensioner whose monthly pension is 375 KM. Her son works and earns approximately 300 KM per month. This would be Šerifa's first loan at the MCO WWI; she is requesting 600 KM. Šerifa will use this loan to rent land from which she would collect grass to feed her cow. Her intention is to keep a cow that she has so that she can provide milk and milk products for her family.

loans.use: To rent land

loans.name: Dembele Fatoumata Ya

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dembele Fatoumata Yaye K. is 49 years old and the mother of three children. She lives in a polygamous household with two co-spouses. Dembele Fatoumata has accumulated a great deal of experience in the manufacture of soft drinks based on local produce. Not having been part of the school system, she learned the juice manufacturing process through the Peace Corps’ training programs offered to uneducated women. To obtain funding for her business, Dembele Fatoumata decided to join her neighborhood’s solidarity loan association. After the successful repayment of four separate loans, she moved on to an individual loan. She wants to use this loan to replenish her stock by buying three bags of different juice powder (mango, papaya and orange), one parcel of packaging material, one 50-kg bag of powdered sugar and other ingredients. She sells her products to professional soft drink vendors (stores and the food trade), but she also has customers within her family and at the market.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Dembele Fatoumata Yaye K. age de 49ans, mere de 3 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame avec deux coépouses. Dembele Fatoumata a accumulé beaucoup d'experience dans la fabrication de boissons sur la base des produits locaux. N'ayant pas fréquente le system scolaire elle a appris le processus de fabrication des jus avec Le Corps de la Paix (Peace Corps) dans le cadre des formations que ceux-ci donnent aux femmes non scolarisées. Pour obtenir un fonds de commerce, Dembele Fatoumata a décidé d'integrer une association de crédit solidaire de son quartier. Apres 4 cycles de prets correctement remboursé, elle passe au pret individuel. Elle veut avec ce pret, reconstituer son stock en achetant 3 sachets de poudre different jus (mangues, papaye, et Orange), 1 paquet d'emballage, 1 sac de 50Kilogrammes de sucre en poudre et autres ingredients. Elle vend ses produits a des vendeurs professionnels de Boissons (Boutique et Alimentation), mais aussi a des particuliers chez elle en famille et au marché.

loans.use: To buy the raw materials to make juice

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama F. sells plastic bowls, chairs, pans, and much more. She is married and has four children.

Ama is working very hard to help pay for the family's expenses and would like a loan to increase her inventory, thus increasing sales.

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of plastic housewares for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther E. sells underwear and childrens clothing at the local market. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a welder in the village, but his income is not sufficient to support the family.

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase additional inventory for resale to help increase profits.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Houleye

texts.fr:
Houleye D. is a 47-year-old widow and mother of seven children. She and her children live with the family of her late husband in their own home in Sanoubougou II. Like many women of her generation, Mrs. D. did not go to a modern school for family/financial reasons. To get by, she had to undertake an activity that generated an income. After trying many activities without success, she decided to run a business selling peanut and palm oil, and has been doing this for two years. She has been working with Soro Yirwaso for about four years. She began with a solidarity loan through a women’s association before requesting an individual loan. All previous loans were repaid successfully. She stocks up from production factories in Sikasso by buying two barrels that she then sells at retail at the market and at home. Her clientele is made up of women. She stocks up at least twice a month. She expects to make a monthly profit of CFA 60,000. As current head of the family, she takes care of all the family expenses (health, food, education, etc.).

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Houleye D. est une veuve de 47ans, mere de 7 enfants. Elle vit avec ses enfants dans la famille de son defunt epoux dans leur propre maison a Sanoubougou II. Comme beaucoup de femmes de sa génération, Madame Houleye D. n’a pas fréquenté l’école moderne et cela pour des raisons sociales. Pour s’en sortir elle était obligée de mener une activité génératrice de revenus. Après avoir mener beaucoup d’activités sans réussite, elle décida de mener l’activité de vente d’huile d’arachide et de palme et cela depuis deux ans. Elle est en relation avec SORO YIRWASO il y a de cela environ 4 ans. Elle a commencé par le prêt solidaire dans une association de femmes avant de demander le prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des unités de production de Sikasso en achetant deux (2) barils qu’elle vend en détail au marché et à la maison. Sa clientèle est composée de femmes. Elle s’approvisionne au moins deux fois par mois. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel soixante mille francs CFA (60 000 FCFA). Etant actuellement chef de famille, elle assure les dépenses de sa famille (Santé, Nourritures, Education etc.).

loans.use: To buy and sell peanut and palm oil

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina E. prepares and sells a native food called ‘Banku’. Maize is used for the preparation of the Banku. It is highly patronized by the natives of her area.

Her husband is a fisherman, but his income is not sufficient to support Faustina and their four children.

She wishes to increase production and sales with a loan.

loans.use: To increase production of a native food, Banku, for resale

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Awa D. is a married woman aged 42, with seven children (five boys and two girls). She lives in a rental property in the Medine neighborhood of SIkasso. Like many women of her age, Mrs. D. did not go to a modern school for family/financial reasons. In order to get by, she had to embark on activities that would generate an income (fabric dyeing and the restaurant business). She has been working with the microfinance institution Soro Yirwaso for five years. All previous loans have been successfully repaid. She wants to buy four bolts of cotton damask and 40 cases of drinks. She gets her fabric supplies from the market in Sikasso. She dyes the damask and sells it to her clientele made up mainly of customers from Sikasso and Syama. Mrs. D.’s cotton damask production is highly valued at the Sikasso market. In addition to selling cotton damask, Mrs. D. runs a restaurant in Syama. She expects to make an average monthly profit of CFA 275,000. With this profit she will be able to meet her family expenses. Right now she has bought some land used for housing and is in the process of construction. She expects to increase her revenue through the current loan.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.
