With a loan of 1,700.00 Soles ($600), which she will repay in six months, she will buy a two-horned bull to raise and two sacks of bran.

Her business is going much better now and she is content with the income she makes by selling. Her husband works with a tricycle in the city of Yunguyo and he supports her unconditionally in her business.

She is thirty years old and has studied through the third grade in school. She has one son and three daughters, three of whom are studying in the community's education institute. She hopes to have a stable to raise and buy more cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Tomasa, es socia del Banco Comunal Progreso Caluyo de la comunidad Villa Santa Rosa sector Sakakatani, departamento de puno ella desde joven se dedicaba al negocio de compra y venta de chuño, papa, habas y quinua. En ese entonces su negocio fue rentable. Cuando tuvo su familia continua con su negocio pero no le alcanzaba la ganancia para cubrir los gastos del hogar, por ello decidió cambiar de negocio. Actualmente, se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno, gracias a su madrina de matrimonio quien la animó para que invirtiera el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 en la compra de concentrado como 2 sacos de afrecho, 2 sacos de soya y más las inyecciones de engorde, esta actividad la hace desde el año 2005. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará un toro de dos dientes para engorde y 2 sacos de afrecho. El negocio le va mucho mejor que antes, por ello ella esta contenta con la ganancia que obtiene de la venta de ganado, y su esposo trabaja con triciclo en la ciudad de Yunguyo y le apoya incondicionalmente en la actividad económica. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, ha estudiado hasta tercero de primaria y tiene un hijo y 03 hijas de los cuales están estudiando 3 en Institución Educativa de la comunidad y ella sueña con tener un establo para el engorde y comprar más ganado vacuno.

loans.use: Purchase of a Bull

loans.name: Volver A Empezar Group

texts.es:
The Volver a Empezar group meets at 10:30 in the morning at the neighborhood center in Alto Lima. The members of the group are all very punctual, and with the help of the loan assistant they go to work on the domestic activities that each of them is responsible for.

Sadly, most of the members are separated from their husbands for many painful reasons, and so these women have taken on the role of heads of their households and are now responsible for their children’s wellbeing. That is the reason why the group is called Volver a Empezar, or “starting over again.”

The women prepare breakfasts and snacks for a living, which they sell as street vendors. Every day they set up their stands on different streets in the city, where they prepare tea, coffee, and hot chocolate, which they then sell along with empanadas, sandwiches, or simply bread. The women would all like their businesses to grow, and that is why they are applying for bigger loans—they will use the loans to rent small rooms where they can set up their businesses, which will guarantee them bigger sales. With increased income the women will be able to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

A las 10:30 de la mañana es la hora cuando la asociación “Volver a empezar” se reúne en el centro focal de Alto Lima, todo el grupo muy puntual, con la ayuda de su asistente de créditos, trabaja en las actividades internas de manera responsable.

Lamentablemente a la mayoría de las socias tuvieron que separase de sus parejas por muchos penosos motivos, lo que les llevo ser jefes de familia, encargándose del bienestar de sus hijos, es por eso que adquirieron la denominación de volver a empezar.

Se dedican a la preparación de desayunos y meriendas, esto lo realizan de manera ambulante, es decir, todos los días, arman su puesto en diferentes calles de la ciudad, y ahí mismo realizan la elaboración de té, café y cocoa acompañados con empanadas, sanguiches o simplemente pan. Tienen la esperanza de que sus negocios crezcan es por eso que solicitan mayores créditos para conseguir alquilar pequeños ambientes apropiados que les garantice mayores ventas y por consiguiente mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Applying for larger loans so they can rent small rooms that will guarantee bigger sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in businesses

loans.name: Thi Chanh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Chanh (MS: 020050), 32 years old, would like to take out a loan of 2,006,000VND to buy feed for pigs. Her husband is a general laborer. They have two school aged children. The family’s income is 80,000VND a day. She, with her group, had one loan that paid off successfully. His group has 4 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Nghiêm Thị Nhượng (MS: 020051) applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs.
  • Lê Thị Nhật (MS: 020053) applies for a loan to invest in scrap metal.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thơm (MS: 020054) applies for a loan to buy wood for making furniture.
  • Nguyễn Thị Mười (MS: 020055) applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Chanh (MS: 020050), năm nay 32 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để về mua cám chăn nuôi lợn. Chồng chị đi làm công nhân giúp gia đình có thêm thu nhập, chị có hai con còn đang đi học. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị là 80.000 VND/ngày. Chị cùng nhóm đã tham gia được một chu kỳ vay vốn và hoàn trả rất tốt. Chị thích tham gia vay vốn vì được trả dần. Chị Nghiêm Thị Nhượng (MS: 020051), vay 2.006.000 VND để về chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Lê Thị Nhật (MS: 020053), vay 2.006.000 VND bổ xung vốn đi chợ mua bán phế liệu. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thơm (MS: 020054), vay 2.006.000 VND về mua thêm gỗ để làm hàng bàn ghế bán. Chị Nguyễn Thị Mười (MS: 020055), vay 2.006.000 VND về mua cám chăn nuôi lợn

loans.use: Chăn nuôi và buôn bán

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Nou Y. is a vegetable farmer in Kampong Cham. She earns on average $3 per day, more than rice farmers usually make. Her husband is a laborer, also earning about $3 per day doing whatever odd jobs need to be done around the province, such as unloading trucks and working on small construction projects. The couple has five children, three of whom are already married. Out of the two that are single, one is still in school while the other is a laborer with his father. Nou Y. has a good farm but is requesting a loan to buy a nearby plot of land to begin growing beans, a high earning crop.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Thi Tuong

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị Tường (MS: 11020001), 33 years old, has two small children. Her family do rice farming, raise livestock, have fish pond and also sell feed. The income is 300,000VND a week. She is applying for a loan of 2,006,000VND to buy breeding pigs. Her group has 6 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers except one.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thùa (MS: 11020002) applies for a loan to invest in her grocery stand.
  • Nguyễn Thị Sáu (MS: 11020003) applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs.
  • Nghiêm Thị Hà (MS: 11020004) applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Tuyết (MS: 11020005) applies for a loan to invest in her construction store.
  • Nguyễn Thị Cửi (MS: 11020006) applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thinh (MS: 11020007) applies for a loan of 1,534,000VND to buy feed for pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trần Thị Tường (MS: 11020001), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị có 2 con nhỏ. Gia đình chị không chỉ làm ruộng, chăn nuôi nhiều ( có mô hình Vườn-Ao- Chuồng) mà còn bán các loại cám cho gia súc, gia cầm.Thu nhập của gia đình chị là khoảng 300.000 VND/tuần. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua lợn giống. Chị rất thích hình thức tiết kiệm để trả vốn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thùa (MS: 11020002),vay 2.006.000 VND để bán hàng tạp hóa. Chị Nguyễn Thị Sáu (MS: 11020003), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị Nghiêm Thị Hà (MS: 11020004), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Tuyết (MS: 11020005), vay 2.006.000 VND để bán hàng sắt và đồ điện. Chị Nguyễn Thị Cửi (MS: 11020006), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thinh (MS: 11020007), vay 1.534.000 VND để mua cám lợn.

loans.use: Invest in businesses

loans.name: Thi Hang

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hằng is 59 years old. She's requesting 2.478.000 VND to raise pigs. She also sells basic good at the market to increase her wages. This is her second loan with SEDA, the first one has been paid off. She likes SEDA program because she can pay back in installments.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Lợi is requesting 2.478.000 VND to buy wood. She makes furniture.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Nguyễn Thị Hằng (MS: 070014), năm nay 59 tuổi. Cô vay 2.478.000 VND về chăn nuôi lợn. Ngoài ra cô còn đi chợ để có thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Cô đã tham gia vay vốn được một chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt. Cô rất thích với hình thức trả góp này vì thu nhập của cô thường xuyên. Chị Nguyễn Thị Lợi (MS: 070033), vay 2.478.000 VND về mua thêm gỗ đóng bàn ghế bán.

loans.use: raise pigs

loans.name: Port

texts.en: Port S., 44 years old, lives in Kampong Cham Province where she has owned her farm since 1985. Both she and her husband are  traditional rice farmers, earning a little less than $3 per day combined. They have a large family of nine children, a necessity for rural farming families as children bring in much needed income once they can work and will care for the parents in their old age. Six of the children are still single, and only the oldest of this group currently works outside the farm, operating a motor-taxi for about $1.50 per day. Port S. hopes to support her next oldest son living at home to enter the same profession and is therefore requesting a loan to purchase a motor-bike for him.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Khac Cuong

texts.vi:
Mr Nguyễn Khắc Cương is 37 years old. He's requesting 2.478.000 VND for his wife. She sells basic goods at the market and works on their rice paddy. He is a construction worker. They have 3 children who are in school. This is his second loan with SEDA. He has paid off successfully the first one.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Anh Nguyễn Khắc Cương (MS: 070006), năm nay 37 tuổi. Anh vay 2.478.000 VND để cho vợ anh đi chợ mua bán phế liệu, ngoài ra chị còn làm thêm đồng ruộng. Anh thì đi làm thợ xây. Anh chị có 3 con hiện còn đang đi học. ( Anh Cương đã vay một kỳ và hiện nay đã hoàn trả hết ).

loans.use: sells basic goods

loans.name: Horm

texts.en:
Horm S., 61 years of age, lives in Kampong Cham Province where, despite being advanced in years, she and her husband work hard on a daily basis and maintain a household with five older children at home, two still in school and two working as laborers. She is a firewood saleswoman earning only $1 per day while her husband collects recyclable items from trash heaps and houses and earns a profit of $7.50 per day by selling them to local factories for reuse.

Horm S. would like to take out a loan to buy a plot of land on which she can build a solid home. The couple wants to be able to leave something behind for their younger children. With any left over cash, she plans to help her husband buy more recyclable items.

loans.use: To buy recyclable items and land.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: Chorn P. is 29 years of age, and from a young age she has helped operate a small grocery store and worked in the rice fields with her family. She currently earns $1 per day through these activities.  Her husband, Neang Sna,  37 years of age, is a blacksmith in Phnom Penh, a city that offers the best pay for his trade. He earns $3 per day and hopes to someday earn more. In order to better support him and their two children, Chorn P. wants to buy a good set of blacksmith tools for her husband to use and thereby eventually raise their income.

loans.use: To buy blacksmith tools.

loans.name: Bi

texts.en:
Bi S. is 35 years old and since 1998 has worked selling vegetables and other grocery products from a storefront outside her home. She earns $1.30 per day. Unfortunately, her husband is vastly underpaid as a government official in their home province of Kampong Cham, earning only $1.50 per day. The family has three children who are all currently enrolled in school.

Bi S.’s business saves her neighbors considerable time since they don’t have to go down to the market to buy their goods. She sees an opportunity to expand her client base and therefore wants to take out a small loan in order to start carrying fresh vegetables bought daily from the market place.

loans.use: To buy fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Nhum

texts.en: Nhum S. is an elderly widow living in Kampong Cham Province. She still farms the rice field that she and her husband used to own together. However, her labor alone barely earns her $1 per day. She has two children, both married, much to her personal joy. Her oldest, a mechanic at a high quality workshop, earns $300 per month and does much to support his elderly mother. She in turn wants to  care for him by taking out a loan to buy him high quality imported tools so he can continue to advance his career in this particular shop.

loans.use: To buy mechanic's tools.

loans.name: Eng Rang Group

texts.en: Mrs. Eng R. is the group leader of five members in Sdok Slat Village in Kampong Speu Province. Mrs. Eng R., 29, is a subsistence farmer, and she is always cooking food for her family. In her farming business, Mrs. Eng R. has faced an infertile field and a drought. Therefore, Mrs. Eng R. now wants a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the cultivatable land, and also to rent a pump to water her field. Her husband, Mr. Khorn Khoun, is a construction worker in the village, and he can generate a small income to support the family. Mrs. Eng R. is the mother of three children; one of the oldest children is employed in a garment factory. The second child died in a car accident. The last one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Eng R. has previously obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizers for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and rent a water pump

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng L. is a grocer in Haong Khvow Village in Kampong Speu Province. In addition to this business activity, Mrs. Seng L. is a subsistence farmer. In this business, she has insufficient draft animals to plow the field. Therefore, she asked for a loan to build her profit by buying two cows to plow her cultivatable land. Mrs. Seng L. is 29 and married with three children, one of whom is attending state school, while the other two are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Noeurn Nov, is a subsistence farmer and a motorbike driver with a cart in which he can transport his passengers for a fee. Previously, Mrs. Seng L. obtained a loan from AMK to start a grocery business. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows to plow her land

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn L., 37 years of age, lives in Kampong Cham Province, where she has been a farmer since 1998 and currently earns $2 per day. Her husband, Yeth Hay, raises ducks for a living and earns about $5 per day. Ducks are a delicacy in Khmer cuisine, a tradition that has its roots in Chinese culture. The family has five children who are still living in the family home.

Morn L. is mostly a subsistence farmer, providing food for her family. But she sees her husband’s business as the real source of income for her family. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy him a large supply of duck feed to have on hand in the future.

loans.use: To buy duck feed.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea M. is a grocer and farmer in Chamkar Sleng Villlag in Kampong Speu Province. These businesses activities are good, but Mrs. Kea M. still cannot support the family. In order to improve her family's situation, Mrs. Kea M. now wants to start a husbandry business, so she needs a loan to buy cows for breeding. She is 29 and the mother of two children, all of whom are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Touch Sam, is a motorbike taxi driver, and he usually assists his wife in the field, too. Last year, Mrs. Kea M. got typhoid, so the family spent a lot on unforeseen expenses. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cows for breeding

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam R., 36 years of age, lives in Kampong Cham Province where she is a vegetable seller earning $6 per day. In a country where the majority of the population is involved in rural farming, vegetable selling is a vital and competitive profession. Her husband runs a taxi route between Kampong Cham and Phnom Penh, earning about $10 per day. Both of their children are students in elementary school.

Sam R. wants to take out a fairly large loan for the purchase of a motorbike to transport vegetables and to increase her stock of vegetables. She believes this will make her business more competitive.

loans.use: To buy both a motorbike and vegetables.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son O., 46 years old, lives in Kampong Cham Province, where she and her daughter share a business selling charcoal from village to village. Together they earn $5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver who adds an additional $4 per day to the family income. Son O. is now requesting a loan to enhance her charcoal business. She plans to buy a trailer to hook up to the back of a motorbike to transport the charcoal each day from village to village. This will save her and her daughter both time and money.

Her husband, Bun Thob, is pictured here, as she was unavailable to be photographed.

loans.use: To buy a trailer.

loans.name: Noa

texts.en: Noa Synam, 27 years old, lives in Kampong Cham Province. Since 1995 she has run a small grocery store, earning about $3 per day. From their home her husband sells a hot soup that is typically eaten for breakfast with tea by Khmers on their way to work. He has had this small restaurant since 1998 and earns about $4 per day. They have one child, a good student at the local elementary school. With the loan they hope to be able to purchase extra tables and chairs to seat more customers each morning and benefit both their businesses.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Chhit

texts.en:
Chhit D., 37 years of age, lives in Kampong Cham Province, where she is a yam farmer earning $3 per day. This is a popular crop in Kampong Cham and she is fortunate to be able to earn that much. Her husband earns about $8 per day selling gasoline from a roadside stand. These stands usually consist of a manual pump attached to a barrel of gasoline with a meter to tell how much gas has been pumped. Together they support four children.

Chhit D. would now like to take out a loan to buy her husband a greater store of gasoline since the fuel has risen past $7 per gallon in Cambodia and it is becoming difficult for him to afford to buy it even by the barrel. Some of the loan will also go towards next year’s yam crop for her.

loans.use: To buy yam seed and gasoline.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang S. is 52 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. She is one vegetable seller out of many in the province and earns about 2 US$ per day. Her husband drives a horse drawn cart which is used to transport everything from fruit to people from place to place. He earns 2.50 US$ per day. They have two children but are too poor to be able to send both the kids to school consistently. Right now, the children help the parents in their work each day. Neang S. wants to apply her loan towards a new horse for her husband's business. Her husband is pictured here at the CREDIT office as she was unavailable to be photographed.

loans.use: To buy a horse.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin P. is a 26 year old housewife in Kampong Cham. She stays home to care for her young child. Her husband luckily has a good job as the head construction worker for a small firm. He earns 10 US$ per day and has opportunities to advance in the company. She knows his work is where the financial future of her family rests and would like to take out a loan to buy him valuable but expensive tools he will need to fully master his trade. Rin P.'s husband is pictured here as she was unavailable to be photographed.

loans.use: To buy construction tools.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin Y. is 43 years old and lives as a housewife in Kampong Cham. She manages the house and cares for her four children while her husband runs a motor-taxi to pay the bills. He does quite well for his profession and earns 8 US$ per day. Their oldest son works in the trucking business as a conductor, organizing routes and negotiating pay. He contributes well to the family income, earning 60 US$ per month. Rin Y. would like to buy her husband a new motorbike for his taxi business during this time of financial stability so they will not have to replace the bike anytime soon. Rin Y.'s husband is pictured here as she was unavailable to be photographed.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en: Mrs. Samorn N. is a subsistence farmer. In addition to this activity, she owns a grocery store in Peam Khlai Village in Kampong Speu Province. Although Mrs. Samorn N. has two business activities, her family's situation has not improved. So Mrs. Samorn N. asked for a loan to buy cows for breeding as well as to plow her rice field. Mrs. Samorn N. is the mother of four children, three of whom are studying in state school, while the youngest child stays at home. Her husband, Mr. Oeurng Bu, is a tractor driver. Previously, Mrs. Samorn N. obtained a loan to buy a big pot to produce a white wine to sell to a middleman and the villagers. Last year, Mrs. Samorn N.’s youngest child got a lung disease and she spent $75 to cure that disease. Her husband is also pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy cows for breeding and to plow her rice field

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn I. is a 29 year old female construction worker in Kampong Cham. It is rare for a female to work construction in Cambodia but she works alon side her husband for the same daily wage of 2.50 US$. The couple has one young child who goes to school each day despite his parents' low earning jobs. Vorn I. wants her child to stay in school but knows the family needs to earn more money to make this a reality. She hopes to buy a motorbike that will enable she and her husband to work multiple construction jobs each day, thus increasing their earning power.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Choun

texts.en: Mrs. Choun O. is a subsistence farmer in Srei Praseur Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a widowed mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other one is studying in high school. So in her family, Mrs. Choun O. has only two business activities; thus, she does not have enough money to build a new house to replace the old one. In order to finish her house, Mrs. Choun O. now needs to request a loan to buy more lumber to build the house. Previously, Mrs. Choun O. obtained a loan from AMK to buy pigs for breeding

loans.use: To build a new house to replace the old one

loans.name: Chhory

texts.en: Chhory S. is 38 years and sells yams in Kampong Cham province. She started her business only four years ago in 2004 and has carved out a niche for herself in the market, earning 6 US$ per day. Her husband runs a motor-taxi to contribute 4 US$ per day to the family income. The couple has one child who they currently are putting through school. Chhory S. wants to take out a loan to buy yams in bulk to boost her sales and savings for the future.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en: Mrs. Mach S. lives in Rolaing Chrey Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and grocer. In addition to these two business activities, she is a pig breeder. She now has insufficient money to buy pig food to feed her pigs, so she asked for a loan for this purpose. She is 48 and the widowed mother of three children. One of her children works in a garment factory, while another one is a construction worker, and the youngest child is studying in high school. Previously, Mrs. Mach S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy cows to work in her rice field.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: Noun P. is a vegetable seller in Kampong Cham. Her daily revenue amounts to 3 US$ per day. She is 37 years old and has had her vegetable selling business since the year 2000. Her husband operates a motor-taxi which earns him minimal wages. His profession is one that rarely offers consistent income. They have five children who also work hard to keep the family afloat. One of the older sons is a construction worker. Noun P. would like a loan to help her son develop his trade as a construction worker. If he can buy his own tool set he will be able to get more jobs or possibly even a permanent position. With the remainder of the loan she wants to install a water pump at her family home.

loans.use: To buy construction tools and a water pump.

loans.name: Chu

texts.en: Chu S. is 44 years old and a widow. She no longer works but has devoted herself wholly to managing her household and caring for her four children who live outside the family home. Her children provide the family income by working at garment factories throughout the area. Together, the three at factories provide their mother with 120 US$ per month. One of her other children is a construction worker and earns 60 US$ per month. She wants to take out a loan to give her children a bike to use to commute to work. Their family is fortunate in that they were able to even find work in their home province. Commonly families must send their daughters all the way to Phnom Penh to live in concrete block houses working 12 hour shifts at the factories there. With the motorbike they will be able to continue to come home each night.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha T. lives in Rolaing Chrey Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is 34 and is a subsistence farmer. Her husband, Mr. Ya Sun, is a tractor driver, and he generates a small income to support the entire family. Mrs. Sokha T. and her husband have six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while three others are enrolled in school. The youngest two are too young to work or study. Although the family has three business activities, Mrs. Sokha T. still has insufficient money to build a new house for the family; therefore, Mrs. Sokha T. asked for a loan to build a new house. Last year, Mrs. Sokha T. obtained a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and a pump to water her field. Her husband is also pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung C. T. is 38 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. She raises pigs for a living, earning about 6 US$ per day. Livestock is often a financially secure business for rural Khmers. Her husband earns 10 US$ per day managing construction sites for a local firm. Together they have three children. The oldest two children have already been brought under their father’s wing and do construction. They are young so each only earns 75 US$ per month. Ung C. T. wants to invest in her own business by storing up pig feed but also help out her husband and oldest children by providing them with fine sets of construction tools to use on bigger projects.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and construction tools.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen Y. E is 54 years old and lives as a housewife in Kampong Cham. Her husband is a low earning farmer making less than 1 US$ per day. The couple has four children. Their two oldest are already married and both live outside the family home. The younger two are also adults and no longer attend school. To support the family, one child works as a tailor in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Another is a clothing vendor at a market in Phnom Penh. She earns 6.50 US$ per day and both send a portion of their earnings home. Phnom Penh is the only large city in Cambodia. Therefore many rural families send their children there with hopes of making ends meet. Yen Y. E wants to purchase a stand in the marketplace for her daughter so she can increase her earnings and live more comfortably as well.

loans.use: To buy a market stand.

loans.name: Mut

texts.en: Mut C. is 42 years old. She lives in Kampong Cham and has been a housewife since 1998. Her husband Ang On is a simple construction worker. This is a recent job for him as he has had to work many different jobs over the years in order to make ends meet for them and their three children. He earns only 1.60 US$ per day. Construction is unreliable work if one is a basic laborer like Ang On. However if he can get his own higher quality tools and build up his skill then he will receive regular work at higher wages. This loan would go towards buying him those tools he needs.

loans.use: To buy construction tools.

loans.name: Muyang

texts.en: Susanna is a very hard working woman with 8 children. Since childhood she faced obstacles in life, which has made her to be determined to reach higher heights. So determined was she with her previous loans, she has been able to build a house where she lives with her children. She plans to educate her children and take good care of the health of her children. Susanna requests a loan to expand her business activity and buy a plot to farm great quantities of cassava. Cassava is in great demand in her community and she knows she will succeed because from her past experience. She plans to repay the loan in 24 months.

loans.use: To buy piglets and seedlings

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Born in 1952, Christina is married with five children. She became a member of GHAPE and received a first loan of $30. With this loan she started a business of cassava farming and pig rearing. Cassava is a starch food product which has many uses. It is used as food when boiled and in manufacturing garri starch which is used as a bleaching agent on clothes. The income helped her pay school fees for her children.
Christina requests a loan to buy piglets, fowls, and seeds. With the profits, she will be able to pay her children’s school fees, increase her business and live well with her family. She plans to pay her loan in 24 months.

loans.use: To buy piglets, seeds, fowls, and cloth

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch M. is 35 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. She lives at home with her elderly mother and father who help her care for her three children. She is a rice farmer working fields behind her home. Her earnings are meager at 1 US$ per day. Her husband is a tradesman specializing in carpentry. He earns 3 US$ per day making chairs, tables, and other such wooden items. Touch M. wants to help her husband expand his carpentry business by buying him better tools and a large stock of wood from which he can work on orders.

loans.use: To buy carpentry tools and wood.

loans.name: Num

texts.en: Num T. is a 54 year old widow in Kampong Cham province. She runs her household for her two children still living at home while they go out to work each day. One of her daughters owns a grocery store and earns 3 US$ per day while another child is a factory employee earning 2 US$ per day. Both her younger children are devoted to supporting their mother. Her oldest daughter is married and lives away. She sends her mother what she can, usually about 30 US$ per month. Num T. wants to provide for her children by purchasing more grocery products for her daughter’s store, and helping her married daughter open up a tailoring shop. There is no social securiT. system for elderly Khmers, and family is the only support system that Num T. can count on as she enters old age. This loan will go a long way towards securing that future.

loans.use: To open up a tailoring shop and to buy grocery products for store.

loans.name: Oibibi

texts.ru:
Oibibi T. has been in the agriculture for the last 20 years. Her occupation earns her profits, but for that, she needs to work with the soil and plant seeds on a timely basis. To obtain hight quality crops she plans to purchase natural fertilizers; however she doesn't have means to do so. For this reason, she is asking for a loan. Once she collects qulaity crops, she will be able to immeadiately sell it and provide for her 8 children. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Тагоймуродова Ойбиби занимается сельским хозяйством. Работает на земле уже 20 лет. Ее деятельность приносит доход , но для этого она должна своевременно обробатывать землю. Для того , чтобы получить качественный урожай клиентка запланировала купить качественные удобрения. Для этого у нее пока нет средств . Поэтому она обратилась к нам за помощью. Получив качественный урожай она сможет быстрее продать его и обеспечить своих восьмерых детей самым необходимым. Погасить кредит она планирет в течении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase natural fertilizers

loans.name: Bibiloik

texts.ru:
Bibloik M. lives in the town of Yavan. She lives with her family and takes care of the household. She is married and has 6 children. She is in agricultural business, and she owns a piece of land. She ususally plants wheat and flax. After collecting crops she prosesses and sells it. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She would like to obtain a loan so she could purchase fertilizers and corn seeds for the upcoming new season, since it is already time to collect wheat crops. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Мусоева Бибилоик живет в городе Яван. Домохозяйка . Живет со своей семьей . Она замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет землю . Засеивает пшеницу и лен. После получения урожая перерабатывает его и продает. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 20 лет. Хочет получить кредит для того . чтобы закупить удобрения и семена кукурузы для посева . Так как уже подходит врем я для сбора пшеницы.Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase natural fertilizers

loans.name: Asimjon

texts.ru:
Asimjon M. lives in the town of Yavan. He lives together with his family. He has 3 children. He has been in agriculture for the last 7 years. He owns his own land where he grows wheat. In order to obtain good quality crops, it is crucial to take care of the plants and add natural fertilizers. Natural fertilizers generally cost more and require additional funds. For this reason, he is seeking to obtain a loan so he could purchase the fertilizers. He lans to pay off the loan within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Маджидов Азимджон житель города Яван. Проживает со своей семьей. У него трое детей. Уже семь лет как он занимается сельским хозяйством. Он имеет дехканское хозяйство , где выращивает пшеницу. Для того . чтобы получить качественный урожай ухаживать за растениями нужно вовремя, удобрять качественными удобрениями . Покупка минеральных удобрений требует больших финансовых затрат. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит , для того , чтобы закупить удобрения. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase natural fertilizers

loans.name: Mahmadi

texts.ru:
Mahmadi U. lives in Yavan. He is a family man and has 8 children. Mahmadi is 59 years old and has been a farmer his entire life. He has land on which he plants wheat and flax. He sells his harvest and uses the profits to live on until the next harvest. Mahmadi’s children are not adults yet, but they still help their father. He has experienced small difficulties and would like to get a loan to purchase fertilizer. He will pay back the loan over an 18 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Юсупов Махмади житель города Яван. Семьянин , имеет восьмерых детей. Махмади 59 лет и ивсю свою жизнь он работает дехканином. Он имеет землю , которую засеивает пшеницей и льном. Получаемый урожай продает . а полученную прибыль запасается до следующего урожая. Дети еще не настолько взрослые , но все равно помогают отцу по хозяйству. Возникли небольшие трудности поэтому он хочет получить кредит и закупить минеральные удобрения. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase Fertilizer

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru:
Jumagul N. lives with her family in the Rudaki area. She owns a private cafeteria in Dushanbe. Because the place has become a little bit dirty it requires repairs. This is why Jumagul has decided to take out a loan. The loan will help her to improve working conditions and service quality. This will allow her to attract new customers and to increase her profits. She plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Неъматова Джумагшуль живет со своей семьей в районе Рудаки. Имеет частную стололвую в городе Душанбе. В связи стем , что помещение немного испачкалось его необходимо отремонтировать. Для этого Джумагуль решила получить кредит. Он поможет ей улучшить условия работы , а так же качество обслуживания. Это даст ей возможность привлеч новых клиентов и получать прибыль больше чем прежде. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Building Repairs

loans.name: Gairat

texts.ru:
Gairat K. lives in the Rudaki area. He lives with his family and is married with 3 children. He rents a van that he uses to provide local bus service. He has had this job for two years. His profits are small because he has to pay rent. Today he has been given the option to purchase goats for a very low price. This is why he decided to get a loan and to purchase these goats. In a month he will be able to sell them at a higher price which will allow him to get a large profit. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонов Гайрат проживает в районе Рудаки. Живет со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Арендует маршрутку , которую использует как маршрутное такси. Рабоьает так уже два года. Доходы не большие , так как приходится оплачивать арендную плату. В данный момент ему придложили купить коз по очень низкой цене. Поэтому он решил получить ткредит и купить этих коз. Через месяц он сможет продать их по более высокой цене. Это тпоможет ему получить более высокий доход. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase Goats

loans.name: Umarbek

texts.ru:
Umarbek S. lives in the Rudaki region. He lives with his family. He is married and has 3 children. He works as a construction worker. In addition he raises livestock. Umarbek purchases calves, fattens them and resells them at the market. He would like to increase his inventory and to take out a loan to do this. This will help to increase his profits. Umarbek will be able to pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Собиров Умарбек житель района Рудаки. Проживает со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Работает строителем по найму. Кроме того занимается животноводством.Покупает бычков . откармливает их и продает на рынке. Поэтому он хочет увеличить товарооборот и получить кредит. Это поможет увеличить прибыльность бизнеса. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. sells cosmetics and provisions. She is married, but her husband's income as a construction worker is not sufficient for Evelyn and their two children.

Evelyn has a list of customers but she is looking to expand her business and increase her profits. She is asking for a loan to purchase additional cosmetic products for resale.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of cosmetic products available for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy E. sells fabric/ She is married, but her husband's income from his own sales is not sufficient for Dorothy and their two children.

Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita T. sells maize. She is married, but her husband's income from his job as a mason is not sufficient to support Rita and their two children.

She has a good following but is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for a loan to purchase a larger inventory of maize for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more maize

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en: Nemat H. is 44 years old. Nemat and his wife are raising their three children with love and trying to ensure their kids having everything that a teenager may need. Nemat is working hard to get a better lifestyle and rise out of poverty. He has a workshop where he is providing the service of a master. He is repairing electronic items such as: TVs, tape recorders, radios, etc. At the same time on his day off he sells dried fruits in the local market. Today Nemat requests $950 US Dollars to purchase spare parts for TVs and to increase the range of his dried fruits. He hopes to increase his income and be able to send his sons to university. He promises to repay the loan within 6 months and your support will really help. Be an important part of the growth of Nemat’s business. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Nemat would like to purchase spare parts for his electronic repairs company and dried fruits to sell at his fruit stall.

loans.name: Ajowa

texts.en:
Ajowa D. sells yams, which are very popular in Ghana. She is a widow and her income as a single mother is not enough to raise her two children.

Ajowa is requesting a loan to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of yams for resale.

loans.name: Mamee

texts.en:
Mamee A. sells food products to other villagers. She is married, but her husband's income from his job as a motor repairman is not sufficient for Mamee and their two children.

Demand for her products is high and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. A loan will allow her to increase her inventory of products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional food products for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en: Khursheda K. is 28 years old. She is married and has three children of school age. Khursheda’s children are small now, but she is already working hard in order to ensure the best future for them. Her husband is a woodworker. Khursheda sells dried apricots in the central local market. As a rule she purchases apricots in the market and dries them herself. She has been in this business for 11 years already. Dried fruits, especially dried apricots, are very popular in Tajikistan, and they are very healthy. Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, Khursheda's business is quite successful and brings the family a stable income. Today Khursheda requests $850 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. She is going to spend the loan purchasing apricots with the purpose of drying them in order to increase the range of goods she can sell. Khursheda expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Khursheda would like to purchase apricots in order to increase the range of goods she sells.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah A. sells maize and gari, a popular local dish. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Sarah and their four children. Demand for her food products is high and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

Sarah is asking for a loan to purchase additional food products for resale..

loans.use: To purchase additional food products and expand her business.

loans.name: Ružica

texts.en: Ružica is a single woman from the town of Derventa. She works and her monthly salary is 400 KM. This would be her first loan from MCO WWI; she is requesting 1,000 KM. She would use the loan to buy rose seedlings, which she would plant and sell. Ružica hopes to increase her monthly revenue in order to buy more rose seedlings, cultivate them, and sell them.

loans.use: To buy rose seedlings

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita H. sells second hand clothing. She is married, but her husband's income from his job as a driver is not sufficient to support Rita and their three children. Demand for her clothing is high and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

Rita is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional clothing inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Tatjana

texts.en: Tatjana is a single woman from the town of Derventa. She works and her monthly salary is 400 KM. She does not have any children. This would be her first loan from MCO WWI, and she is requesting 600 KM. She will use this loan to work to become a florist, and will use the loan to purchase flower seedlings and agricultural tools. Tatjana hopes to expand a flower cultivation operation and generate future revenues through the sales of the flowers that she grows.

loans.use: To purchase  flower seedlings

loans.name: Nazirjon

texts.en: This is Nazirjon M., who is married with five children. He is 48 years old and lives in Isfara town, Tajikistan. He has a retail shop and he is the one to support his family with this business. Nazirjon sells spare parts for foreign cars like Mercedes-Benz and Opel. He has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. He provides the cars with spare parts and his family with the necessary food and needs. Nazirjon has a great demand for his spare parts thus he wants to buy more spare parts in order to be in requisition of his clients. He hopes to increase his income and be able to send his two elder sons to the University. He wants to take out an individual loan for $900 US Dollars to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop to meet the requirement of his clients and make a good income for his family. The loan will be repaid within 8 months. Nazirjon is happy about this loan and would like to thank everyone for your trust and promises to be precise in the loan payment.

loans.use: Nazirjon would like to purchase spare parts for cars to sell.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en: Dilrabo N. is 23 years old and married. Her husband is a student. For about four years Dilrabo has been running her own business, a tailoring shop. Currently there are four sewers working in the shop. Dilrabo specializes in sewing European-style clothing for women as well as clothes of the national style. She wants to make herself more popular in the city and expand her business. Today Dilrabo is planning to expand her business and to purchase modern summer fabrics in order to meet the requirements of her customers. So she requests $1000 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. The loan will be for purchasing new modern summer fabrics produced in Dubai. Dilrabo is counting on your help and would like to thank everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Dilrabo would like to purchase a new sewing machine to expand her business.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua K. sells palm oil. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Afua and her six children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for $300 of additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra P. is 35 years old and the loving mother of three children of school age. Gulchehra sells fruits and vegetables like apples, apricots, strawberries, bird-cherries, tomatoes, cucumbers and others in the central local market. She has been in this business already for 14 years. Over these years Gulchehra has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, she knows how to store the fruits so that they keep their marketable conditions and don't lose the taste and useful properties.

Being located in the biggest central market, Gulchehra's business has great clientele and is rather stable, generating the main income allowing her to support her family. Gulchehra has proved herself as an honest and reliable client. Today she requests $900 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Gulchehra plans to spend the loan to purchase fruits in order to increase the range of goods she sells. She would like to thank all for supporting her and promises to manage the current loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Gulchehra would like to purchase fruits and vegetables in order to increase the range of goods to sell.

loans.name: Biloliddin

texts.en: Biloliddin S. is 28 years old and married with 2 children. Biloliddin runs his own café where he cooks shish kebab. His café is located in the central local market. He has been in this business already for 10 years. Biloliddin is trying to use only the best inputs in his café. For example he breeds his own cattle. Part of the meat he sells for meat and part he utilizes in his café. His elder son helps his father in the café and probably with time will inherit the business. The café and cattle breeding are the main sources of income for the family. Today Biloliddin requests $900 US Dollars for the term of 8 months. He is planning to purchase two cows and coal for his café for cooking shish kebab. Having the positive credit history, Biloliddin is sure he shall pay this loan also in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of 2 cows and coal for his café in which he is cooking shish kebab.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa A. sells palm oil. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Adjowa and her 4 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Mohijon

texts.en:
Mohijon S. is 54 years old. She and her husband have raised four children. Two of Mohijon's sons help her in the business. She bakes the national bread “lepeshka”. The family works hard; they start baking the “lepeshka” early in the morning so that their customers shall have fresh bread in the morning. They go to bed late in the night after making dough and preparing the firewood and coal for baking the next day.

Mohijon has great customers, so she sells the majority of her products just from her place. However, she is also running a trading place in the central local market for selling the”lepeshka”. Thus, keeping the business stable, Mohijon helps her husband in supporting their family and allowing her sons to have a significant source of income. Now Mohijon requests $300 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. She is planning to purchase flour wholesale required for her business. Mohijon is grateful for all those supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Mohijon would like to purchase flour wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia N. sells palm oil. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Cynthia and her three children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Rafiya

texts.en:
Rafiya T. is 42 years old and married. She is the loving mother of three children. Her eldest daughter is studying at the university and her sons are of school age. Her husband is a teacher of chemistry. Rafiya is a seamstress. She sewsthe national style of dresses for women and girls. Rafiya works at home, accepting orders and creating them. She has been in this business for more than six years. Rafiya purchases the fabrics required for sewing by herself in the market. Rafiya is a very popular seamstress and has lots of orders. The business is stable, generating considerable income for the family.

Rafiya is applying for a loan for the first time. She is requesting 2000 Somoni ($600 US Dollars) for the term of 10 months to purchase a new sewing machine. Rafiya thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate in loan repayment.

loans.use: Rafiya would like to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Javlyanbek

texts.en:
Javlyanbek M. is 54 years old and married with three children. Javlyanbek provides taxi service in his vehicle. He has been in this business for ten years already. He has many years' experience driving a taxi, which he does for a living five days a week. At the same time he raises calves. Javlyanbek buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells them on the same market at a more profitable price. His sons and wife help him with the feeding and looking after the calves.

Javlyanbek is trying to make his business stable. These businesses generate income that allows Javlyanbek to support his family. As long as Javlyanbek wants to provide the taxi services of high quality, he is going to have to fix his car. In order to do this he needs to purchase the spare parts. And he is also planning to purchase more calves. With this purpose he requests $1000 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Javlyanbek had already proved himself as a reliable client and today he also promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Javlyanbek would like to purchase spare parts to repair his car and also to buy calves to raise.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba F. sells palm oil. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Araba and her five children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Khayrullo

texts.en: N. Khayrullo is 54 years old. He is married with two children. His sons are already married and help their father in his business as well as Khayrullo's daughter-in-law, who is pictured as Khayrullo left that day for the market. Khayrullo is a cattleman. Khayrullo buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. Now Khayrullo has got 4 cows in his household. This family business is very stable, generating the main income for the family. Khayrullo has already been loaned by IMON and shown himself as an accurate client with a positive credit history. Today he requests $750 US Dollars for the term of 12 months as he is planning to increase his cattle stock and purchase calves. Khayrullo thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Khayrullo would like to purchase calves.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua N. sells fruits and vegetables, cassava, yams, and other food commodities. She is married, but her husband's income from farming is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Akosua and her three children. Demand for her food is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aminatou B. was born on November 3, 1968 in Mango, in the county of Oti in the far north of Togo. She is married and the mother of three children. She has lived in the neighborhood called Nukafu since 1995 and her primary business is the sale of rice and peanut fritters. In the beginning, she made and sold only peanut fritters, but with her first loan of US$ 725 from WAGES, she added the sale of rice to her initial business.

The loan she is presently requesting will allow her to purchase 9 sacks of rice and 2 sacks of peanuts.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame B. Aminatou est née le 03 novembre 1968 à Mango dans la préfecture de l’Oti à l’extrême nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle habite dans le quartier de Nukafu depuis 1995 et a pour activité principale la vente du riz et de beignet d’arachide. A ses début, elle ne fabriquait et vendait que des beignets d’arachides mais avec le premier d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA qu’elle a obtenu auprès de WAGES, elle a ajouté la vente du riz a son activité initiale.

Le crédit actuel qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter neuf (9) sacs de riz et deux (2) sacs d’arachides.

loans.use:
Purchase of rice and peanuts

Achat de riz et d'arachides

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: Marhabo T. is 55 years old and married with three children. Her children are married and they have got their own children who adore their grandparents. Marhabo’s husband is currently unemployed and that is why she is the main bread-winner in the family. For 10 years already Marhabo has been breeding cattle. Currently she is breeding 4 cows. Her son helps her and her husband sells the meat of the cattle in the market. So this family business brings the stable income for the family of Marhabo. Marhabo is planning to expand her business and to purchase calves. For this reason she requests $1000 US Dollars. Part of the loan she will spend to purchase fodder. Being very accurate by her nature, Marhabo promises to pay the loan timely and precisely. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Marhabo would like to purchase calves and fodder to expand her cattle breeding business.

loans.name: Yacoubou

texts.fr:
Mr. Ycoubou A., a laboratory technologist, was born on December 10, 1974 in Anonoé in the county of Wawa. He is married and the father of three children. In 1990, after having obtained his degree, he opened a clinic called "Clinique Gracia" in the Bè neighborhood in Lomé. Sometimes he has difficulties with medical equipment.

This first loan that he is requesting will permit him to acquire a microscope and reagents so that he can better care for his patients.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Yacoubou est un laborantin né le 10 décembre 1974 à Anonoé dans la préfecture de Wawa. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. En 1990 après l’obtention de son diplôme de fin d’étude, il a ouvert une clinique dénommée « CLINIQUE GRACIA » dans le quartier de Bè à Lomé. Parfois il est confronté aux difficultés d’équipement médical.

Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir un microscope et des réactifs pour pouvoir mieux prendre soins de ses patients.

loans.use:
Purchase of a microscope

Achat d'un microscope

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr:
Miss Aïcha A. was born on September 14, 1977 in Atakpamé in Ogou County. She is single and her primary business is selling cereals in Agoè Assiyéyé market. Her business consists in purchasing from farmers in out-lying farms and selling the cereals she buys in Lomé. She reinvests the profit she makes into her business so that she can have a large inventory. Her goal is to be the biggest cereals merchant in Agoè market.

The loan that she is presently requesting will allow her to purchase 7 sacks of corn containing 60 bowls each.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mademoiselle A. Aïcha est née le 14 septembre 1977 à Atakpamé dans la préfecture de l’Ogou. Elle est célibataire. Elle a pour activité principale le commerce des céréales dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé. Son activité consiste à acheter auprès des agriculteurs dans les fermes reculées et de les revendre à Lomé. Avec le revenu que lui procure cette activité, elle réinvestie dans ce commerce pour pouvoir avoir un grand étalage. Son objectif est d’être la plus grande commerçante de céréales dans le marché d’Agoè.

Ainsi le crédit actuel qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter sept (7) sacs de maïs d’une contenance unitaire de 60 bols.

loans.use:
Purchase of 7 sacks of corn

Achat de 7 sacs de maïs

loans.name: Beza-Tokoum

texts.fr:
Born in 1967 in Tchitchao in Koza County, Mrs. Beza-Tokoum E. is a widow raising two children. In 2000, she opened a little shop selling general merchandise and fruit juice in the neighborhood of Agoè.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to expand into selling drygoods. She will use this loan to purchase 12 cartons of sewing thread and other related articles. With the income from these two businesses, she will be able to support her two children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1967 à Tchitchao dans la préfecture de la Koza, madame E. Beza-Tokoum est une veuve ayant deux (2) enfants à charge. Elle a ouvert en l’an 2000 un magasin de vente de produits génériques et de jus de fruits dans le quartier d’Agoè.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de débuter une nouvelle activité de vente des produits de mercerie. Ainsi, elle utilisera ce crédit pour acheter douze (12) cartons de fil à coudre et quelques produits génériques. Avec le revenu de ces deux activités elle pourra subvenir aux besoins de ses deux enfants.

loans.use:
Purchase of dressmaking supplies

Achat des produits de mercerie

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Komla Adjato

texts.fr:
Born in Tohoun in 1985, Mr. Komla Adjato A. is single. In 2005, he opened a general store in the district of Agoè near the market. In his shop, ETS AKAS, he sells milk, canned goods, soaps and detergents, etc. His location allows him to do a good business since he is alone in this area. On days when the market is not busy, Mr. Komla Adjato A. has a hefty turnover.

This first loan that he is requesting will allow him to stock up on certain non-perishable items. He would like to buy 10 sacks of rice and 8 sacks of granulated sugar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né à Tohoun en 1985, Monsieur A. Komla Adjato est célibataire. Il a crée en 2005, un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè près du marché. Dans son magasin « ETS AKAS », il vend du lait, des boites de conserves, des savons etc. Sa situation géographique lui permet de mieux vendre car il est le seul dans ce milieu. Les jours aux quels le marché ne s’anime pas, monsieur A. Komla Adjato réalise de gros chiffre d’affaires.

Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra de faire un approvisionnement des certains produits non périssables. Il désire acheter aussi dix (10) sacs de riz et huit (8) sacs de sucre en poudre.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 sacks of rice and 8 sacks of granulated sugar

Achat de 10 sacs de riz et de 8 sacs de sucre en poudre.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa A. extracts palm oil. She sells her oil to a local soap manufacturer. She is married, but her husband's income from farming is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Adjowa and her eight dependents. Demand for her palm oil is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Djariatou

texts.fr:
Born in 1971 in Sokodé in the central part of the country, Mrs. Djariatou A. is married and the mother of two children. In 2007, she opened a general store in the district of Agoè in Lomé. Her manner of welcoming and serving her customers allows her to do a good business and make an acceptable profit. She is a dynamic woman who is greatly helping her husband in supporting their family.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 8 sacks of rice, 6 sacks of sugar, and 5 tins of oil. With this merchandise, she will be able to improve her inventory and sell more.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1971 à Sokodé dans la région centrale, madame A. Djariatou est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. En 2007, elle a ouvert une boutique de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. L’accueil qu’elle réserve et donne au client, lui permet de bien vendre et de dégager un bénéfice acceptable. C’est une femme dynamique qui aide beaucoup son mari dans les dépenses de sa famille.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 8 sacs de riz, 6 sacs de sucre et 5 bidons d’huile. Avec ces marchandises, elle pourra améliorer son stock et mieux vendre.

loans.use:
Purchase of 8 sacks of rice, 6 sacks of sugar, and 5 tins of oil

Achat de 8 sacs de riz, de six (6) sacs de sucre et de 5 bidons d'huile

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hai Tarawa 2003-1 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Sara M.. She sells beer at her bar and is requesting a loan to expand the bar. Sara is 37 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children, ranging from ages 2 to 20, who go to school. Each week, Sara makes approximately 240 sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Sara is joined in her small group by Agnes G., Jusphine G., Stella K., and Grace D.. Agnes G. bakes bread and wants to buy a car. Jusphine G. sells local brewed alcohol and wants a loan to pay school fees for her children. Stella K. sells green vegetables at the market and wants to expand her business. Grace D. sells bread and is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: expand the business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC South Sudan - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Jalil

texts.en: Jalil K. is 53 years old, married and he and his wife raised three children. All of their children are married except one who lives at home. Jalil sells clothing and shoes for women in the local central market which is called “Panjshanbe”. Once a week Jalil travels to the neighboring city Istaravshan to purchase new goods to sell. His younger son (who is pictured in the photo) helps Jalil with the business. Jalil and his son are very polite and open people by nature, and this helps them in their business. For 10 years he has managed to have great clientele. Jalil‘s business is stable and brings the main income, allowing his family to improve their living conditions and make their plans for the future. This year is very important for Jalil as he is going to arrange the marriage of his elder son. For this reason he wants to increase the range of his goods. With this purpose he requests $600 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. The loan will be spent on new summer clothing and shoes for women. Jalil would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in time. Jalil is counting on your help. With your help he can arrange the marriage of his dear eldest son.

loans.use: Jalil would like to purchase of the new clothing and shoes for women in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dodji D. was born on May 29, 1965 in Lomé. She is married and is the mother of four children. In 2001, she opened a dressmaking shop she calls COUTURE LA VICTOIRE, in the district of Agoè. The fashions she creates and the rapidity of her service have won her the confidence of her clientele.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to acquire a second sewing and embroidery machine to better serve her customers and make her apprentices' work easier.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame D. Dodji est née le 29 mai 1965 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. En 2001, elle a ouvert son atelier de couture dénommé « COUTURE LA VICTOIRE » dans le quartier d’Agoè. Les modes qu’elle créées et la rapidité dans ses services sont des atouts pour elle à gagner la confiance de ses clients.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir une deuxième machine à plinte pour mieux servir ses clients et de mettre à l’aise ses apprentis.

loans.use:
Purchase of a sewing and embroidery machine

Achat d'une machine à plinte

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa M. sells palm oil. Palm oil is very popular in Ghana. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Adjoa and her four dependents. Demand for her palm oil is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Hanu Kafui

texts.fr:
Mrs. Hanu W. was born on December 31, 1972 in Mission Tové. She is married. She sells rice and rice porridge in the district of Agoè.

Her business consists in selling rice during the mornings and rice porridge in the evenings. Her location next to a big bar called "BAR BKS" which attracts a lot of customers permits her a good turnover.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 6 sacks of rice.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame W. Hanu est née le 31 décembre 1972 à Mission Tové. Elle est une femme mariée. Elle est revendeuse de riz et de bouillie dans le quartier d’Agoè.

Son activité consiste à faire la restauration du riz dans la matinée et faire celle de la bouillie le soir. Son lieu d’activité est situé à côté d’un grand bar dénommé « BAR BKS » qui accueille beaucoup de personnes ce qui lui permet de bien vendre.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter Six (6) sacs de riz.

loans.use:
Purchase of 6 sacks of rice

Achat de 6 sacs de riz

loans.name: Block C North 2003-5 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Rose P.. She sells beer and is requesting a loan to open a bar at the market. Rose is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children ranging from 7 to 15 years of age, and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately 80 sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar.

Rose is joined in her small group by P. S., Juru L., Ruth K., and Jane A.. P. S. has a business selling vegetables at her home and wants to build a house. Juru L. sells charcaol and wants a loan to pay school fees for her children. Ruth K. sells bread and wants to open a bakery. Jane A. sells vegetables and is requesting a loan to buy a generator.

loans.use: To open a bar at the market

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC South Sudan - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela W. is a provisions seller. She sells things such as tins of fish, sugar, tea, and rice. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Angela and her two children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Salamatou B. was born on December 31, 1968 in Dapaong, in the far north of Togo. She is married and the mother of three children. Since 2001 she has been selling cereals but she is specialized in the sale of corn.

This first loan she is requesting in the amount of US$ 725 will allow her to acquire four big sacks of corn so that she can increase her income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame B. Salamatou est née le 31 décembre 1968 à Dapaong à l’extrême nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Depuis 2001, elle exerce le commerce de vente des céréales mais elle s’est spécialisée dans la vente du maïs.

Le premier crédit d’un montant de 300.000FCFA qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir quatre (4) grands sacs de maïs afin d’améliorer ses revenus.

loans.use:
Purchase of 4 sacks of corn

Achat de 4 sacs de maïs

loans.name: Saratou

texts.fr:
Miss Saratou A. was born on January 14, 1974 in Lomé. She lives in the district of Totsi in Lomé and is engaged in ambulant sales of lengths of African print cloth and costume jewelry. She covers a distance of about 12 kilometers on foot. She's a dynamic woman whose goal is to be able to set up a sales point in one of the marketplaces.

With this in mind, she is requesting a loan of US$ 725 to purchase costume jewelry and 20 lengths of cloth so as to have a more attractive inventory and make more sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mademoiselle A. Saratou est née le 14 janvier 1974 à Lomé. Elle habite dans le quartier de Totsi à Lomé et est une revendeuse ambulante de pagnes et de bijoux. Elle parcourt à pieds environs une distance de 12 km. Elle est une femme dynamique qui a un projet de s’installer dans l’un des marchés de la place. A cet effet, elle sollicite un crédit de 300.000FCA pour acheter des bijoux et 20 pièces de pagnes en vue d’avoir un stock attrayant et de mieux vendre.

loans.use:
Purchase of 20 lengths of African print cloth

Achat de 20 pièces de pagnes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Atsoupé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Atsoupé G. was born on July 21, 1974 in Lomé. She is a married mother of two children. Her business consists of selling food and drinks. In 2001, she opened a bar-restaurant named “Bar Desiadenyo” in the Agbalépédo neighborhood in Lomé. Her business is located near the neighborhood bus station, which brings many customers to her restaurant. This first loan she is requesting will allow her to purchase 50 units of yams, three bags of corn and 12 cases of beer.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame G. Atsoupé est née le 21 juillet 1974 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la restauration et la vente de boissons. C’est en 2001 qu’elle a ouvert un Bar restaurant qu’elle nomme « BAR DESIADENYO » dans le quartier d’Agbalépédo à Lomé. Son lieu d’activité est situé près de la gare routière du quartier ; ce qui fait qu’il y a beaucoup d’affluence dans son restaurant. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter cinquante (50) tubercules d’ignames, trois (3) sacs de maïs et douze (12) casiers de bière.

loans.use: Purchase of root vegetables

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame T. is a palm oil extractor. Palm oil is very popular for cooking in Ghana. He is married, but his wife's income from farming does not cover the expenses for Kwame and his four children. Demand for his palm oil is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase the profits he brings back to his family.

He is asking for $500 in additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business

loans.name: Afua Enyonam

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afua Enyonam Z. was born on December 31, 1966 in Kpélé-Tsavié, in the Kloto prefecture. She is a divorced mother of two children. She runs a restaurant business in the Adidiogomé neighborhood in Lomé, where she sells rice, pounded corn paste and pounded yam paste. She started her business in 2007 and has been able to attract many customers, which has been the key to her success, as there are many other women who have similar businesses in the neighborhood. This first loan she is requesting will allow her to purchase 20 bags of yams, four bags of rice and six bags of corn.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Z. Afua Enyonam est née le 31 décembre 1966 à Kpélé-Tsavié dans la préfecture de Kloto. Elle est divorcée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la restauration dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle fait la restauration du riz, de la pâte du maïs, de la pâte d’igname. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2007 et a une bonne stratégie d’accueil des clients, c’est d’ailleurs ce qui fait sa force de résistance puisse qu’elles sont nombreuses à exercer la même activité dans le quartier. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter vingt (20) tubercules d’ignames, quatre (4) sacs de riz et six (6) sacs de maïs.

loans.use: Purchase of root vegetables for her restaurant

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.es:
Nazaria Britez started selling clothing about two years ago. This was a very good experience for her because she learned how to treat customers and improve her selling techniques. She is currently an owner of a store situated in the municipal market of Luque. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase clothing for the winter season such as jackets, boots, fleece coats, pullovers among others for their eventual sale. Nazaria is a very generous person who creates sources of work for her family.

Nazaria's family consists of her two children; Cintia is 24 years old and a licensed beautician and Hernan is three years old. According to Nazaria, the reason why she works is the desire to move her children ahead and provide for all that their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Nazaria Britez inicio vendiendo ropas hace aproximadamente dos anos. Esta experiencia le sirvió mucho debido a que aprendió como tratar a los clientes y mejorar sus técnicas de ventas. Actualmente es dueña de una tienda situada en el mercado municipal de Luque. Y solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de invierno como sacos, camperas, poleras, pullovers, entre otros para su posterior venta. Nazaria es una persona muy generosa que crea fuentes de trabajo para sus familiares.

La familia de Nazaria esta conformada por sus dos hijos, Cintia de 24 años, licenciada en estadística y Hernán de tres años. Según Nazaria, la razón por la que trabaja son las ganas de sacar adelante a sus hijos y proveerle todo lo que necesiten.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for the fall and winter seasons.

loans.name: Yawa Eléonore Zita

texts.fr:
Mrs. Yawa Eléonore Zita T. was born on August 16, 1973 in Kpadapé, in the Kloto prefecture. She is single and has one child. Since 1995, she has been selling traditional African cloth and charcoal. Seventy percent of her capital is dedicated to selling charcoal. She earns a decent income from these sales, as she is able to sell both wholesale and retail. Her primary suppliers are farmers from the plateau region. Her first loan, which she quickly repaid, allowed her to purchase her supplies for last year. This second loan she is requesting will allow her to purchase 35 bags of charcoal in order to boost her sales.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame T. Yawa Eléonore Zita est née le 16 Août 1973 à Kpadapé dans la préfecture de Kloto. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant à charge. Depuis 1995, elle exerce le commerce de pagne et de charbon. 70% de son fonds de commerce est alloué à l’activité de charbon de bois.
