loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, rice, noodles etc.

loans.name: Luisa  Reyna

texts.es:
In the sector of Somotillo of the city of Chinandega, Luisa R. has devoted herself to the sale of clothing on the street for the past six years in order to support herself and her home.

Since she began this business, she has been able to provide for her home. To do so she has depended on the support of the loans made by Ceprodel. Today she needs to purchase merchandise. More specifically, she is searching for the support of Ceprodel in order to be able to buy shirts and pants that she will sell in her area.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Luisa Rodríguez se dedica desde hace seis años al negocio de venta de ropa ambulante con el objetivo de llevar a su hogar de habitación el mantenimiento para salir adelante y poder subsistir.

Desde que inició este negocio de venta ambulante ha logrado suplir las necesidades de su hogar y para ello se ha apoyado de los créditos proporcionados por Ceprodel. Hoy en día su necesidad es la compra de la mercadería y es por esto que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de camisas y pantalones para comercializarlos en su sector.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel S. is from the sector of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. She is a very hard-working woman with the goal of providing her two young children the best conditions in which to live. Her business for the past four years has been the sale of materials in her sector, offering her clients the materials that they come to buy.

In order to grow and develop her business, she is currently seeking support from Ceprodel to obtain the credit necessary to buy her materials. She trusts that she will be given credit and will thus be able to succeed with her business and be able to provide for her children, who so depend on her.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Anabel Sánchez es originaria del municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una dama muy esforzada en su trabajo con el único fin de brindarles a sus dos pequeños hijitos las mejores condiciones para vivir. Su negocio desde hace cuatro años ha sido la venta de granos básicos en su sector ofreciéndolos a sus clientes que la visitan para realizar sus compras.

En vistas de crecer y desarrollarse en el negocio, hoy en día ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de sus granos básicos. Es por este motivo que espera muy confiadamente a que su crédito le sea otorgado y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio beneficiando a sus hijos que tanto necesitan de ella.

loans.use: Purchasing materials

loans.name: Zenelia Alaniz

texts.es:
Zanelia Z. is from Condega, where she has for the past few years devoted herself to the business of agriculture. More specifically, she cultivates corn and beans, a task with which she needs technical assistance in order to obtain a good, abundant harvest.

The purpose of her efforts is to provide for her little boy. For this reason, she has decided to invest in the improvement of her business by applying for credit at Ceprodel so that she can find technical assistance for her cultivation. Through this credit, she and her son will benefit given that the technical assistance will guarantee an excellent harvest.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Zenelia Z. es originaria del municipio de Condega donde desde hace varios años se ha dedicado al negocio de agricultura dando lugar al cultivo de maíz y frijoles los cuales les brinda asistencia técnica para al final obtener una cosecha abundante y en buen estado.

Sus fuertes trabajos que ella realiza los debe a su pequeño hijo que necesita de su madre por ser menor de edad, es por este motivo que comprometida con el bienestar de su hijo ha decidido invertir en el mejoramiento de su negocio por medio de la solicitud de crédito que ha hecho en Ceprodel para dar asistencia técnica a sus cultivos. Por medio de este crédito se beneficiara ella y su pequeño hijo ya que al darle asistencia técnica al cultivo garantizará una excelente cosecha.

loans.use: Technical assistance for cultivation

loans.name: Aracelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Aracelly V. dedicates herself to selling food out of her home. She lives in the "Ariel Darce" neighborhood. She is 34 years old, married, and has two young children. Thirteen years ago she began her business selling food with the help of her husband, who is the warehouse manager of a business in Managua. She wants to insure a storefront that she has had for awhile so she can put in a new grocery store. She needs this loan to be able to purchase construction materials to make improvements to her home and to the new location that can make her business more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Aracelly V. se dedica a la vnta de comida en su casa habitación. Habita en el barrio Ariel Darce. Tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, con 2 hijos menores de edad. Hace 13 años empezo el negocio de la venta de comida cn la ayuda de su esposo, quien es Resnsable de Bodega una empresa de managua. Ella desea poder asegurar el local para poner nuevamente una pulpería, que ya hace tiempo habia tenido. Requiere del rstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras en su casa de habitación y el local que le pueda dar seguridad a su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make improvements to her home and business.

loans.name: Karen Maritza

texts.es:
Karen Martiza lives in the "Arlen Siu" neighborhood in the city of Managua. She is married and has two dependent children. Her husband owns a taxi cab, where he works every day. She is 23 years old, and has three years of experience working in a supermarket. She will continue to work hard there so she can keep her job and improve their home. With this loan, she intends to buy construction materials to build a front wall for their house. Through hard work, she and her husband hope to be able to send their two children to school so that they can be well off in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Karen Maritza habita en el barrio Arlen Siu de la ciudad de Managua, es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Su esposo es dueño de una unidad de taxi, y en él trabaja todos los días. Karen Maritza tiene 23 años de edad y tiene 3 años de estar trabajando en un supermercado. Seguirá trabajando duro para conservar su empleo, y así mejorar su vivienda. Con este préstamo pretende comprar materiales de construcción para hacer el muro delantero de su casa de habitación. Con su esfuerzo y el de su marido espera poder darle estudios a sus 2 hijos para que sean personas de bien en un futuro

loans.use: Build a wall in the entrance of their residence

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Ms. Natividad is a 57 years old widow, who lives in the Hugo Chávez neighborhood. She has two children who work and are independent.

Ms. Natividad has had a grocery store for seven years. Meager sales volumes are amongst the difficulties she faces. With the loan, she intends to buy basic products to offer to her clients, in order to sell more and obtain a greater profit. Her future plans include the improvement of her store’s infrastructure and the increase in her merchandise stock, in order to improve her life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Natividad tiene 57 años de edad, es viuda, y habita en el barrio Hugo Chávez. Tiene dos hijos que trabajan y son independientes.

Doña Natividad tiene una pulpería y lleva siete años de experiencia. Entre las dificultades son las ventas bajas, que muchas veces son superables. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos básicos para tener bastante para ofrecer a sus clientes y vender más y obtener más ganancias. Sus planes futuros son mejorar la infraestructura del negocio y hacer más grande la pulpería con diversos productos, y así mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of basic products for her grocery store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Luz De Lourdes

texts.es:
Mrs. Luz lives in the "14th of February" neighborhood, is 35 years old, married, and has three children in school. Her husband works at a business as an accountant and supports the household's income needs.

Luz has a general store and also sells clothing and other articles. She has four years of experience and began with her own money. The loan that she is requesting is for cash to invest in whole grains and purchasing clothing that will fill her general store. That way, she will be able to offer her customers a wider variety of products that are useful to them. In the future, she hopes to expand her business, gaining more customers, and provide her children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Luz habita en el barrio 14 de Febrero, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, con tres hijos que están estudiando, su esposo trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose como contador y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Doña Luz tiene una pulpería y también vende ropa y otros, ella tiene cuatro años de experiencia y comenzó con fondos propios, con el préstamo que le otorguen es para capital de trabajo en la inversión de granos básicos y comprar ropa para tener llena la pulpería y poder ofrecer a sus clientes diversos productos obtener mas utilidad. A futuro es incrementar el negocio y captar más clientes y brindar a sus hijos estudios.

loans.use: Purchase whole grains and undergarments for her shop

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
Maria Elsa C. is from the sector of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, where she devotes herself to working with the goal of improving her home, which has gotten to a state of disrepair. For this reason she has invested in reconstruction. Because of her economic difficulties, however, she had to stop the process.

Today Ceprodel has come to the rescue by soliciting credit that would allow her to purchase the construction materials she needs for the reconstruction of her home. She is confident that this way she will be able to succeed and have better conditions in which to live.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Elsa C. es originaria del municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se dedica arduamente a trabajar con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda ya que ha sido muy maltratada desde hace varios años y por este motivo ha invertido en la reconstrucción de esta, sin embargo a pesar de las dificultades económicas al haber iniciado con la construcción se vio en la tarea de detener el proceso por falta del recurso económico.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción para su reconstrucción de su vivienda. Es por este motivo que espera muy confiadamente ya que de esta manera logrará salir adelante y tener mejores condiciones para vivir.

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
Jose Santos is a man who has for many years worked very hard to improve conditions for himself and his family. He has attempted to do so by improving his home, which for some years has been in a state of disrepair and today requires immediate reconstruction.

We can't ignore the fact that Jose Santos has begun to reconstruct his home and has done part of his construction already but he is not yet done with the roof and walls. It is for this reason that he is seeking assistance from Ceprodel, so that he can get the credit necessary for the purchase of construction materials and thus continue the reconstruction of his house. Actually, he has already possessed three loans from Ceprodel, all of which were paid in time as established by the agreement.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

José Santos es un caballero que desde hace varios años ha laborado muy fuertemente con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su humilde familia por medio del mejoramiento de su vivienda el cual desde hace varios años ha estado muy maltratada y hoy en día merece ser reconstruida de inmediato.

No podemos pasar por alto que el señor José Santos ha iniciado a reconstruir su casa de habitación y ha avanzado con parte de su construcción pero aun le hace falta en lo referente a techo y pared. Es por este motivo que él acude a Ceprodel para recibir el crédito necesario para la compra de sus materiales de construcción y de esta manera continuar con su reconstrucción de su vivienda. Actualmente posee tres créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials

loans.name: Aguilas De Oro Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto there is the association called “Águilas de Oro” (Golden Eagles) that works with Pro-Mujer very responsibly, they are a very likeable and united group. Most of them are married with kids, their husbands’ salaries are not enough to support them; therefore they work to support their homes. They have several different activities like beauty products sales, cell phone and other appliances repair shops, but the principal activity is the production and sales of delicious hand made chocolates (filled with fruits, coconut, chocolate bars, and in animal shapes) that are later on sold on the streets and at open markets in the city of La Paz. Their goal is to increase their capital to buy better quality packaging and improve the presentation of their products so they can reach more demanding markets and buy more supplies to increase their production, so they can create more income for the good of their children.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra a la asociación “Águilas de Oro” que trabaja junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer con mucha responsabilidad un grupo muy simpático y unido sobre todo. La mayoría de ellas son casadas y con hijos, nos cuentan que con para mantener sus hogares no les alcanza con los sueldos de sus esposos, lo que les llevo a buscar una actividad que les permita generar ingresos para solventar la economía de sus hogares. Varias son las actividades a las que se dedican por ejemplo la venta de cosméticos de marca, reparación de celulares y equipos electrónicos y otros, pero la actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de exquisitos chocolates artesanales (chocolates rellenos de fruta, de coco, en barra, chocolate puro en formas de animalitos) que luego de elaborarlos los venden de manera ambulante o en puestos de ferias en toda la ciudad de Paz. El objetivo de ellas es el de aumentar su capital para la compra de empaques de mejor calidad y presentación para que axial sus productos puedan llegar a mercados mas exigentes y comprar mayores insumos para generar mayor producción, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus hijos.

loans.use: Need capital to buy provisions and packages to improve the quality of their products / Necesitan capital para la compra de insumos y empaques de mejor calidad para sus productos

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Pro Mujer Bolivia - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Claribel Group

texts.es:
The focal center of the Adela village is located in the city of El Alto, where the association “Claribel” belongs and works with Pro-Mujer for the past two years, showing gratitude and loyalty to the institution.

The sale of natural products and provisions to locals is the activity of this group; they produce quinua, amaranto and pito de cañahua, in seeds and grounded, sold at markets in La Paz and Cochabamba. To increase their production they need to invest into buying more land in order to cultivate and install some machinery to process their products, they have the dream to form a large enterprise, that generates larger income for their families and give better opportunities of work to others.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

El centro focal de Villa Adela esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a éste pertenece la asociación “Claribel” que trabaja junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace dos años, demostrando gratitud y lealtad a dicha institución.

La venta de productos naturales y también abarrotes a nivel local es la actividad principal de este grupo, para darnos una idea mas general, producen quinua, amaranto y pito de cañahua, en grano y también molidos, luego los venden en mercados de la Paz y Cochabamba . Para ampliar su producción necesitan invertir en la compra de un terreno de gran superficie con el fin de instalar sus plantaciones y al mismo tiempo instalar la parte de mecánica para procesar sus productos, tienen el sueño de formar una empresa grande, que genere mayores ingresos para sus familias y además pueda dar oportunidad de trabajo a otros.

loans.use: Need more credit to buy land to cultivate and machinery to process their products / neceistan mayores creditos para comprar areas de plantacion y maquinaria para procesar sus productos.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Pro Mujer Bolivia - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn S. is 58 years old and has one child, two nieces, and one older brother. Her child is a vendor selling second-hand phones in Phnom Penh. They are depending on Mrs. Morn to provide for them. Morn is a widow and has been working as a teacher at a state school since 1979. After the full time class, she opens an extra class to her students to make additional income. On average she earns $1.60 of profit per day.

Mrs. Morn currently is requesting a loan from Kiva to help open a stand in a busy market for her son who is selling telephones in Phnom Penh. This will help him to earn more profits to support the family income. Mrs. Morn is pictured with her older brother.

loans.use: Set up a shop stand for her son.

loans.name: Kurmi Group

texts.es:
Association Kumi works with Pro-Mujer in the area of Alto Lima in the city of El Alto. They hope to keep their own activities to improve their lives, the group is formed by 13 members, that worked with Pro-Mujer for the past two years, proving to be very organized and responsible in their activities.

Almost all of them with their families pay about 500 Bs. ($69 approximately) minimum for rent, an amount they work very hard to reach. They dream with buying their own house for their children. There are several activities on the association, like bread production, bed sheets and clothing production, which is the main one. They usually sell their products on credit, so they need to have capital for production. Short time ago they received an order to produce uniforms for a bank, so they are soliciting a loan in order to buy materials to produce them. They want to increase their income to get financial stability for their homes and save money enough to buy their own house some day.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

En la zona de Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto, junto a Pro-Mujer trabaja la asociación Kurmi, todos con la esperanza de tener actividades propias que les brinde mejores oportunidades de vida, el grupo esta formado por 13 miembros activos, que trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace mas dos años, demostrando ser muy organizados y responsables en sus actividades de grupo.

Casi todos con sus familias por lo general entre de alquiler de vivienda, mensualmente gastan 500 Bs. mínimos, monto que lo consiguen con mucho esfuerzo, ellos sueñan en comprar una casa propia para sus hijos, Existen diversos negocios dentro la asociación, por ejemplo la elaboración y venta de pan, confección de Edredones y sabanas, pero la confección y venta de ropa viene a ser la actividad principal. Productos que generalmente los dejan a crédito, teniendo así que tener un capital de trabajo que respalde la adquisición de éstos productos. Hace poco recibieron la propuesta de dotar uniformes a una institución bancaria lo que les lleva a solicitar mayor crédito para poder comprar materia prima en mayor cantidad para poder cumplir con dicho pedido. De este modo mejorar sus ingresos para conseguir estabilidad económica en sus hogares y poder ahorrar para la futura compra de sus viviendas.

loans.use: Need capital to buy materials of better quality / Necesitan capital para comprar materia prima en mayor cantidad

loans.name: Cielo Group

texts.es:
The main activity of the group "Sky" is making hand embroidered clothes, purses and folk disguises. They work with Pro-Mujer and take on much responsibility. They have already finalized the work that people have ordered, art work for stores, and folk disguises for fairs in the city of "La Paz."

The dream of the association is to export their products to the interior and exterior of the country. In order to do this, they need better credit to replenish their capital for work and be able to hire personnel to help them in the business. They already have orders that demand manual labor and much time and they will train these new employees in order to ensure the quality of their products. In this way, they will achieve better economic and personal status for the benefit of their homes.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

El bordado a mano de carteras, monederos y disfraces folklóricos es la principal actividad de la asociación “Cielo”, que trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer con mucha responsabilidad. Ya finalizados sus trabajos los venden a pedido, en tiendas de artesanía, tiendas de disfraces folklóricos y ferias de la ciudad de La Paz. El sueño que la asociación, es el de exportar sus productos al interior y exterior del país. Para esto necesitan mayores créditos para reforzar su capital de trabajo y poder contratar personal que les ayude en este negocio ya que al ser una producción manual demanda mucho tiempo además de acceder a capacitaciones donde aprendan a promocionar sus productos de manera mas calificada. De esta manera logran crecimiento personal y económico, para el bien de sus hogares.

loans.use:
They need capital to share amongst themselves and to take professional courses.
necesitan capital para comtartar pérsonal y para acceder a cursos profesionales

loans.name: Halil

texts.en: H. Halil is 32 years old. He is married and has three adorable children. He works hard to give them a good education and to make them happy. Halil is a market vendor. He sells houseware like dish and plates, tea sets, tea towels, and thermoses. He has been in this business for five years. His eldest son helps him with the business. His store is located in the central local market “Panjshanbe”. The business is successful and generates stable income, allowing Halil to support his family. Now Halil wants to increase the range of goods sold and he requests 1000 $ US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Halil would like to thank everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of the house ware like dish and plates, thermoses, tea towels, tea sets in order to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Usmon

texts.en:
H. Usmon is 28 years old. He is married with two wonderful children. His wife is keeping the house and taking care after the kids. Usmon’s children are small now, but already today he is working hard in order to ensure the best future for them. 
Usmon is running his business for five years. He is selling the houseware like: plates and dishes, teapots and caps, vacuum flasks and others. His sister who was pictured on the photo helps him with the business. All the goods are supplied from China. Except for the retail clinetele Usmon has got the wholesale customers. The business is successful and generates the stable income allowing Usmon to contribute considerably to the family budget. Usmon’s children are raising and their expenses are raising too. He is doing all the best in order to be able to ensure all the needs of his children. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies.  
Thus today Usmon is asking for a loan 1000 $ US Dollars for purchasing the china ware and other houseware like teapots, caps, and flasks in order to increase the range of goods for selling. He promises to repay the loan within 6 months. Usmon thanks all for support and promises to mange the loan without violations.

loans.use: Purchasing of the house ware like in order to enlarge the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en: U. Anvar is 20 years old. In spite of his young age, he supports his parents and younger brothers and sisters. For the last two years Anvar has been providing taxi services with his car. Anvar is a very diligent young man. His main purpose is to make the client happy. Anvar is ready to work day and night in case his customers need his services. He gets up early and goes to bed late as to not lose any clients. At the same time he raises cattle. Anvar buys calves on the market at low prices, feeds them and then resells at the same market at a more higher price. His wife and little brother help him with feeding and looking after the calves. In order to be able to provide the services of higher quality Anvar would like to fix his car. For this he needs to purchase spare parts. He requests 1000 $ US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Part of the loan will be spent purchasing calves in order to expend his business. Anvar thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy in time.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for fixing of the car and calves.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: B. Dilorom is 40 years old. She is married with three children. Dilorom is a market vendor. She sells kids clothing at the local market. The elder daughter helps her mother in her business. For seven years, Dilorom built her clientele. Now the business is successful and generates a stable income for the family.  Dilorom would like to purchase kids clothing for the summer season. She requests 200 $ US Dollars for the term of 3 months. Dilorom thanks everyone supporting her and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase kids clothing for the summer season

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
D. Gulbahor is 39 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of six children.
Gulbahor is a market vendor and sells clothing for kids. With 6 years experience and good taste, Gulbahor has made her business stable and successful. Thanks to her business's income, Gulbahor is able to contribute considerably to the family budget and help her husband support their family and his parents.  Gulbahor would like to purchase clothing for kids for the summer season. For this she needs additional funding. She requests 250 $ US Dollars for the term of 3 months. She hopes to increase her income and be able to send her elder son to University. Gulbahor promises to pay the loan in time and thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for kids in order to increase inventory.

loans.name: Zendia C 2017-4 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Susan K.. She sells milk in her shop and is requesting a loan to expand the shop. Susan is 50 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 5 children ranging from 12 to 20 years old, and her children go to school. Each week, Susan makes approximately 80 sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the shop.

Susan is joined in her small group by Alice S., Mary S., Rose S., and Veronica Amose. Alice S. sells charcoal and wants to buy a bicycle. Mary S. sells vegetables and wants a loan to expand her business. Rose S. sells charcoal and wants to buy tools for digging, such as hoes. Veronica Amose sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy chairs to sell.

loans.use: To expand her shop

loans.name: Orzigul

texts.en: H. Orzigul is 47 years old. She is a widow and has two children. Ahror, her son, age 24, just received his bachelor’s degree in Journalism and her daughter Zebo, age 15 is in school. She started her business because she needed extra income to be able to pay for household and personal expenses. Six years ago she began selling kids clothing. She is requesting a loan of 200 $ US Dollars, which she will repay over 3 months, to purchase more clothing and have a greater inventory.  Orzigul would like to express her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell to expand the business

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.en: K. Nozigul has been running her business for six years. She is 37 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a farmer. To help her husband support the family and provide the best future for her children, she has a trading place in the market where she sells seeds.   She began this small business because she didn’t have a job and she needed to find an activity to support her family and provide her children with an education. Working 8 hours a day, 6 days a week, she earns about 70 $ US Dollars every month from this business. Now Nozigul requests a loan 300 $ US Dollars within 6 months to purchase additional seeds to increase her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to sell.

loans.name: Sowra D 2012-2 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Betty W.. She sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to rent to others. Betty is 45 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has 3 children ranging from ages 15 to 25, who go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately 70 sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike.

Betty is joined in her small group by Mary W., Floura D., Victoria J., and Tabitha T.. Mary W. sells charcoal and wants to build shop to sell oil. Floura D. sells salt and charcoal in a shop and wants a loan to expand her shop. Victoria J. sells charcoal and wants to buy a tractor for plouging her farm. Tabitha T. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to rent to others

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: N. Aziza is 35 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children of school age. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Aziza is a market vendor. She sells clothing for kids in the central local market.  Aziza delivers the goods by herself. As a result she often travels to the neighboring city. Aziza tries to purchase goods of good quality and at prices acceptable to middle class clients. Being very nice and friendly, Aziza works hard and tries to serve her clients well so that they want to come back. The business is stable, allowing her to contribute considerably to the family budget. Now Aziza would like to purchase summer clothes for kids to increase inventory. She requests 400 $ US Dollars for 4 months. Having the positive credit history, Aziza promises to repay the current loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase kids clothing to increase inventory.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 40-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Hassan sells mobile phones. This is the sixth time he had applied to Al Majmoua for a loan. He needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Gam D 2028-3 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Esther T.. She sells vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Esther is 45 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has 2 children, ages 25 and 30, who go to school. Each week, Esther makes approximately 100 sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Esther is joined in her small group by Veronica N., Sunday W., Hellen J., and Regina M.. Veronica N. sells bread and charcaol and wants to build a house to rent to others. Sunday W. sells charcaol and wants a loan to open a hotel. Hellen J. sells beans and oil and wants to build a big shop for selling oil. Regina M. sells charcoal and beans and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 37-year-old father of one child. He lives with his family in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Hussein sews curtains. This is the sixth time he has applied to Al Majmoua for a loan. He needs to buy material to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy material for his curtain business

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
H. Hamza is 36 years old. Hamza and his wife, who is a nurse, dream that their two children can have a higher education. In order to support the family and to ensure a better future for his children, Hamza runs his own business repairing  electronic equipment like TVs, radios, CD recorders, and tape recorders. Hamza also sells the equipment. Being a good repairman, Hamza is able to choose equipment of a better quality and attractive price for the clients. Hamza’s business is very stable and brings significant support for his family. 
Today Hamza requests 1200 Somoni (350$ US Dollars) for the term of 4 months. With tthe loan funds he is planning to purchase spare parts and diagnostic devices to repair electronic equipment. Hamza thanks all for their support and says that he will repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and diagnostic devices to repair electronic equipment.

loans.name: Buluk B 2018-1 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Mary M.. She sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Mary is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has 2 children, ages15 and 20, who go to school. Each week, Mary makes approximately 50 sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Mary is joined in her small group by Joice K., Martha P., Sebina P., and Bajina P.. Joica K. sells vegetables and wants to expand her business. Martha P. sells vegetables and wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Sebina P. sells bread and charcoal and wants to buy a generator to rent to others. Bajina P. sells ice cream and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru:
Nodira S. is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. Since she was young, she has sold goods in the market with her mother. After her marriage, she got a job as a street sweeper in the market. Along with this work, she and her daughter sell household goods. At the present time, she doesn’t have much selection. In order to increase the variety of goods she sells, she decided to come to Mikroinvest for assistance.We told her about KIVA and she wanted to take part with request for business expansion( for purchasing of house hold goods: cleaning fluid,electro belongings and battareis of different size)

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer

Сангинова Нодира женщина в возросте 36 лет замужем имеет 3 детей, с молодости торговала вместе с матерью на базаре,после замужества устроилась на рынке дворницей ,параллельно с этой работой она с дочькой торгует хозяйственными товарами.На сегодня у нее оборот бизнеса не велик, для увеличения ассортимента товаров она решила обратится в Микроинвест. Ей мы рассказали о помощи Кива и она захотела участвовать с просьбой на займ на рассширение бизнеса( на покупку хоз.товаров: чистящие средства для ванны и кухни, электро. принадлежности и батарейки разных размеров.)

loans.use: Purchasing household goods

loans.name: George

texts.en: George A. is a 30-year-old father of three children. He lives with his family in Nyalenda. He is a member of West Kolwa Community Based Service Providers group, a K-MET initiative. He was trained by K-MET in home-based care services for people living with HIV/AIDS. He is the proprietor of a community pharmacy located in Nyalenda, where he sells a wide range of drugs such as painkillers, malaria medications, family planning, and children's syrups. He has received and fully paid three previous microfinance loans. He appreciates K-MET/ KIVA for the financial assistance. He requires an additional US $800 to purchase an additional stock of drugs in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock of drugs in bulk.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel A. sells maize. He is married, and his wife sells kenkey, a local dish made of fermented dough. It is in great demand by the Cape Coast locals. There is also a great demand for the maize.

Daniel plans to use the loan for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand his business selling maize.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. is a hair dresser. She has many customers, and her services are in great demand. She is married, but her husband's income from the Sanitary Office at the University of Cape Coast does not cover the expenses for Regina and her two children.

Regina plans to use the loan as captial to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama T. sells kenkey, a local dish of fermented maize. It is a favorite of the Cape Coast locals. Ama is a single mother of two. Demand for the kenkey is high. Ama plans to use the loan to expand her business, and so increase her profits.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. sells food items, and has many customers. She is married, but her husband's income from the Sanitary Office at the University of Cape Coast does not cover the expenses for Felicia and her two children.

Felicia plans to use the loan to purchase more food to sell. She wants to expand her business to increase the profits she brings back to her family.

loans.use: Purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. sells charcoal. He is married, but his wife's income from farming does not cover the expenses for Mana and his four dependents. Nana has many customers who want charcoal.

He plans to use the loan to expand his business so he can increase his profits, and provide more income for his family.

loans.use: Purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S. sells kenkey, a local dish of fermented maize. It is highly sought after by the Cape Coast locals. She is married, but her husband's income from the Sanitary Office at the University of Cape Coast does not cover the expenses for Ama and her two children.

Ama has many customers who want to buy kenkey. She plans to use the loan to purchase more maize. She wants to expand her business to increase her profit, and provide more income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase more maize to increase production of kenkey to sell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 42-year-old father of four children. He lives with his family in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Hussein is in the painting business. This is the first time he has applied to Al Majmoua for a loan. He needs to buy material to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa is a 33-year-old father of two children. He lives with his family in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Moussa sells car oil. This is the fifth time he has applied to Al Majmoua for a loan. He needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi N. sells groceries. She is married, but her husband's income from MTN, a local cell phone provider, does not cover the expenses for Esi and her two children. There is great demand for the goods she sells.

Esi plans to use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell. She wants to expand her business so she can increase her profit and provide more income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 33-year-old father of one child. He lives with his family in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Mohamad owns a bookstore. This is the fifth time he has applied to Al Majmoua for a loan. He needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy books for his bookstore

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua M. sells kenkey, a local dish of fermented maize. It is a favorite dish of the Cape Coast locals and in great demand. Ekua is married, but her husband's income does not cover the expenses for Ekua and her two children.

Ekua plans to use the loan to purchase more maize to produce more kenkey to sell. She wants to increase the profit from her business to provide more income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase more maize to increase production of kenkey

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 50-year-old mother of three. She lives with her family in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Wafaa sells clothing. This is the first time she has applied to Al Majmoua for a loan. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 46 years old mother of two. She lives with her family in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Zeinab owns a mini-market. This is the first time she has applied to Al Majmoua for a loan. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert M. sells mobile airtime cards and mobile unit transfers. He is single. There is a great demand for airtime cards. Robert plans to use the loan to purchase more airtime cards to sell so he can increase his profit.

loans.use: Purchase more mobile airtime cards to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. sells second-hand clothing. She is married, but her husband's income from selling second-hand clothing does not cover the expenses for Joyce and her three children. Joyce has many customers for her clothes.

She plan to use the loan so she can purchase more second-hand clothing to sell. She wants to expand her business so she can increase the income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase more second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan B. sells porrigde. She is married, but her husband's income from the University of Cape Coast Sanitation Office does not cover the expenses for her family. Demand for her soup is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase the profits she brings back to her family.


She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou G. is single and was born in 1971 in Thies. She lives near the Moda Kane bank in the Senghor sector of Thies. She is requesting this loan for the purpose of bolstering her commercial business. With this loan, she expects to buy bags of chili peppers in Mali that she is going to stock for retail sale to her loyal customers, who are at the central marketplace in Thies.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

FATOU G. EST UNE CELIBATAIRE NEE EN 1971 A THIES .ELLE HABITE PRES DE LA CAISSE DE MODA KANE AU QUARTIER CITE SENGHOR DE THIES .ELLE SOLLICITE CE PRET DANS LE BUT DE RENFORCER SES ACTIVITES COMMERCIALES .AVEC CE PRET ELLE COMPTE ACHETER DES SACS DE PIMENT AU MALI QU ELLE VA STOCKER POUR LES REVENDRE AU DETAIL A SES CLIENTS FIDELES QUI SONT AU MARCHE CENTRAL DE THIES/

loans.use: Commerce in chili peppers

loans.name: Takku 1 Group

texts.fr:
The women from the Takku 1 group are very active in the field of weaving traditional wrap around fabric (pagnes) and in making clothing. With the allotted funds, they will buy essential material: weaving thread, bazin fabric, traditionally weaved fabric, and dye etc… They will then share those to make traditional clothing as well as distinctively African ones, such as robes, wrap around fabric (pagnes), male outfits, sheets and tablecloths, and other knitted clothes for women. They will sell their wares at the weekly markets and in their neighborhood. This type of clothing is popular at this time because it is made of cotton fabric. 
Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Les femmes regroupées dans le groupement Takou 1 sont trés actives dans le dommaine du tissage des pagnes et la confection d'autres tenues vestimentaires. Avec les fonds alloués, elles vont acheter les matières premières : fil de tissage,  tissus bazin et pagne tissé de façon traditionnelle, teinture etc., qu'elles vont se partager pour confectionner des habits traditionnels et typiquement africains, telles que les robes, pagnes,tenues masculines, draps et nappes de tables, et autres tenues tricotées pour femmes qu'elles revendent au niveau des loumas hebdomadaires et dans leur quartier. ces habits sont très recherchés en ce moment car ils sont faits à base de tissus en coton.

loans.use: Making and selling of clothing

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah N. has a retail shop in Katosi that has been in business since 1992. She is a widow with four children and she cares for three orphaned children, including paying their school fees, clothing, medical care and shelter. She has been our client for ten years as a member of Kewerimidde women’s group; she has had a 100% loan repayment rate. Her dream is to transform her shop into a wholesale venue but because she is still paying too much in school fees, it’s not a thing for tomorrow. Still, she has hope through hard work and determination. She would like a loan to help her buy more goods for her shop (sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice, maize flour) and to complete the construction of additional commercial rooms for rent, which are just next to her shop.

loans.use: Sarah Nakato needs to buy more sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice, maize flour for the shop plus cement, sand and iron sheets for her incomplete commercial house.

loans.name: Eron

texts.en: Eron N. has had a retail shop in Katosi for one year. She is married with two children. She helps to pay school fees for her brother in secondary school in the village. This is her second time asking for a loan through Kewerimidde women’s group; the first loan repayment was 100%. Her husband is a shop keeper, too, but he is hesitant to contribute to the welfare of the home, especially with food and school fees. This is one reason why she is working very hard to better her children’s future. She needs a loan to buy sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice and maize flour for her shop.

loans.use: Eron Nampijja needs a loan for buying sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice and maize flour for her shop.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. is a multi-businesswoman. She is a farmer growing food for both home consumption and for sale; and this time around, she has a lot of ginger for sale. She has three fresian cows at home for milk, for which she has a ready market. She also has had a fishing business for 18 years with three boats. She employs six men whose payments are agreed upon depending on their catch measured in kilos everyday.

She became a widow with 10 kids after her husband died of “AIDS." She is her family's sole source of support. She is really a strong woman. Her businesses are profitable but they can not give her the required money for fees, hence the need for a loan.

loans.use: She needs a loan to help pay school fees as her business makes the repayments.

loans.name: Comite San Miguel De Ita Group

texts.es:
This group was formed in September of 2007. Mrs. Jorgelina V. had already worked with the group “Divino Nino,” she then decided to form her own group which has been named “San Miguel.” The group is in its third cycle and has not been late with any payments. The group members work together, attend weekly meetings and count on a good quantity of savings which is deposited in a cooperative. The group members have different business such as the sale of clothing, coal, vegetables and fruits. The group San Miguel is made up of 15 members who all recognize the importance of granting a loan with their identity as their sole warranty and they will work together to strengthen the solidarity between them.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

El inicio del Grupo fue en el mes de Septiembre del 2.007, la Sra. Jorgelina Verón ya había operado en un Comité denominado Divino Niño, luego la misma decidió formar su propio grupo al cual denominaron San Miguel, el Comité se encuentra en el 3º ciclo, cuentan con 0 (cero) días de atraso, trabajan en forma conjunta, asisten a sus reuniones semanales y cuentan con una buena cantidad de ahorro el cual ya tienen depositado en una cooperativa. Las integrantes se dedican a distintas actividades como: Venta de ropas, carbón, verduras y frutas, etc. El Grupo San Miguel está conformado por 15 integrantes, las mismas reconocen la importancia de acceder a préstamos con la sóla presentación de la cédula de identidad, y siendo la única condición de trabajar unidas para fortalecer la solidaridad entre ellas. El promedio retirado por las integrantes fue de 800.000gs. el monto total retirado fue de 7.450.000 Gs.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries, drinks, fruits and vegetables, clothing, coal, etc.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia N. is a tailor in Katosi. She has a sewing machine at her home. She has been in this business for eight years and makes school uniforms of different schools, lady’s traditional wear, and children's clothing. Schools and parents contract with her after taking the necessary measurements of those involved. She then she goes to Kampala or Mukono for the materials needed for the sewing. Her husband left her with four children to take care of and she is doing her best because she wants a bright future for them. Together with her group's members, Senoga Betty and Namubiru Betty, she is asking for a loan to buy material and partly to clear her children’s school dues through Kewerimidde women’s group. 
In the photo, Scovia N. is in the middle; she is with Senoga Betty and Namubiru Betty, also members of her group.

loans.use: She needs a loan to buy school uniform material for sewing.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima K. is a devoted member of the Kewerimidde women’s group in Katosi and owns a restaurant that has been operational for seven years. At this stage, her restaurant can stand on its own as it makes enough profit to cater for any pending issue in her business. She is a widow with five children and all of them are in school. Through her group, she is asking for a loan to enable her to pay for her children's school fees. She fears to drain her business by extracting so much in school fees from it at once and that is why she needs a loan which she will pay back in installments using the profits from her restaurant.

loans.use: Halima Kilibwa needs a loan to be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco owns a grocery store where he offers a great diversity and great quantity of products.  Grocery stores in Paraguay are considered very lucrative businesses because they are a meeting point for people in rural areas of the country. 

Francisco’s wife’s reparation payment allowed them to collect the sum of money to be able to open their small venture.  Occasionally, Francisco sells merchandise as a traveling salesman. 

Francisco’s family is made up of his wife and his two children who go to school.  All of the members of his family help at the store in their free time.  The money from this loan will be used to purchase products for the store such as flour, pastas and oil among other things.   Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.


Francisco es dueño de una despensa donde ofrece una gran diversidad y cantidad de productos. Las despensas en Paraguay son consideradas negocios muy lucrativos, porque para la gente de las zonas rurales del país las despensas consisten en un punto de encuentro. 
El pago de indemnización de la esposa de Francisco fue lo que les permitió reunir toda la suma de dinero para poder abrir la microempresa. Ocasionalmente Francisco se dedica a vender mercaderías de forma ambulante. 
La familia de Francisco esta conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijos que van al colegio. Todos los miembros de la familia ayudan en la despensa en sus horas libres. 
El dinero proveído por el crédito será utilizado en la compra de mercaderías para la despensa tales como harina, fideos, aceite entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, rice, pasta, cooking oil, milk products, meat, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es:
Myriam Lopez and her husband Wilson Apariz are very dedicated people who work seven days a week. The couple has two children who go to school. They are also ambitious people who are searching only for the best for their children in terms of health and education.

Six years ago, Myriam started working as a merchant while Wilson has been a local policeman for the past three years. This shows that the family has two different sources of income.

The money obtained from this loan will be used to purchase goods such as sugar, flour, baking supplies, dairy products, oil and pastas among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Myriam Lopez y su esposo Wilson Apariz son personas muy dedicadas que trabajan de lunes a lunes. La pareja tiene dos hijos que van al colegio. Son también personas ambiciosas que solamente buscan lo mejor para sus hijos en términos de educación y salud.

Hace 6 años Myriam empezó trabajando como comerciante, mientras que Wilson es policía municipal desde hace ya tres años. Esto demuestra que la familia tiene dos fuentes diferentes de ingreso.

El dinero proveído por el crédito será utilizado para la compra de mercaderías tales como: azúcar, harina, panificados, lácteos, aceite, fideos, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, oil, meat, dairy products, soft drinks and other goods.

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es:
Myrian L. is married and has four children. Several years ago she started working as a traveling salesperson with the help of her husband who loaned her money to purchase her merchandise.

Her husband and children dedicate themselves to selling vegetables while Myrian sells jewelry.

Due to the increase in demand for products, Myrian is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Myrian L. está casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Hace muchos años empezó trabajando como vendedora ambulante con la ayuda de su esposo, quien le presto cierta suma de dinero para poder comprar mercaderías para luego venderlas.

Su esposo y sus hijos de dedican a la misma actividad, vendiendo verduras. Sin embargo Myrian vende bijouterie.

Debido a la creciente demanda de productos Myrian solicito el crédito que será destinado a la compra de mercaderías.

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry like bracelets, earrings, rings, etc.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual Vicente R. is an entrepreneur who realized he had a brilliant opportunity for business in his city: there was not a single repair shop. He therefore had no doubt when he invested his money and formed his own repair shop. In addition to the store, Pascual is the owner of a body shop. He makes many sales in having these businesses together because the customers of one become customers of the other.

The income obtained from the workshop and from the spare parts shop allows Pascual Vicente R. and his family to have a decent living through the great effort they make day after day.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Pascual Vicente R. es un emprendedor que se dio cuenta de una brillante oportunidad de negocios en su ciudad: no había ninguna casa de repuestos. Entonces no dudo en invertir su dinero y así formo su propia casa de repuestos. Además de la tienda, Pascual es propietario de un taller mecánico. El quita muchas ventajas de estas empresas conjuntas debido a que los clientes se una de ellas se vuelven clientes de la otra.

El ingreso obtenido en el taller y en la casa de repuestos, hacen que Pascual Vicente R. y su familia tengan una digna, a través del gran esfuerzo que realizan día tras día

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for vehicles

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Purchase flour, yerba mate, sugar, rice, milk products, meat, soft drinks, etc Santiago F. Maidana is married and has two adult children. Both go to the university.

The couple started working in different companies, but due to the low salary they received they resigned and launched a new venture. They opened two microenterprises: a small grocery store and a polyethylene factory. Both work together in both businesses.

The money from the requested loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for the small store, for example flour, rice, oil, noodles, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Santiago F. Maidana esta casado y tiene dos hijos mayores de edad. Ambos van a la universidad.

La pareja empezó a trabajar en diferentes compañías y debido al salario bajo que recibían decidieron renunciar e iniciar un nuevo emprendimiento. Fue así como abrieron dos microempresas: una despensa y una fabrica de polietileno. Los dos trabajan conjuntamente en ambas empresas.

El dinero del préstamo solicitado será invertido en la compra de mercaderías para la despensa. Por ejemplo: harina, arroz, aceite,fideo, etc.

loans.use: Purchase flour, yerba mate, sugar, rice, milk products, meat, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.es:
Ubaldo Morrel is a married man with four children; two of whom attend university and the other two go to secondary school. From the point of view of Ublando, the education of his children is his priority in life and he works hard to be able to pay for the schooling of his four children.

The family has two different sources of income. The wife is the owner of a small grocery store which offers a diverse quantity of products, while Ublado works in a company. The money provided by the loan will be used to purchase flour, noodles, rice, and other things.

Both of them are hardworking and honest people with a great desire to overcome. For quite some time they have worked with the Foundation, demonstrating seriousness, responsibility, and punctuality in payment.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Ubaldo M. es un señor casado con 4 hijos, de los cuales dos van a la universidad y otros dos al colegio. Desde el punto de vista de Ublando la educación de sus hijos es su prioridad de visa, entonces trabaja duramente para poder pagar los estudios de los cuatro hijos.

La familia tiene dos fuentes de ingreso distintas. La señora es dueña de una despensa donde ofrece una diversa cantidad de productos, mientras que Ubaldo trabaja en una compañía. El dinero proveído por el crédito será utilizado para la compra de harina, fideos, arroz entre otros.

Son personas muy trabajadoras y honestas, con un gran deseo de superación. Trabajan con la Fundación desde hace bastante tiempo, demostrando seriedad, responsabilidad y puntualidad en los pagos,

loans.use: To purchase flour, noodles and rice among other things

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.es:
Wilfreda is 46 years old, she did not finish high school, she speaks Aymará and Spanish, she lives with her 6 daughters, 3 of whom study at the university, 3 in high school.

She sells women’s clothing such as skirts, shirts, sweaters, polartec pullovers and other items. In addition she creates embroidered items and raises small animals such as chickens.

With the first loan she received from the Molino Communal bank for S/.300.-00 nuevos soles back in 2004, she decided to invest in a small grocery store. That store didn’t provide good earnings and didn’t go well, so she changed her business to selling clothing which is more or less profitable.

With the current loan for S/.800.00 which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy more merchandise to sell.

In light of everything she is happy with her business and her vision of the future is to capitalize on and expand her business to the important markets in cities such as Desaguadero, Huapaca San Miguel, Ilave, Puno y Juliaca.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Wilfreda tiene 46 años de edad, su nivel de instrucción es secundaria incompleta, habla aymará y castellano vive con sus 6 hijas, de los cuales 3 están en superior y 3 en secundaria.

Ella desarrolla la actividad económica de venta de ropas de vestir de mujeres como son: polleras, centros, chompas, mantas polar y otros. Además realiza actividades de bordados y crianza de animales menores como pollos.

Con el primer crédito que recibió del banco Comunal Molino, fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles en el año 2004, ella decidió invertir en la pequeña tienda de bodeguita, en el cual no tuvo buenas ganancias y no le fue bien, por ello cambió de negocio en venta de ropas el cual es más o menos rentable .

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará mas mercadería para su venta

Por todo ello esta muy feliz con su negocio y su perspectiva a futuro es capitalizarse y ampliar su negocio a las ferias importantes como Desaguadero, Huapaca San Miguel, Ilave, Puno y Juliaca.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Saré Sama 2 Group

texts.fr:
Our group just finished reimbursing the first loan Kiva gave us. We waited for a suitable time to ask to renew our loan so we can continue to sell the products we go get in town (rice, sugar, oil, soap and kitchenware). Our village is very isolated and very far from the national road. This is why the population has a hard time getting supplies, especially during the rainy season that will begin shortly. With our first loan, we started to supply the villagers and those who live in the surrounding villages. Our experience taught us that people need our products the most during winter time because it is most difficult to travel towards towns. This is why we are asking Kiva to renew our loan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Notre groupement vient de boucler le remboursement du premier prêt que kiva nous avait donné. Nous avons attendu le moment propice pour demander le renouvellement du prêt pour continuer à commercialiser les produits ( riz, sucre, huile, savon et ustensile de maison) que nous allons chercher en ville, car notre village est très enclavé et il est très loin de le route nationale. Ce qui fait que les populations éprouvent des difficultés pour se ravitailler surtout lors de la saison des pluies qui va bientôt s'installer . Avec le premier prêt, nous avions commencé à ravitailler les villageois et ce qui habite dans les autres villages environnants. L'expérience nous a fait savoir que c'est pendant l'hivernage que les gens ont plus besoin de nos produits à cause de la difficulté de déplacement des gens vers les villes. C'est pour cela que nous demandons à Kiva de renouveler notre crédit.

loans.use:
Purchase of raw material and domestic products

Achat de matières premières et produits d'utilisation domestique

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund (SEM) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia is asking for a 4th refinancing to invest in improving her home (constructing a kitchen). She has worked as an elementary teacher for 16 years at the Rafaela Herrera school in the Fonseca neighborhood located 30 km from Nueva Guinea.

Herminia is a hardworking, honest, and very responsible woman. She has 3 children, the oldest is 17 and in his 5th year of secondary school, another is 15 and in 3rd year of secondary school and the youngest child is 11 years old and in 6th grade of primary. In spite of being a single mother this teacher has enabled her children to be successful. In addition Herminia is in charge of her mother’s care. Her dream is that her children continue studying, have a beautiful home and steady work in order to help her family, as they are a family of scarce economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Herminia está solicitando un 4to refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construccón de una cocina), desde hace 16 años trabaja como docente de educación primaria de la Escuela Rafaela Herrera en colonia la Fonseca a 30 km de Nueva Guinea.

La profesora Herninia es una mujer trabajadora honesta y muy responsable, tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de 17 años estudia su quinto año de educación secundaria, otra 14 años estudia su 3er año de educación secundaria y su hijo menor de 11 años estudia 6to grado, a pesar que es madre soltera esta docente ha sacado a sus hijos adelante, además doña Herminia se encarga del cuido de su mamá, su sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, tener una vivienda mas bonita y estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia, ya que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos.

loans.use: Construct a kitchen in her home

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa Ameliis asking for her 2nd refinancing to invest in improving her home (constructing a room). She works as an elementary teacher.

She has two children, the oldest is 16 and in his 4th year of secondary school, and the her younger daughter is 13 years old and in 5th grade of primary. Amelia is an exemplary mother to her children and the community, she feels grateful for the previous loan she received from this institution.

It is important to mention that this client not only is a teacher, she also works growing basic grains on her brother’s farm on the weekends. Her dream is to have a decent home, health, steady work and that her children continue studying in school.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Rosa Amelia está solicitando su segundo refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una habitación), se desempeña como docente de Educación primaria.

Tiene dos hijos, el mayor de 16 años de edad estudia su cuarto año de educación secundaria y la hija menor de 13 años estudia 5to grado; la profesora Amelia es una madre ejemplar con sus hijos y con la comunidad , ella se siente agradecida con el crédito anterior otorgado por la institución.

Es importante mencionar que esta cliente no solo se dedica a la docencia, tambien trabaja cultivando granos basicos en la finca de su hermano los fines de semana, su sueño es tener una vivienda digna, salud, estabilidad laboral, y que sus dos hijos sigan estudiando.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a room on her home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Thelma Ivania

texts.es:
Thelma Ivania is requesting a loan to invest in a home improvement project, which is to finish building a kitchen.

She has worked at the Rubén Darío Institute for the past 10 years. Ms. M. is a single mother of two daughters for whom she struggles to give the best she can. The oldest is 14 years old and in the 4th year of secondary school and the youngest is 12 years old and studies sixth grade. In her free time and in the afternoons, Thelma sells cosmetics. She carries out her work with great responsibility and is a woman who wants to advance professionally. She has struggled for her family so that her daughters are not wanting for anything. Her dream is to have work stability and that her daughters study.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra.Thelma Ivania está solicitando su refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como es terminar de construir la cocina de su casa.

Labora para el Instituto Rubén Darío desde hace 10 años; es importante mencionar que la Sra. M. es madre soltera de dos hijas por las cuales lucha para brindarles lo mejor de si, la mayor de 14 años estudia 4to año de educación secundaria y la menor de 12 años estudia su sexto grado; en las horas libres y por las tardes se dedica a vender cosmeticos, doña Thelma desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad , es una mujer que desea superarse en lo profesional, ha luchado por su familia para que a sus hijas no les falte nada, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral y que su hijas estudien.

loans.use: Finish building a kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Panfilia Regina

texts.es:
Panfilia is requesting a loan to invest in a home-improvement project (build a room). She works as a teacher at the Diriangen school. Her husband sells cattle and she helps him with household expenses.

She has had prior loans which have helped her make improvements to her home little by little, and for this she is grateful to AFODENIC. She is a woman who works by her husband´s side on their piece of land, raising various crops so that they can improve their quality of life and that of their daughter, who is studying in primary school. She is beloved in her San Antonio neighborhood because she helps out her community by bringing education to the farmers´children. Her dream is to have a beautiful home and work stability.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Panfilia está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación). Se desempeña como docente de la Escuela Diriangen, su esposo se desepeña como comerciante de ganado y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Es importante explicar que está clienta con los créditos anteriores ha ido poco a poco mejorando su vivienda, y por ello se siente agradecida con AFODENIC, es una mujer que trabaja de la mano con su marido en la parcela cultivando diversos cultivos para asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y de su hija que actualmente está cursando su primaria, es muy querida en la colonia San Antonio ya que ha sido un ejemplo de mujer ya que ayuda a su comunidad llevando el pan de la enseñanza a los niños campesinos de su colonia,su sueño es tener una casa bonita y estabilidad laboral.

loans.use: Build a room onto her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Noel Alfredo

texts.es:
Noel is requesting a loan to invest in a home-improvement project (construction of a room). For the past 19 years, he has worked as a secondary school teacher at the Rubén Darío Institute.

He is a hard-working man, honest and responsible, who has demonstrated his love of teaching for many years, in spite of the low salary. He does not have any children, but Noel cares for two nephews who are living with him this year while they study, because in the region where they live there is no secondary school.

His dream is to study a master´s degree and to have a more comfortable home and work stability so that he can help out his family, who have limited economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Don Noel está solicitando refinanciamiento de su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construccón de una habitación), trabaja como docente de educación secundaria del Instituto Rubén Darío, desde hace 19 años.

Es un hombre trabajador, honesto y responsable que ha demostrado durante muchos años amor por la docencia a pesar que el salario es poco, no tiene hijos, pero Don Noel cuida a dos sobrinos que este año estan viviendo en su casa, ellos se encentran estudiando ya que en la comarca que ellos viven no hay secundaria.

Su sueño es estudiar una maestria, tener una vivienda con mas condiciones y estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya que son de escasos recursos económicos,.

loans.use: Build a room onto his home.

loans.name: Jorge Danilo

texts.es:
Jorge Danilo is requesting a loan to invest in a home-improvement project (install a tile floor in his house). He is a secondary-school teacher at the Rubén Darío institute. He has two children; the oldest is 14 and in the 4th year of secondary school and the youngest is 13 and studies in the 6th grade.

Danilo is a model father and very responsible with his children. With previous loans he has made improvements to his home. He is currently studying his undergraduate degree at the URACCAN University branch in Nueva Guinea. His dream is to become an experienced professional, have work stability, have a comfortable home and that his two children continue to study so that in the future they can become outstanding professionals. Please support him with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Jorge Danilo está solicitando su refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Ponerle ceramica a la casa), se desempeña como docente de Educación Secundaria en el Instituto Rubén Darío, tiene dos hijos, el mayor de 14 años de edad el cual esta estudiando su 4to año de educación secundaria y la menor de 13 años estudia 6to grado.

Don Danilo es un padre ejemplar y muy responsable con sus hijos, con los créditos atorgados por la institución ha ido mejorando su vivienda; actualmente está estudiando una licenciatura en la Univesidad URACCAN recinto Nueva Guinea, su sueño es ser un profesional con mucha experiencia, tener estabilidad laboral, tener una casa con las todas las condiciones y que sus dos hijos sigan estudiando para que en el futuro lleguen ha ser unos excelentes profesionales, solicitamos se le apoye con este crédito.

loans.use: Install a tile floor in his home.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Mrs. Elsa G. is married and has three children. Her husband is a blacksmith and works for a private company as well as making custom orders. At her 58 years of age she still has a strong spirit and desire to succeed and is always thinking long-term, which is why she continuously saves and invests. Both of them are sacrificing and hardworking people. According to Elsa, the house where they were living was the result of marriage savings because they come from a family of scarce resources.

The small grocery store is approximately 4 years old. Taking advantage of the fact that house in which they live has spare rooms, which they rent, providing a third of their income. Mrs. Elsa attends to both businesses.

At this time the loan is needed to complete a bathroom in one room of the house and to close it off to create a separate room to rent. As the rent is very accessible there is a constant demand by workers and/or students in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elsa G. se encuentra casada y tiene 3 hijos. Su marido es herrero y trabaja en una empresa privada y también de forma particular. Ella con sus 58 años de edad aún tiene un espíritu vigoroso y ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta pensando a largo plazo es por eso que ahorra e invierte constantemente. Los dos son personas muy sacrificadas y trabajadoras. Según Elsa, la casa donde están viviendo es fruto del ahorro matrimonial, ya que provienen de una familia de escasos recursos.

La pequeña despensa tiene aproximadamente 4 años de antigüedad. Aprovechando que en la casa donde viven sobran cuartos, la pareja los alquila para así tener acceso a una tercera fuente de ingresos. Es la Sra. Elsa quien atiende ambos negocios.

En este momento necesita el préstamo para terminar un baño en otra pieza de su casa y cerrarla para así dejar una pieza independiente y alquilarla. Como el precio del alquiler es muy accesible tiene demanda constante ya sea de trabajadores y/o estudiantes de la zona.

loans.use: Refurbishment of Bedrooms

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Mrs. Nidia is 36, and is married to Mr. Cristino Espínola. More than ten years ago she migrated from the interior of the country to the city of Luque, where she sells meals for workers of a known factory that is meters away from her home.

Nidia’s family is made up of two school-aged children and her husband, who has worked as a fireman in the city airport for more than 8 years.

The requested loan is for the expansion of her business, which will allow her to work more comfortably and provide better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nidia tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Cristino Espínola. Hace más de 10 años migró del interior de país a la ciudad de Luque, donde se dedica a la venta de comidas para empleados de una conocida fábrica que se encuentra a metros de su domicilio.

La familia de Nidia esta constituida por sus 2 hijos que están en edad escolar y su marido, quien trabaja como bombero en el aeropuerto de la ciudad hace más de 8 años.

El préstamo que solicita es para la ampliación de su negocio, así de esa forma poder trabajar cómodamente y brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Expansion of commercial space

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Mrs. Veronica V. was born in General Articas in 1965. She lives with her two children, Ramona Soledad, 15, who is studying media in the National College of Luque and Claudio, 22, who works for Corrugadora del Paraguay (a paper and plastics company). She has run a small grocery store for 15 years and also has a hair salon in her own home. With the loan she bought a motorcycle for her son Claudio so he will have greater mobility.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Veronica V. nació en General Artigas en el año 1965. vive con sus dos hijos, Ramona Soledad de 15 años, quien esta cursando la media en el Colegio Nacional de Luque, y Claudio de 22 años quien trabaja en la Corrugadora del Paraguay. Dirige una despensa desde hace 15 años y además una peluquerìa en su propio domicilio. Con el préstamo compró una moto para su hijo Claudio a fin de lograr una mejor movilidad del mismo.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Rosalino

texts.es:
Mr. Rosalino S. Ocampo is from the Navidad neighborhood, of the city of Guayaybi, he is 52 years old and is married to Mrs. Aurelia Aguilar Escobar who is 45 years old.  The pair has 3 children and they live in their own home.   For the past 11 years Mr. Rosalino has been the owner of a motorbike workshop where he also sells replacements for motorbikes.   The wife of Rosalino is owner of a store that offers a good variety of products.

 Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El  señor Rosalino S. Ocampo es del Barrio Navidad, distrito de la ciudad de Guayaybi, tiene 52 años y esta casado con la señora Aurelia Aguilar Escobar de 45 años de edad. La pareja tiene 3 hijos, y vive en casa propia.
  Desde hace 11 años el señor Rosalino es propietario de un taller de motocicletas y moto sierras, donde también vende repuestos para motos. La esposa de Rosalino es dueña de una despensa que ofrece una gran variedad de productos.

loans.use: to purchase general replacements

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Mr. Enrique P. is from the Navidad neighborhood, in the district of Guayaybi, he is 70 years old, he is married to Mrs. Josefina Vazquez who is 69 years old, they have 2 children. He is the owner of a house that sells drinks and food in general. Mr. Enrique also dedicates himself to agriculture and he has cattle, his wife helps him in the business, they have their own place with a good location, well formed clientele, a good income, and good commercial and personal references. Mr. Enrique is a hard worker and well known in the area for being friendly and supportive.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.
