El señor Enrique P. es de la localidad de Barrio Navidad, distrito de Guayaybi, tiene 70 años, esta casado con la señora Josefina Vázquez de 69 años de edad, tienen dos hijos. Es propietario de una casa de ventas de bebidas y comestibles en general. Don Enrique también se dedica a la agricultura y tiene animales vacunos, su señora le ayuda en el negocio, tienen local propio, buena ubicación, con clientela formada, buenos ingresos, buenas referencias comerciales y personales. El señor es muy trabajador y muy conocido en la zona, por ser amable y solidario con los demás.

loans.use: to purchase various drinks such as soda, juices, liquors, and beer.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Mr. Fermin Benitez is 36 years old and is married to Mrs. Rumelia Suarez who is 29 years old, they live in the area of Tacuruty in the city of San Estanislao, they have a son who is of school age. They have a grocery store in their own home, with well formed clientele and a good income, by means of the good prices and good attention to the clients. Their project for the future is to finance a mini market now that their clientele is large.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Fermìn Benitez tiene 36 años de edad esta casado con la señora Rumelia Suarez de 29 años de edad, viven en la compañía de Tacuruty de la ciudad de San Estanislao, tienen un hijo que esta en la edad escolar. Tiene una despensa en su domicilio particular, con clientela ya formada y un buen ingreso, mediante los buenos precios, a la buena atenciòn a los clientes. Su proyecto para el futuro es habilitar un mini mercado ya que cuenta con un local muy amplio, para realizar dicho proyecto .

loans.use: to purchase bread products, dairy products, flour, cleaning products, sweets, etc.

loans.name: María De Jesus

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Dejesus J. is 63 years old, she is from the city of San Estanislao, the neighborhood of Ycua Pai, she is a widow with grown children that work in an independent manner. She is the owner of a grocery store that she has located in her own home, with good supply and a well formed clientele. She has a good income, good commercial and personal references, she is beloved and well known in the area for being a fighter and supportive to the rest.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Dejesus J. tiene 63 años de edad, es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Ycua Pai, es viuda, con hijos mayores de edad, que trabajan en forma independientes Es propietaria de una despensa, que tiene montado en su domicilio particular, con buen surtido y una clientela formada. Tiene buenos ingresos, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, muy querida y conocida en la zona, por ser una persona luchadora y solidaria con los demás.

loans.use: for the purchase of merchandise for her grocery store such as cleaning supplies, sugar, flour, noodles, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria C. is 34 years old, she is married to Mr. Victor Cardozo who is 39 years old and they have 5 school-aged children. They live in the city of San Estanislao, in the Monte Alto neighborhood, they have their own house. They have a grocery store in their home that is 5 years old, with a well-formed clientele, a good income, and excellent commercial and personal references. They need to purchase notions for their business, since there isn’t another store of this type in the area. They are hard working people and are always characterized for their enterprising spirit.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria C. tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Victor Cardozo de 39 años de edad, tienen 5 hijos, en edad escolar. Viven en la ciudad de San Estanislao, en el barrio Monte Alto, tiene casa propia. Posee una despensa en su domicilio particular, con una antigüedad de 5 años, con clientela formada, buenos ingresos, y excelentes referencias comerciales y personales, El cliente necesita comprar artículos de mercerías para su negocio, ya que en la zona no existe otro negocio de ese rubro. Son personas muy trabajadores y siempre se caracterizaron por su espiritu emprendedor.

loans.use: to purchase milk, eggs, meat, vegetables, fruit, candy, etc.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Mr. Miguel Santa Cruz is 42 years old, he is married to Mrs. Teodolina Ovando, who is 38 years old and they have 4 children. They live in the city of San Estanislao, in the neighborhood of Monte Alto, they have their own house. They have a jewelry and watch store in the center of the city, with 8 years of operation, a well formed clientele, and a good income thanks to the good prices and quality of their products, and they offer guarantees on their merchandise. Excellent commercial and personal references, they are very responsible and hardworking.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Miguel Santa cruz tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado con la Señora Teodolina Ovando, de 38 años de edad, tienen 4 hijos. Viven en la ciudad de San Estanislao, en el Barrio Monte Alto, tienen casa propia. Tienen una Joyería y Relojeria en el centro de la ciudad, con 8 años de funcionamientos, con clientela formada, y buenos ingresos, gracias a los buenos precios y también a la calidad de sus productos, y trabajos con garantìa. Excelentes referencias comerciales y personales, son muy responsable y trabajadores.

loans.use: to purchase watches, rings, chains, etc.

loans.name: Ceriana Alejandra

texts.es:
For the past 15 years Ceriana, with the help of her family, has been mass-producing bricks. She comes from a family for whom this trade is their main source of income. Because of the continuous profits resulting from her efforts, she has decided to install more kilns in the space where she manufactures, as she currently has only three. For this reason she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Ceriana, desde hace 15 años se dedica con ayuda de toda su familia a la fabricación de ladrillos a nivel industrial. Ella proviene de una familia que se dedica a este oficio como fuente de ingreso principal.Debido a los frutos continuos de su esfuerzo ha decidido implementar con más hornos de cocción de ladrillos su humilde espacio de fabricación ya que en la actualidad cuenta con tres, es por ello que ahora solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Capital investment to buy supplies needed for building more kilns.

loans.name: Diana Felicitas

texts.es:
Diana and her husband deliver bread from a bakery. Previously they had their own bakery, but due to the high prices of ingredients, their business failed. Through their work delivering bread every day, they have gained more experience and have been able to adjust to changes and challenges. Now that they have the necessary knowledge, they have decided to work harder so that in a short time they can again start up their own bakery, for the well-being of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Diana y su esposo se dedican a repartir panes de la panadería, ellos anteriormente tenían su propia panadería pero por el alza excesiva de los insumos fracasaron. Con el reparto de panes a diario han ganado más experiencia y han podido convivir con las novedades y dificultades ahora que ya poseen los conocimientos necesarios han decidido esforzarse aún más para que dentro de poco vuelvan a instalar su humilde panadería para alegría y bienestar de los suyos.

loans.use: To improve her capacity buy supplies and to eventually open her own bakery.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora is 60 years old and is married to Señor Juan Vera who is a vendor. They have two shops (one in their home and the other in a market in the city).

Aurora opened her shop over 18 years ago and thanks to her perseverance and her insistence that sustains her, with her husband, she has been able to raise two children who are independent and are college-educated working professionals.

Aurora, thanks to her efforts and a good investment of loans acquired from the “Fundación Paraguaya”, has been able to improve the quality of her life and that of her family, which is how she was able to allow her children to study.

Aurora needs a loan to purchase more merchandise so that she can stock her businesses now that the season of higher prices is coming.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Aurora tiene 60 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Juan Vera, quien es comerciante, poseen dos locales (uno en su propio domicilio y otro en el mercado de la ciudad).

Aurora inició su actividad de despensera hace más de 18 años y gracias a la constancia y el empeño que sostuvieron con su esposo, lograron formar a sus dos hijos, quienes ya son independientes y excelentes profesionales universitarios.

Aurora gracias a su esfuerzo y a la buena inversión del crédito adquirido de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, como así también hacerle estudiar a sus hijos.

Aurora necesita del crédito para adquirir más mercaderías para poder surtir sus negocios ya que se acerca la temporada de suba de precios.

loans.use: Purchase of dairy products, meats, fruits, vegetables, canned goods, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
Evaristo is 30 years old and lives with his partner, Blanca Otazú, who is 22 years old. They have their own house. Evarista started working with his father as a vendor when he was very young. Later he acquired a motorcycle and started to work on his own over 10 years ago.

He makes his sales going door to door on his motorcyle, covering many kilometers each day.

Two nephews and a cousin work with him and he pays them for the sales they make.

He needs a loan for the purchase of merchandise like bedspreads, quilts, and sheets, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Evaristo tiene 30 años de edad, vive en pareja con Blanca Otazú de 22 años de edad, tienen casa propia.

Evaristo empezó desde muy joven a trabajar con su padre como vendedor, luego adquirió una moto y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia hace ya más de diez años .

Realiza las ventas casa por casa en su moto recorriendo varios kilómetros diarios.

Trabajan con él dos de sus sobrinos y un primo a quienes les paga por las ventas realizadas.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como colchas, edredón, sábanas, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of quilts, sheets, bedspreads, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
For the past 15 years, Aquilina has sold snacks to hundreds of people in her city. Little by little she has expanded her service and she has the satisfaction of having contributed to her home and to the education of her beloved children, who have now turned into good men and women. Her desire to always improve has now led her to request a loan to begin repairs on her humble home.

Translated from Spansh by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Aquilina, acaba D. cumplir quince años dedicada a la venta D. comidas a manera D. bocadillos a cientos D. personas en su ciudad, poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus servicios y tiene la satisfacción D. haber contribuido con su hogar y con la educación D. sus amados hijos que se han convertido en hombres y mujeres D. bien. Su deseo D. mejorar siempre la conducen ahora a solicitar un préstamo para iniciar la refacción D. su humilD. domicilio.

loans.use: Start repairs on her home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
Señor Gabino is 37 years old and is married to Mary Caballero who is 35 years old and is a housewife. She also helps in the care and milking of their cows. They have a five-year-old son who is starting elementary school.

At a young age, Gabino started selling milk with his father. Later he went out on his own and today is doing very well in producing his own milk and delivering milk from door to door by bicycle. Even though he often experiences bad weather, he is motivated by his friends’ and clients’ appreciation and value of his work.

Today, thanks to the quality of his product, he has a large clientele for which he needs a motorcycle to reach more consumers and to go longer distances.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Gabino tiene 37 años, está casado con Mary Caballero de 35 años de edad quien es ama de casa, quien también ayuda en el cuidado y ordeñe de las vacas. Tienen un hijo de cinco años quien esta empezando su escolar básico.

Gabino empezó desde temprana edad en la venta de leche junto con su padre, luego se independizó, hoy en día cuenta con su propia producción de leche lo cual le va muy bien, ya que las ventas las realiza casa por casa en bicicleta, a pesar de que muchas veces se presenta inclemencias del tiempo, motivo por el cual es muy apreciado y valorado la labor de Gabino por sus amigos y clientes.

Hoy día gracias a la calidad de su producto cuenta con una numerosa clientela para lo cual necesita de una motocicleta para llegar a más consumidores y en lugares más distanciados.

loans.use: Purchase of a Motorcycle

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
For many years Rebeca, along with her beloved husband, has manufactured coffins for the eternal rest of their clients´ family members. Thanks to their excellent finishing work and the materials they use, production has improved and market demand has increased. They would like to start offering funeral services in addition to the coffins, and for this reason are requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Rebeca, en compañía de su amado esposo hace mucho se dedica a fabricar ataúdes para el descanso eterno de los familiares de sus clientes. Gracias a los excelentes acabados y a los materiales que utilizan para este fin han mejorado su producción y se ha incrementado la demanda en el mercado. Tienen deseos de implementar los servicios funerarios además de los ataúdes y a esta razón atiende su solicitud.

loans.use: Start up business to offer funeral services.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio, 26, is married to Carmen Alvarez, 34. Carmen earns money selling empanadas to friends, neighbors and even her husband's customers. They have a five-year old son who is just starting school.

Ignacio is a mechanic and has an established customer base. He learned his trade from his uncle with whom he worked for more than ten years. Five years ago, he opened his own garage, a business that has gone well thanks to the care he takes and the thorough job he does for his customers. He needs the loan to buy a compressor.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Ignacio tiene 26 años, está casado con Carmen Álvarez de 34 años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta de empanadas en su domicilio vendiendo a los vecinos, amigos e inclusive a los clientes de su marido. Tienen un hijo de cinco años quien está empezando el ciclo básico.

Ignacio es mecánico, tiene clientela formada, el conocimiento de la profesión lo aprendió de su tío con quien estuvo trabajando por más de diez años. Hace cinco años que abrió su propio taller lo cual le va bien por su buena atención y por el trabajo garantizado que presenta a sus clientes. Necesita el crédito para la compra de una compresora.

loans.use: Buy a compressor.

loans.name: Comité Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
In the city of Paraguari, just 3 kilometers from the Paraguari office, a group of women got together, some wanting to start a business and others to increase their working capital, but all with the ultimate goal of improving their lives and the lives of their families. These women approached the Fundacion Paraguaya to learn about the Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras ("Committee of Women Entrepeneurs") and to take advantage of the opportunities that our institution offers and no other institution does.

Their group, Santa Lucia, which is now in its sixth round, has an excellent record and includes 23 active women entrepeneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

En la ciudad de Paraguarí, compañía Soto distante a 3 Km. De la Oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con ganas de emprender actividades productivas y otras para aumentar su capital de trabajo con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Estas mujeres se acercaron a la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse sobre el programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y quienes aceptaron felices de participar y aprovechar las oportunidades que nuestra Institución ofrece y que ninguna otra institución lo ha hecho.

El comité lleva por nombre Santa Lucía, quienes actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo, con calificación excelente, integrada por 23 emprendedoras y activas mujeres.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Ventura

texts.es:
Ventura is 37 years old, is single, and is a merchant. She also works as a receptionist for the city government of Paraguarí.

Ventura started her business over twelve years ago, opening a small booth where she sold undergarments. Thanks to a loan from the “Fundación Paraguaya,” she was able to strengthen her business which has helped her to gain the large clientele she now has and has noticeably improved the quality of her life.

Ventura needs a loan to purchase garments for the season, now that winter is coming.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ventura tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera, comerciante, también trabaja como recepcionista de la gobernación de la Ciudad de Paraguarí.

Ventura inició su actividad hace más de 12 años, abriendo una pequeña casilla en donde vendía lencería, gracias al crédito adquirido de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo consolidar su negocio, lo que la ayudó para que actualmente cuente con una numerosa clientela y ha mejorado notablemente su calidad de vida.

Ventura necesita del crédito para adquirir prendas de temporada, ya que se avecina el invierno.

loans.use: Purchase of Winter Clothing

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor is 38 years old and is married to Mariza Zaldívar. She is a 34-year-old dressmaker and helps with the household expenses.

They have an eight-year-old son who is in third grade.

When he was very young, Victor started working as his uncle’s carpentry assistant. Later, after many years, he acquired enough capital to open his own carpentry shop which he has had for more than ten years.

Through his efforts, he has been able to acquire the tools needed for his work and to improve his family’s quality of life. Today, he has established a clientele with the quality of his work and because his shop is well-located along the international route.

He needs a loan to buy a planer.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Victor tiene 38 años, está casado con Mariza Zaldívar de 34 años de edad quien es modista, quien ayuda en los gastos del hogar.

Tienen un hijo de ocho años quien está en el tercer grado del escolar básico.

Victor empezó desde muy joven como ayudante de un tío trabajando como ayudante de carpintería, y luego de varios años pudo adquirir capital para abrir su propia carpintería hace más de diez años.

Mediante su esfuerzo pudo ir adquiriendo las herramientas necesarias para su trabajo y mejorar la calidad de vida de él y la de su familia, hoy en día cuenta con clientela formada, por la calidad de su trabajo su local está bien ubicado al costado de la ruta internacional.

Necesita el crédito para compra de una cepilladora.

loans.use: Purchase of a Planer

loans.name: La Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
In the city of Yaguarón, 15 km. from our Paraguarí branch, a group of women with a desire to undertake productive activities and others to increase their income came together. From there they contacted us to find out more about the program and accepted the program for the many benefits it offers.

The group is called “La Fortaleza” and it is in its forth cycle with an excellent record and is made up of 16 working women.

In the hopes of continuing to grow and to increase their sales, the women use the loans to invest in their businesses. Today they are asking for a new loan to invest in their respective activities such as the purchase of fabric, thread, meat, drinks, oil, noodles, rice, flour, dairy products, bread products, accessories for their stores, sheets, fruits and vegetables in general, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de Yaguarón distante a 15 Km. de la oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con ganas de emprender actividades productivas y otras para aumentar su capital de trabajo, de ahí que se pusieron en contacto con nosotros para interiorizarse sobre el programa, quienes aceptaron por los múltiples beneficios que presenta.

El comité lleva por nombre La Fortaleza, quienes actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo, con calificación excelente, integrada por 16 trabajadoras mujeres.

En miras de seguir creciendo y aumentar sus ventas ellas utilizan los créditos para invertir en sus negocios. Ellas hoy están solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en sus respectivas actividades como son la compra de tela, hilo, carne, bebidas, aceite, fideo, arroz, harina, lácteos, panificados, accesorios para mercería, sábanas, frutas y verduras en general, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, meat, drinks, oil, noodles, rice, flour, dairy products, bread products, accessories for their stores, sheets, fruits and vegetables in general, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
A couple years ago Elizabeth and her husband decided to acquire a vehicle to provide public transportation service in their community and nearby villages. Thanks to this investment they have been able to improve their quality of life and Elizabeth has learned an occupation that benefits their home situation. Nevertheless due to the lack of precaution and service, the vehicle has some maintenance issues that they wish to repair soon and also acquire new tires in order to continue providing their service.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth y su esposo hace un par de años decidieron adquirir un vehículo para realizar servicio de transporte público en su comunidad y zonas aledañas. Gracias a esta inversión han podido mejorar su nivel de vida y Elizabeth ha emprendido una ocupación también en beneficio de su hogar.Sin embargo debido a la falta de precaución y chequeo el vehículo ha sufrido algunos desperfectos que desean solucionar cuanto antes y adquirir llantas nuevas para seguir con su labor.

loans.use: Repair her vehicle and acquire new tires

loans.name: Agustín

texts.es:
Augstin, 51, has been married to Pelagia Ortega, 53, for 29 years. They have 6 children, three who are married and independent and three who still live with their parents. The oldest of the three who live at home manages his father's second store and the two youngest are still in school. Agustin has been a merchant for 2 years. He started with money that he got from selling farm products--sugar cane, tapioca, watermelon and beans--that even now he still grows for an established base of customers.

Agustin is applying for this loan so that he can buy merchandise--pans, oil, pasta, flour, t-shirts, sopa, insecticides, charcoal, different kinds of drinks, etc. He wants to add to his stock so that he can offer a range of products to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Agustin A. de 51 años de edad está casado hace 29 años con la señora Pelagia Ortega de 53 años, el matrimonio cuenta con 6 hijos de los cuales tres ya están casados y viven en forma independiente, los otros tres viven con sus padres, la mayora está manejando otro local comercial de su padre, que es una sucursal, mientras los dos menores están estudiando, el primero está en el 3ro de la media y el otro está en el 6to. grado. El señor Agustín es comerciante hace 2 años, se inició en este rubro con un capital que consiguio de la ventas de productos agricola que hasta ahora sigue cultivando como caña dulce, mandioca, sandía y porotos, cuenta con una clientela bien formada.

Solicita este préstamo para compra de mercaderías como cacerola, aceite, fideos, harina, remera, jabones, insecticidas, carbones, bebidas en general y otros. Asi aumentará su Stock de mercaderías y ofrecer de esta forma variedad a sus clientes

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Benicia

texts.es:
Miss Benicia F. is 24 years old and single.

Benicia tells us that 2 years ago she took design and painting classes and then with her small savings and help from her parents she opened her own microbusiness which is a party supply store.

The loan she seeks will be used to buy toys to then sell to her customers. In the future she wishes to have her own locale and provide event decorating services and rent chairs and tables.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señorita Benicia F. tiene 24 años, es soltera.

Benicia nos cuenta que hace como 2 años participó en cursos de diseño y pintura, y luego con un pequeño ahorro más la ayuda económica de sus padres emprendió su propia micro empresa que consiste en un cotillón.

El préstamo que solicita será destinado a la compra de juguetes para volver a vender a sus clientes. Para el futuro desea tener un local propio y realizar servicios de decoración de eventos, alquiler de sillas y mesas.

.

loans.use: Purchase toys

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Mr. Carlos B. is 25 years old, married to 20 year old Maria Benítez. He is a computer teacher. Carlos says that after studying at a local institute, he decided to share his knowledge with other people, and that is how he began his own institute with only 2 computers. Today he has 9 computers and a very good quantity of students.

The loan will be used to expand his locale, as his business is growing. In addition has is planning to sell computer accessories in the future.

He wishes that his county be free from corruption and with more opportunities for work for all Paraguayans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Carlos B. tiene 25 años y esta casado con Maria Benítez de 20 años. El es instructor en el área de informática, Carlos cuenta que luego de estudiar en un instituto local, se decidió a compartir sus conocimientos con otras personas, fue así que inicio su propio instituto con apenas 2 computadoras. Actualmente ya cuenta con 9 computadoras y con muy buena cantidad de alumnos.

El préstamo será destinado a la ampliación del local, ya que el negocio va progresando. Además tiene proyectado dedicarse a la venta de accesorios de informática en el futuro.

El desea que su país este libre de corrupción y con más oportunidades de trabajo para todos los paraguayos.

loans.use: Enlarge his locale.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Mrs. Felicia Sánchez is 40 years old and married to 45 year old Carlos Domínguez. They are parents to 3 sons ages 17, 16, and 12 years old, respectively.

Our client tells us that her husband was employed as a carpenter and was saving money in order to start a hardware store, which changed later to a general and grocery store, which is going very well with a steady customers base.

The loan will be used to buy cowboy boots, pants, and women’s outfits. In the future she wants to expand her locale and buy more clothing items to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Felicia Sánchez cuenta con 40 años de edad, y está casada con Carlos Domínguez de 45 años. Ambos son padres de 3 hijos varones de 17, 16 y 12 años respectivamente.

La cliente nos comentó que su marido era empleado de una carpintería y fue ahorrando hasta iniciar un negocio de venta de artículos de ferretería, para cambiar más adelante al rubro de despensa y mercería, en el cual le va de maravillas, ya que tiene clientela formada.

El monto del préstamo será destinado a la compra de camperas, pantalones y conjuntos para damas. Más adelante quiere ampliar su local y comprar más prendas de vestir para la venta.

loans.use: Purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Isabelino

texts.es:
Mr. Isabelino M. is 40 years old and married to 37 year old Ermelinda Melgarejo, they have 2 chidlren, one goes to school and the other is not yet school age.

Isabelino owns a shop where he repairs electronic items. He began this profession as an assistant 15 years ago, when he had the opportunity to study it and therefore he did so. The repair tools and items he uses he was slowly able to obtain with his savings, and in this way over time he began to work independently. Today he has his own business with a solid customer base.

He wishes that his children finish their schooling and become successful professionals. He is seeking this loan to buy parts.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Isabelino M. de 40 años, casado la señora Ermelinda Melgarejo de 37 años, tienen 2 hijos, una va a la escuela y la otra no esta todavía en edad escolar.

Don Isabelino posee un taller donde repara artículos electrónicos. Se inició en esta profesión como ayudante desde los 15 años, tuvo la ocasión de estudiar y así lo hizo, los elementos de trabajo que el utiliza los pudo conseguir con pequeños ahorros, de este modo empezó a trabajar en forma independiente. Actualmente tiene su local propio y con clientela bien formada.

Desea que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y llegar a ser profesionales exitosos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos.

loans.use: Purchase parts such as metal plates, compra de repuestos como placas, amplifiers clips, nuts, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, 25, is single and lives with his mother. He worked in his father's glass business from a young age and took over the business when his father died. He still operates the glass business along with a carpentry business that he just bought. He wants to make furniture that he will later sell in the interior of the country.

Juan wants to buy a store on the main street of Caaguazu so that he can set his business up there. He's applying for a loan to buy wood to make "roperos" (stand-alone closets or armoires).

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Señor Juan M. de 25 años de edad, es soltero, actualmente esta viviendo con su Madre. El sr. Juan desde pequeño trabajaba en la vidriaría de su Padre, cundo falleció su padre el quedo al frente del negocio. Actualmente esta trabajando en su vidriaría y también acaba de comprarse una carpintería donde desea fabricar mubles para su posterior venta en el interior del país.

Como sueño personal desea comprar un local en la avenida principal de Caaguazú para poner allí su negocio. El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas para la fabricación de roperos.

loans.use: Buy different kinds of wood for furniture-making business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, 40, is separated from her partner. She has three children, one in elementary school, one in high school and one working and independent. All live in the city of Caaguazu.

Julia started her small "copetin" (snackbar or food-selling shop) around 1992 and later decided to take a course to learn to make confectioneries, something that led to added growth for her business, especially from the sale of "flores de azucar" ("sugar flowers", a local confectionery). She now works with supermarkets in the city and even other cities.

Julia's fondest wish is that her children finish their studies and become successful professionals. She hopes that the change of government (in Paraguay) will bring more security, more jobs and greater justice.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Julia V. de 40 años de edad, quien actualmente esta separada de su conyuge, tiene tres hijos, una va a la escuela, la otra al colegio, y el mayor de ellos ya es profecional independiente, todos viven en la ciudad de Caaguazú.

Ña Julia comenzó con un pequeño copetin aproximadamente en el año 1.992, tiempo despúes se decidió a estudiar un curso de confiteria, con la que hizo crecer su negocio, en especial con la venta de Flores de Azucar, actualmente trabaja con supermercados de la ciudad e incluso con los de otra ciudad.

Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos concluyan sus estudios y sean profecionales exitosos. Ella espera que con este cambio de gobierno que haya mas seguridad, fuente de trabajo y justicia.

loans.use: Buy raw ingredients for bakery business.

loans.name: Lucino

texts.es:
Luciano, 39, has been happily married to Evangelista Gonzalez, 34, for 16 years. The couple has 2 children who are both in elementary school.

Luciano worked abroad for a private company but he returned to his native Paraguay in 2000. He decided then to use his small savings to start a carpentry shop. He now makes furniture which he later sells in the interior of the country. Luciano would like to expand his shop so that he can build more pieces of furniture and, in turn, increase his income.

He's applying for a loan to buy a truck. He has some money saved for it and, with the loan, he'll be able to more easily buy one on favorable terms.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Señor Luciano Núñez de 39 años de edad está felizmente casado hace 16 años con la Señora Evangelista González de 34 años. El matrimonio tiene dos hijos que están estudiando en la primaria.

Don Luciano fue empleado de una empresa privada en el exterior, en el 2000, regreso a su país natal y fue cuando decidió emprender su propia carpintería con un pequeño ahorro con el que contaba. Actualmente esta fabricando mubles para su posterior venta en el interior del país. Como sueño personal desea ampliar más su carpintería para llegar a fabricar mas muebles, y lograr así un mejor ingreso.

El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de un camión, ya que tiene un dinero ahorrado y junto con el crédito le va ser más fácil adquirir el vehículo al contado.

loans.use: Buy a truck.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
Marcia, 43, separated from her partner 2 years ago and is supporting her 4 children, 20, 13, 12 and 11. Two of the children deliver newspapers and the youngest helps her with her business. All the children are in school.

Marcia started her business more than 4 years ago with funds that she got from the sale of a property. She has a dependable customer base and extra income from a house that she rents. She's applying for a loan to buy merchandise--for example, sugar, rice, pasta, flour, cleaning products, soap, insecticides, milk, charcoal, different kinds of drinks, etc.--to add to her stock and increase the range of products she can offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Marcia S. de 43 años de edad se separó de su pareja hace 2 años y está manteniendo a sus 4 hijos de 20, 13, 12 y 11 años, dos trabaja en la distribución de periódicos, la menor de todos le ayuda en su negocio y todos están estudiando.

La señora Marcia es comerciante hace más de 4 años, se inició en este rubro con un capital que consiguió por la venta de un terreno, la señora Marcia cuenta con una clientela bien formada y cuenta además con otro ingreso por alquiler de una casa. Solicita este préstamo para compra de mercaderías como azúcar, arroz, fideos, harina, lavandina, jabones, insecticidas, leche, carbones, bebidas en general y otros. Así aumentará su Stock de mercaderías y ofrecer de esta forma variedad a sus clientes .

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial, 35, has been happily married to Liz Chavez, 28, for 10 years. The couple has two daughters, one in the third grade and the other in the first grade.

Marcial used to be a soccer player. He lived with his mother who operated a small grocery store and, when she died, he took over her business. Operating the store was more of a struggle before Marcial added on a fish market. Now he has an established base of customers thanks to the attention he pays to service and to the quality of the products he offers.

Marcial wants to expand his fish market so that he can offer a wider range of fish to his customers. He's applying for a loan so that he can buy a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Mrcial J. de 35 años de edad está felizmente casado hace 10 años con la señora Liz Chávez de 28 años. El matrimonio tiene dos hijas, actualmente están estudiando en la primaria, una de sus hijas esta en el 3º Grado y otra en el 1º grado.

Don Marcial fue futbolista y vivía con su madre, quien tenía una pequeña despensa. Luego falleció su madre y él quedo al frente del negocio. De apoco fue cargando más su despensa hasta llegar a anexarle una pescadería. Actualmente ya tiene una clientela bien formada, gracias a la buena atención y calidad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Como sueño personal desea ampliar más su pescadería para así poder ofrecer más variedad de pescados a su clientela. El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de otra congeladora.

loans.use: Buy a freezer.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Viktor is married with two sons ages 11 and 12. He is a businessman who works in the central market in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine selling sportswear and t-shirts. Viktor admits that lending services from Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine have helped his business grow over the past 6 years. He now owns three vending facilities. Viktor and his wife run two of them and his mother works in the third one. Currently, his monthly profit is about $1200.

Viktor would like to purchase 50 sports suits to re-sell in his vending kiosk. He is hoping to generate additional profits and hopefully buy a house for his family one day. Viktor used to work in construction before he started his own business. It taught him perseverance and stamina. We believe these qualities will secure the success of his venture and prompt repayment of this loan.

(Note: this is a short-term “express” loan that will be repaid in two months.)

loans.use: To purchase 50 sports suits

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is 38 years old, is single, and has two school-aged children.

Graciela is a hard working women, and since she was very young, worked in domestic labor, raising her children alone and making great sacrifices. She has sold food for business events.

Five years ago she started a small business selling clothing, that has been growing thanks to the loan credits from the Foundation, and she is struggling so that her children finish their education.

Now Graciela is hoping for a loan to buy winter clothing that her clients have been requesting.

Translated by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Graciela tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, todos ellos en edad escolar.

La Sra. Graciela es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde muy joven trabajó como empleada domestica, crió a sus hijos sola y con mucho sacrificio,y tambien empezó a veneder cosas comestibles en las fiestas patronales.

Hace 5 años montó un pequeño negocio de venta de ropas que con el tiempo fue creciendo gracias a los creditos que le otorgó la Fundacion y esta luchando para que sus hijos concluyan el colegio pose casda propia.

En esta ocación ella desea un crédito para comprar ropas de temporada invierno que sus clientes ya le han solicitado.

loans.use: To buy winter clothing

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married with a 12-year-old son. He started his business selling footwear 18 years ago. Financial assistance from Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine has helped Ivan grow and expand his business. Today he has two vending kiosks and his wife helps him run the business.

Ivan is planning to use this loan of 2500 Grivnas to purchase 100 pairs of shoes to sell in his kiosk. He believes an assortment of merchandise will boost his sales and help him generate additional profit. Ivan’s goal is to continue refining his business skills so that he can keep his venture growing and provide for the needs of his family.

(Note: this is a short-term “express” loan that will be repaid in two months.)

loans.use: Purchase 100 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is married. She is from the town of Beregovo in western Ukraine. Katerina sells women’s clothing in the central market of Beregovo. She has a favorable vending location and a nice selection of merchandise. Katerina has proven to be a good client with Hope Intl. Nadiya Ukraine, establishing a good credit history and promptly repaying all her loans. Katerina started her business 8 years ago. Since that time her venture has grown into a stable and profitable business which now brings her about $800 of income each month.

Katerina is very cheerful and energetic. Her customers love buying things from her as they always leave encouraged and inspired. She loves communicating with people and believes her job gives her many wonderful opportunities to do so. Katerina is requesting a short term loan of 1000 Ukrainian Grivnas to increase her business turnover capital.

(Note: this is a short term “express” loan that will be repaid in one month.)

loans.use: Increase working business capital

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deisy is 26, has three childre, and is working selling clothing and sells them at the Argentina/Paraguay border. In the past, she worked at the market selling vegetables, and later as a saleperson in a salon, but since she earned so little, she decided to try business for herself.

Deisy has worked since she was 15 years old, and already has her own house. Thanks to the Foundation she is improving her sales and savings, and she hopes to one day have her own shop from her house, where she would like to open a small bar.

Deisy is asking for a loan to buy winter clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La sra Deisy tiene 26 años,tiene 3 hijos,ella se dedica a la compra de ropas y las vende en la frontera. con Argentina. Anteriormente trabajaba en el mercado vendiendo verduras y después fue vendedora de salón, pero como ganaba muy poco ella decidió independizarse.

Deisy trabaja desde los 15 años, ya posee una casa propia y gracias a la Fundación fue progresando con sus ventas y ahorros, ella desea poder montar el día de mañana su propio salón de ventas en su casa donde además le gustaría poder abrir un pequeño bar.

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de la temporada invierno.

loans.use: To buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
Ermelinda is 57 years old, is married, and has two children, both of which are indepedent professionals. Ermelinda comments that she is very proud of her children.

She has had a store and eatery for about 7 years, which she began by selling quickly prepared food and providing lunch at the requests of workers that began working at a large paper factory. When the factory got running and incorporated more jobs, Ermelinda started her store, hoping to offer a great variety of products to her clientele. Ermelinda mentions that she has put a lot of love into this endeavor, and thanks to her good treatment of customers, she maintains steady clientele.

Ermelinda is asking for this loan to buy merchandise such as beef, chicken, flour, oil, rice, sugar, sodas, drinks, bread, and other provisions for the store.

Translated by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Ermelinda tiene 57 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos, ambos mayores independientes y profesionales, comenta que esta orgullosa de los mimos.

Ermelinda tiene un despensa y comedor hace aproximadamente 7 años, se inició con la venta de comidas rápidas y a proveer almuerzos a pedidos de unos obreros que iniciaban la obra de una gran fabrica de papel. Cuando la fábrica empezó a funcionar y se incorporaron los nuevos funcionarios, Ermelinda habilitó un salón comercial en donde habilitó un comedor y una despensa con el fin de brindar mayor variedad de productos a su clientela. Menciona la señora que en todo esto ella deposita mucho amor a su trabajo y gracias a su buen trato mantiene una buena clientela.

Solicita el crédito para compras de mercaderías como: carne, pollo, harina, aceite, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, bebidas en general, panificados y otros.

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as: beef, chicken, flour, oil, rice, sugar, sodas, drinks, bread, and others.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara is in a relationship and is 32 years old. She has two children, one of which goes to high school. In the past Sara worked as a salesperson at the market, and later as an employee in domestic labor, but since she made such little money through these jobs, she put together some savings and has begun to sell clothing.

With these earnings, she also began a small general store from her house, and today she is doing well for her position, wherein all of her neighbors go to her to buy necessities such as sugar, flour, and milk, among other things.

Sara says that the loan is a tool that is important to somall business owners that hope to realize their dreams of running their own business. With this loan that she is asking for, she hopes to acquire various merchandise to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

Sara vive en pareja y tiene 32 años. Tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno va al colegio. Sara anteriormente trabajaba como vendedora del mercado, después trabajó como empleada doméstica, pero como la remuneración era muy poca, ella junto unos ahorros y se independizó y empezó a vender ropas de forma ambulante.

Con las ganancias quele dejaba la venta de ropas, ella monto una pequeña despensa en su casa y que hoy día ya es la más surtida del barrio, en donde todos los vecinos van a comprar artículos de primera necesidad como azúcar, harina, leche, entre otros.

Sara cuenta que el crédito es una herramienta también importante para los pequeños emprendedores que desean realizar sus sueños de su propia empresa. Con el crédito que ella ahora está solicitando, desea adquirir mercaderías varias para surtir su despensa.

loans.use: To buy oil, wine, beer, flour, sugar, pasta, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Comite Renacer Group

texts.es:
The committee, "Rebirth," of the company, Villa Madrid de Limpio, was formed so that members of the company living in the same area could regroup with other members, primarily their neighbors.

There have been four previous meetings regarding loans, in which the interested members became more involved with the program, Commitee of Women Entrepreneurs. In the meetings, these women shared many of their business experiences. At the inception of these meetings, 20 women attended, 19 of which were in agreement with the decisions of the committee.

Now they are in their 4th cycle of the program, and each member is asking for a loan ranging in amount from 300 guaranies to 800 guaranies (average $120), according each member's correspondance since the last loan cycle.

Each member is asking for a loan which will be used to buy the tools of their trade, or to buy merchandise or provisions for the creation of the final product which they sell. The majority of committee members are working independently in selling prepared food, fresh fruits and vegetables, perfumes, flowers, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

El comité denominado "Renacer” de la compañía Villa Madrid de Limpio, se formó a partir de que las integrantes de un comité de la misma zona que decidió desintegrarse ya que quisieron formar un grupo cuyas integrantes vivan más cerca, principalmente vecinas del barrio.

Se realizaron cuatro reuniones previas al crédito en donde las interesadas se interiorizaron más a cerca del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. En las reuniones compartimos muchas experiencias de las señoras con sus negocios. Al comenzar las reuniones asistieron 20 señoras de las cuales 19 estuvieron de acuerdo con los compromisos del comité.

Actualmente se encuentran en el 4º ciclo del programa, la línea de crédito que manejan es de a partir de 300.000 guaraníes hasta 800.000 guaraníes por cada integrante, según lo que le corresponde de acuerdo con el ciclo en el que se encuentran.

Lo solicitado en el crédito cada una de las integrantes utiliza para la compra de herramientas de trabajo o para la compra de mercaderías y/o materias primas para la elaboración del producto que finalmente llevarán a la venta. La mayoría de las integrantes del comité se dedican al trabajo independiente como por ejemplo: venta de comidas, de verduras y frutas, de perfumes, venta de flores, venta de comestibles, etc.

loans.use: Buy materials and merchandise such as linens, meat, fruits and vegetables, soda, perfume, cosmetics, flowers, flour, eggs, bread, etc.

loans.name: Sadagat

texts.en:
Sadagat M. is 32-year-old woman who owns a shop where she sells textiles. She started her business in 1993, selling textiles in her home. She is the manager and salesperson at the same time. From the money she earned she opened her own shop.

She is married and has 2 children. As the children grow up it is getting harder to cover all the family's needs. Keeping the store is the only source of income in her family and Sadagat decided to start a livestock business. She believes that purchasing one milk cow will increase her income and will help to cover her children's needs. She applied for 800 USD to purchase one milk cow and start her livestock business.

loans.use: Purchase one milk cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir N.  is a 27-year-old young man who keeps a shop where he sells marriage portions for brides. He has nine years of experience in this field. He lives with his family in the southern region of Azerbaijan, Sabirabad. He applied for 800 USD to purchase a first supply of wedding dresses. The estimated cost for one wedding dress is 200 USD. Samir says he would like to start with a few dresses, but from the money he earns he will purchase more and expand his business.

loans.use: Expand his business by purchasing wedding dresses

loans.name: Misirkhan

texts.en: Misirkhan Q. is a 47-year-old man who has sold women clothes and textiles in the local bazaar of Sabirabad region since 1982. He is married and has three children. Now is the high season for weddings and women are coming to the bazaar to purchase special dresses for weddings and other beautiful clothes. Misirkhan decided to catch this moment and purchase a lot of clothes which are in high demand now. All the money he earns goes to cover family needs and it is not enough to purchase a lot of clothes. So he has applied for 800 USD to expand the number of goods he sells and increase his income.

loans.use: Expand number of women clothes he sells

loans.name: Sembrando Esperaza Group

texts.es:
Leather made from cows and sheep is the main working tool for the "Sembrando Esperanza" association, who manufacture wallets, coin purses, and jackets from this material. When they started out, that bought these products from other artisans and later resold them for a higher price, but they realized that in light of the difficult economic situation they faced, they needed to find their own activity so they could have better opportunities. So they learned how to work leather to be able to have their own merchandise and offer better prices, and therefore have better earnings. They now want more loans to build up their capital and to buy special machinery for this type of work.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El cuero de vaca y oveja es la herramienta principal en el trabajo de la asociación “Sembrando Esperanza” ya que ellas se dedican a la confección de carteras, monederos, billeteras y chamarras en este material, Al principio compraban estos productos de otros artesanos para luego revenderlos a un precio mayor, pero un día se dieron cuenta que ante la difícil situación económica que atravesaban, necesitaban tener una actividad propia para conseguir mejores oportunidades, es así que aprendieron la confección en cuero para poder ser dueños de su mercadería y ofrecerlas a mejores precios donde obtengan mayores ganancias. Ahora quieren mayores créditos para reforzar su capital y comprar maquinaria especial para este tipo de trabajo

loans.use: Build capital and buy special machinery for leather work.

loans.name: Estrellas De Mar Group

texts.es:
The association called "Estrellas de Mar" has worked with Pro-Mujer for several years and has completed 9 credit cycles. They are located in the Villa Adela zone, in the city of El Alto and currently have 18 members, and have shown that they are a well-organized group with their credit.

The majority in the group are married with children, almost all school-age. There are a few cases in which, for lack of economic resources, unfortunately their children had to abandon their studies and now stay at home taking care of their younger siblings.

There are different businesses within the association, such as: sales of clothing, sale of milk products, sale of lingerie; but the main activity is sewing curtains, coverings for chairs and furniture upholstery. After completing their work, they sell only by order since they do not have any stand or exhibit space to show their work.

The "Estrellas de Mar" association says they need capital to rent stands or spaces in commercial zones, which will enable them to be more profitable. In addition, they need to be able to buy better-quality materials so their products have higher quality, and in this way they can get more customers and, in turn, have better earnings. Their main objective is to improve their economic situation and to be able to give their children a better quality of life, mainly an education.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La asociación denominada “”Estrellas de Mar” trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace ya varios años cumpliendo con 9 ciclos de crédito, esta se encuentra en la zona de Villa Adela, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 18 socias y ha demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.

Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar, existiendo algunos casos que por falta de recursos económicos, lastimosamente sus hijos tuvieron que abandonar sus estudios y ahora se quedan en sus casas cuidando de sus hermanos pequeños.

Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de ropa, de lácteos, ropa intima pero la actividad principal es la costura de cortinas y fundas para sillas, además tambien de tapizar muebles. Luego de finalizar sus trabajos solamente las venden a pedido, ya que no cuentan con ambientes para poder exponer sus trabajos,

La asociación Estrellas de Mar, afirma que necesitan mayor capital para alquilar ambientes adecuados y en zonas comerciales, que les asegure rentabilidad, además de poder adquirir telas de mejor calidad para que sus productos también tengan mejor calidad y así obtendrían mayores clientes y por consiguiente mayores ganancias con el unico objetivo de mejorar su situación económica de esta manera ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor forma de vida principalmente en su educación.

loans.use: Capital to acquire stands or rent spaces in commercial zones.

loans.name: Flor Pileña Group

texts.es:
"Flor Pileña" is an association made up of 10 members. The group is located in the city of El Alto at the focal center of Villa Adela. This group pools its loans and has worked with Pro-Mujer for to complete 12 loans.

Most of them have an average of 5 children that do not even have basic medical care; that is, they haven't had vaccines nor medical and dental checkups due to lack of financial resources. Any resources their parents had were used for food and rent.

Previously, the principal activity of Flor Pileña involved selling light clothing like blouses, shirts, dresses, etc. However, now that the season has changed, these items are no longer profitable. They want to change the product to winter clothing, which will bring in more sales. But buying this merchandise requires borrowing a new large loan so they can purchase their inventory at wholesale prices. Everything is for their families' welfare - increased sales will secure good health and well-being for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Villa Adela, a este pertenece la asociación “Flor Pileña ” integrado por 10 socias. Un grupo muy simpático que junto a su asistente de créditos, trabajan con Pro-Mujer hace dos ciclos.

La mayoría de ellas tienen un promedio de 5 hijos, y estos no cuentan con atenciones medicas básicas, vale decir que no cuentan con vacunas, valoraciones indispensables y principalmente consultas odontológicas, por falta de recursos económicos, ya que los recursos que generan sus padres solo les alcanza para gastos de alimentación y alquileres de sus casas.

Anteriormente, la actividad principal de la asociación “Flor Pileña” era la venta de ropa ligera, es decir blusas, camisas, vestidos etc., pero ahora de momento ya no es rentable por las condiciones del tiempo, lo que les lleva a cambiar de producto, ahora quieren adquirir ropa adecuada para el invierno, son la seguridad de obtener mas ventas, pero esta adquisición requiere solicitar un mayor crédito para la compra al por mayor de dicha ropa. Todo esto para el bien de sus familias ya que aumentando sus ingresos podrían asegurar la salud y bienestar de sus hijos.

loans.use: They need capital to buy a new inventory of winter clothing at wholesale

loans.name: Tata Santiago Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto in the Adela Villa zone, the center with the same name can be found. Within this center, we find the assocation called "Tata Santiago." Fifteen members form this very united and organized group. Only eight of them have completed school; the rest regrettably learned to read and write at a very basic level. It is a great dream of theirs to enroll in a school for adults to finish their studies, but due to their lack of resources, at the moment they can't do it.

The majority of them are dedicated mainly to the sale of fruits and vegetables on different streets in the city of El Alto. Now that winter has arrived, these types of products tend to raise in price because of the frosts in the fields. This is why they need to strengthen their capital to acquire these products, which they do every two weeks. They also hope to be able to rent or buy stands in the city's markets to assure the sale and conversvation of their products. In this way, they can obtain larger profits, and with these, finish their studies and help their families have a better way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

En la ciudad de El Alto, en la zona villa Adela se encuentra el centro focal del mismo nombre, dentro este centro encontR. a la asociación denominada “Tata Santiago”, 15 socias forman un grupo muy unido y organizado. Solo 8 de ellas tiene estudios culminados el resto lamentablemente aprendió a leer y escribir da manera muy básica, siendo un gran sueño él poder entrar a la escuela de adultos para culminar sus estudios que de momento por falta de recursos no pueden hacerlo.

La mayoría de ellas se dedican principalmente a la venta de fruta y verdura en distintos calles de la ciudad del Alto. ahora que el invierno llego, este tipo de productos tiende a subir de precio por las heladas en las plantaciones, Es por eso que necesitan reforzar su capital para la adquisición de estos productos, que lo realizan quincenalmente, además desean poder alquilar o comprar puestos en mercados o tambos de esta ciudad para asegurar las ventas y la conservación de sus productos De esta manera obtener mayores ganancias y con esto poder culminar sus estudios y apoyar a que sus familias tenga una mejor forma de vida

loans.use: They need larger credits to strengthen their capital and to rent stands.

loans.name: Ernesto Ariari

texts.es:
Ernesto is requesting financing to invest in improving his home so he can replace the roof on his house. He has worked for the Rafaela Herrera school in the colony of La Fonseca in the municipality of Nueva Guinea for five years.

Ernesto is a young man who is currently working on his bachelor's degree. He carries out his work with much responsibility, honesty, and many dreams of improving himself. Although he doesn't have children, he assumes the responsibility of caring for his parents. Since he is the youngest child, it is he who lives with them and assumes the expenses of the home.

It is fitting to point out that Ernesto is known for being a fighter and being enterprising. He is an example for all young Nicaraguans who love our country.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Ernesto esta solicitando su financiamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como es cambiarle el zinc a la casa que habita; labora para la Escuela Rafaela Herrera en la colonia La Fonseca del municipio de Nueva Guinea desde hace 5 años

Ernesto es un joven que actualmente está estudiando una licenciatura, desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad, honestidad y mucho deseo de superacion personal. A pesar que no tiene hijos, asume la responsabilidad del cuido de sus padres, ya que como hijo menor es el que vive con ellos y asume los gastos del hogar.

Cabe resaltar que se caracteriza por ser luchador y emprendedor, es un ejemplo para todos los jovenes Nicaragüenses que amamos nuestro pais.

loans.use: To replace the roof on his house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Melvin Antonio

texts.es:
Melvin, a youthful man, is requesting a loan in order to invest in the improvement of his home, specifically, the construction of a bedroom. He has worked for the Rafaela Herrera School in the La Fonseca neighborhood for 7 years. This young man has a 6-year old son who is currently in pre-school. Every day Melvin rides his horse for two hours to another region in order to impart the bread of knowledge to peasant children of the area. His dream is to have a stable job and a dignified home with all the basic conditions any person would want. He is recognized in the La Fonseca de Nueva Guinea neighborhood as a responsible and friendly person.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El joven Melvin esta solicitando financiamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como lo es la construccion de una habitacion. Labora para la Escuela Rafaela Herrera en la colonia La Fonseca desde hace 7 años; este joven tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, el que está estudiando su pre-escolar. Melvin todos los dias viaja 2 horas montado a caballo a una comarca a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos del lugar. Su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral y una vivienda digna con todas las condiciones básicas como todo ciudadano aspira; él es una persona reconocida en la Colonia La Fonseca de Nueva Guinea por ser responsable y sociable.

loans.use: Build a bedroom for his home

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Mr. Carlos Alberto is a 36-year old married man with two children ages 3 and 6 who are in pre-school and the first grade. With his own strength, he has managed to raise four walls and buy some zinc for the roof of what will be his house. With this first loan request, he plans to purchase 30 zinc sheets, both large and small, and the window and door frames. For Carlos Alberto this loan is urgent because he wants to have a house for his wife and children, as they are currently staying with one of his wife’s relatives. At the moment he depends on the salary he receives from the Juigalpa Mayor’s Office, where he has worked as the head of the information technology services for 4 years and 7 months. His wife is completing her studies at the university. Mr. R. is an honest, responsible person with a desire to get ahead personally and for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Carlos Alberto, casado, de 36 años de edad, con 2 hijos de 3 y 6 años que estudian primer grado y primer nivel de educación, con esfuerzo propio ha logrado levantar 4 paredes y comprar una parte del zinc para el techo de la que será su casa, con la solicitud de este primer crédito pretende comprar 30 láminas de zinc largo y pequeño, y los marcos de las puertas y ventanas. Para él es urgente este crédito porque quiere tener su propia casa para sus hijos y su esposa, ya que en la actualidad están habitando en la casa de un familiar de su esposa. Al momento sólo cuenta con su salario que deventa en la alcadia municipal de Juigalpa, como responsable del departamento de informática, con 4 años y 7 meses de servicio, su esposa está finalizando los estudios universitarios. El señor R. es una persona honesta, responsable, con deseos de superacion personal y familiar.

loans.use: Purchase zinc and window and door frames for his home

loans.name: Rosalpina

texts.es:
Ms. Rosalpina has worked at the Juigalpa’s City Hall for five years. She is a single mother with two children, one of which is a college student. The other daughter, married and with a child, lives with her. This woman is also responsible for the care of a 35 years old handicapped brother.

Ms. M. is requesting a loan to improve her house, more specifically to replace the kitchen roof and a partition in the living room, which is in bad shape and needs to be rebuilt with better materials. In this way, she hopes to provide greater comfort to her children, grandchild, son in law and the rest of the family.

She has used prior loans towards the same purpose, having installed electricity, drinking water and the first partition of the living room. As she is a single mother without any support, she will continue to give good use of loans to improve her home.

This woman is well liked amongst her coworkers, thanks to her honesty, responsibility and the good treatment she gives to all of those who ask for her help as human resources staff.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Rosalpina es trabajadora de la Alcaldía Municipal de Juigalpa, con 5 años de servicio; es madre soltera con 2 hijos, 1 estudiante universitario, y una hija que es casada y tiene una niña. Ambas habitan en casa de Rosalpina. Además esta señora tiene bajo su responsabilidad a un hermano discapacitado de 35 años.

La Sra. M. está solicitando un crédito para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, como cambiar el techo de su cocina y reemplazar una división que tiene en la sala, que está en mal estado, utilizando un material de mejor calidad, para de esa manera dar mayor comodidad a sus hijos, nieta, el esposo de su hija y resto de familia.

Los créditos anteriores también los utilizó para mejorar su vivienda, donde instaló energia eléctrica, agua potable y la primera división de su sala. Como es madre soltera, sin apoyo ninguno, continuará mejorando su vivienda con futuros créditos, porque siempre ha dado y seguirá dándole un buen uso a los créditos.

Esta señora es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo, gracias a su honestidad, responsabilidad y el buen trato que da a todas aquellas personas que le solicitan apoyo, como auxiliar de recursos humanos.

loans.use: Replace kitchen roof and living room partition.

loans.name: Maenudin

texts.en:
This is Maenudin, son of G.. He is a 29-year-old married man and now he lives in Ningarhar province. He is working as a farmer on his own land.
Maenudin is a credible person. He wants to buy seeds and improve his products, but he is poor and doesn’t have enough money on hand. He applied to AFSG for a 30,000 Afghanis loan to solve his problems and achieve his target. He will repay it in 18 months.

loans.use: To buy seeds for his land

loans.name: Abdul Qayom

texts.en:
Abdul Qayom, son of M. R., is a 48-year-old man. He is married and has 8 children. Now he is working in his own garden as a gardener in the Behsood district of Ningarhar province.
Abdul Qayom has 10 years work experience in this field. He wants to raise the current level of his income to solve his economic problems, so he needs to buy some stock and other necessary things. He applied to AFSG for 30,000 Afghanis loan and he will repay it in 24 months.

loans.use: To buy stock and plants

loans.name: Marculino Augusto

texts.en:
Marculino is 41 years old and originally from Manjacaze in the Gaza Province. Marculino is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. In addition to his immediate family, he also supports a nephew, who lives with him.

Marculino studied until 4th grade and had to stop due to his family’s difficult financial situation. In 1984 he moved to the capital city of Maputo to search for a job and worked first as a fisherman, and later at CFM, the Mozambican Railway Company. Marculino decided to move to Catembe, a fishing village that is a 10-minute ferry boat ride away from Maputo, as the cost of life was significantly lower than in the capital. He started working with commerce and has never stopped.

He has a small general store near Catembe’s central market, where he sells mainly food and basic needs products. He works daily from 8:30 am to 7:00 pm and relies on the help of his eldest daughter when she is not in school. Marculino’s most sold products are rice, sugar and cigarettes. He daily earnings range between MTn 1,500 to MTn 2,000, but he is still not saving as he has a large family to support.

Marculino is an old client of Hluvuku. This MTn 15,095 loan will be used to buy merchandise in large quantity and increase his stock. Marculino intends to buy mainly rice, sugar, oil and cigarettes. He hopes to attract more clients and increase his daily sales. In the future, Marculino would like to see his general store profits improve and, potentially, build a new store and offer many more products for his clients.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Albertina Alberto

texts.en:
Albertina is 46 years old and originally from the capital city of Maputo. She is married and supports 16 people, of which eight are her own children.

Albertina lived most of her life with her grandmother, helping with household duties when she was not studying or working at the family’s machamba, a small agricultural field. When Albertina married, her husband finished building their house in CaT., a fishing village that is a 10-minute ferry boat ride away from Maputo, where she still lives. Albertina worked for many years at CIMA, a manufacturing company that produces fishing nets. She quit because she became ill. After she was better, she started to sell products bought in the neighboring country of Swaziland. But the profits were insignificant so Albertina decided to change jobs again.

In 2000 she built a small restaurant at CaT.’s central market, where she sells prepared food and drinks. Albertina works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. She counts on the help of her eldest daughter whenever she has to be away from the business. Albertina’s daily income varies from MTn 500 to MTn 1,000, depending on the time of the month and the season. Her greatest difficulty is the clients that promise to pay at the end of the month and don’t. Albertina buys all her products in Maputo, and says that beer, wine and soda are her most profitable items for sale.

With this MTn 14,000 loan, Albertina intends to buy drinks to stock (beer, wine and soft drinks), and also raw material to cook, such as chicken, rice and oil. In the future Albertina would like to diversify the products offered to her clients and grow her business.

loans.use: Buy inventory and raw materials (drinks and food to cook)

loans.name: Emilia Jonas

texts.en:
Emilia is 36 years old and originally from Incassane in Catembe, a fishing village that is a 10-minute ferry boat ride away from the capital city of Maputo. Emilia is married and has two children: a 14-year-old daughter, and a 12-year-old boy, both of whom are in 7th grade.

Emilia grew up with her parents and when she was 11 years old she moved to Chamanculo, where she studied when she was not working at home. Her formal education ended at 6th grade.

Emilia lived a few years in South Africa, where her husband still lives. She decided to start selling products acquired there to her compatriots in Mozambique. Emilia sells curtains and clothes to her neighbors and has been quite successful. Curtains are the most successful product and are sold for amounts between MTn 250 and MTn 2,500, depending on the size and quality. Emilia is currently earning about MTn 5,000 per month and has a profit of up to MTn 1,000. Her husband sends her a monthly 2,000 Rands (approximately MTn 6,000) to help with the household expenses.

Emilia has received three previous loans from Hluvuku. The first two were used to start new a business, but the results were not satisfactory. Emilia decided to use the third loan to help speed up the construction of her house. She built a ditch at her house and improved the quality of sanitation of her family. With this fourth loan of MTn 15,000, Emilia plans on buying cement, sand, windows and doors to keep building her house.

In the future Emilia would like to be able to pay for her children’s schooling and see them graduate from university.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota is 38 years old and originally from Maxaquene, Maputo. Carlota is divorced and has five children: two girls and three boys, who are all full-time students, with the exception of her eldest daughter, who studies at night and works with Carlota during the day.

Carlota attended school up to the 8th grade. She lived with her parents until she was 17 years old and then she moved to South Africa, where she worked in a motorcycle manufacturing factory for three years. Carlota returned to Mozambique in 1990, when she married and started to sell used clothes. In 1993, when Carlota divorced, she started a beauty salon at her house and she began to sell food and basic needs items at a general store that she owned in one of Maputo’s markets. 

Carlota works at the store daily from 6:00 am to 6:30 pm; during the summer the store stays open until 8:00 pm. She buys all of her products at a large warehouse in the outskirts of the city and rents a car to transport them. Carlota employs her daughter at the store and pays her a monthly salary of MTn 1,200. The store's most productive days are Wednesdays and Thursdays, when she can make up to MTn 3,900 in one day. Carlota’s most lucrative items for sale are rice, pasta, oil, fish, chicken and milk. Her monthly profit from the store and the beauty salon ranges between MTn 7,500 and MTn 10,000. At the beauty salon, Carlota employs her daughter-in-law, paying her a monthly salary of MTn 1,500. 

This will be Carlota’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. She heard about Hluvuku through a friend and decided to apply to help her business grow. With the MTn 15,000 loan. Carlota intends to buy a significant amount of merchandise and increase her inventory. Carlota will buy rice, oil, milk, fish, chicken, juice, sodas, and pasta, among other things. 

In the future Carlota would like to open a warehouse, where she would sell in bulk to smaller stores. Such a business expansion would provide more local employment and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn K., 29, is a mother of four children and lives in the province of Kampong Cham. She is a farmer growing rice and yams. She makes $3.60 per day. Her husband (pictured with Mrs. Morn) works collecting recycling items in the village. Everyday he has to go around the village to purchase the recycling items and re-sell them to the recycling plant, earning around $7.50 in revenue per day.

This couple would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike and reserve money to purchase the recycling items in large amounts.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and reserve money to purchase recycling items in large amonts.

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Chey D., a fish seller earning around $3 per day, is married and lives with five children in Sneng Krabey Village, Kampong Thom Province. Her husband, Mr. Noun Vanna, is a fisherman who makes around $4 per day. Their children are young and attend school, so D. and her husband have a large responsibility supporting the family and paying the children’s school fees. In order to expand their businesses, D. seeks a loan to purchase more fish stocks as well as a boat for her husband’s fishing operation.

loans.use: To purchase more fish stocks and a boat  for her husband's fishing business.

loans.name: Chankosal Choy Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chankosal C. is the leader of a group of six members in Kosh Khtum Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a subsistence farmer and firewood seller, but neither of these two business activities supports his family adequately. His plantation has faced a drought and his last crop was not very good. As well, last year Mr. Chankosal C. experienced stomach problems and suffered from malaria, which cost him $200 for treatment. Therefore, he is seeking a loan to start a white wine production business in the village..

Mr. Chankosal C. is 36 and the father of two children, one of whom is enrolled in school while the other one is yet too young to attend. His wife, Mrs. Sophorn Keb, is a farmer. Two of the male group members are not presented in the picture. Their wives are pictured instead.

loans.use: To start a wine business.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en: H. Dilafruz is 28-years old. She is a widow with three children. Her oldest son is in school. Dilafruz is a market vendor. She is the only bread-winner in the family, and she works hard selling kids' clothing in the market. She has been in this business for 5 years. Dilafruz is requesting a loan of $800 so she can diversify her stock and have her wares satisfy the needs of people at various income levels. This will increase her customer base. Dilafruz's business is stable and allows her to keep her children and work for their future. She thanks all supporting her and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner as she has done with her previous loans.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing for upgrading stock

loans.name: Mehri

texts.en: K. Mehri is 48-years old. She is married and has an amazing daughter. Mehri is selling the undergarments and women's clothes. Her trading place is located in the one of the most famous markets, “Somon-bozor”, which is located in Kayrakkum town. Her husband is currently unemployed ,and Mehri has to work hard because she is the only source of income for her family. To increase the range of goods she can offer for the summer season, Mehri is requesting a loan for $600. There is no shortage of customers when the shelves are well-stocked. Mehri thanks everyone for support and promises to use the loan wisely.

loans.use: To purchase undergarments and women's clothes.

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: M. Malik is 54 years old. He is married and has three children. Malik’s wife is a housekeeper. Almost all of his children are married and have their own children except his younger son. Malik is working hard as he is the only bread-winner in the family. Already for 2 years he is selling the blankets and underclothes in the local market “Somon-bozor”.
